Summary: No it isnâ€™t across the street from Disneyland, but the breakfast is just what you need before hitting the park in the morning. I really appreciate that Marriott thinks about those of us with dairy allergies & have started offering almond milk at breakfast time. That has been so limiting for me when it is this type of breakfast. Just know because itâ€™s Disneyland none of the Marriott hotels offer 24 hr coffee in the lobby only at breakfast. The rooms are modern & clean. The sofa is comfortable to watch TV on. Our room was on the first floor & we loved not having to wait for the elevator. I watched the fireworks from the hotel one night. The walk-in closet is nice & the spacious bathroom is always a plus. As I mentioned we were on the bottom floor & I did not hear the people next
Manager Response: Hello Reneetravels2,   Thank you so much for taking the time to write us about your stay and giving us so much positive feedback. This not only helps our team but also for our future guests as well. We pride ourselves on having a welcoming and attentive team so I'm thrilled that we gave you a home away from home during your stay. We would love to have you back the next time you visit the parks with your Annual Pass!   Sincerely,   David Dumond Front Desk Supervisor

Summary Heading: Spacious and clean rooms with modern feel. Excellent breakfast. Easy parking. About 10-12 min walk to Downtown Disney.
Summary: I am a very hard to please, natural complainer and I had no complaints about this resort.  Staff friendly, room was ready on check in, Check out was a breeze. Everything went smoothly!  Parking: The parking is easy to get in and out of the lot. It is right outside the building and we were always able to find a spot.   Rooms: The rooms were spacious and clean and well appointed with extra plush pillows on the beds. Shower was awesome with great water pressure. There was a microwave and refrigerator, plastic utensils/plates/cups and a coffee maker. Certainly more than I would expect a hotel to provide. The pullout sofa was comfortable.  Breakfast: Scrambled eggs, yogurts, bananas, assorted cereals, oatmeal. Waffle station. Sausage or bacon or skillet potatoes each day on rotating
Manager Response: Hello savannah080808,   Wow thank you so much for the thorough and outstanding review. We and also our future guests thank you for telling us all about your stay. I'm glad that check in and check out were a breeze and that you enjoyed the rooms, breakfast and parking as well. I'm also glad that you had an easy time getting into the parks through the Downtown Disney Security access point. Give us a call the next time you're in the area. We'd love to have you back again.   Best,   David Dumond Front Desk Supervisor

Summary: easy walk to Downtown Disney and both parks. Breakfast was well done, selection changed a bit each morning. Bathroom was modern as well as beautiful. Loved having a couch and table area in room. Staff was welcoming. Bed was comfortable and the area was quiet.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed a week here while visiting Disneyland.  The staff were all very nice and always accommodating. Check in was easy and the breakfast staff were great. Housekeeping was fantastic, always left us with plenty of towels and toiletries and the room was very clean.  The breakfast buffet was just ok.  The scrambled eggs were not edible, watery with a weird texture. Not much variety so after a week we were pretty bored with the food.  This hotel is at the far end of Disneyland. Not much in the area; no restaurants or stores. Can be a bit difficult if you donâ€™t have a vehicle.  While we really enjoyed staying at the hotel because the room was very comfortable and clean unfortunately I donâ€™t think we would return do to the location.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel was clean, quiet, spacious rooms for family with good breakfast variety. 20-30 minute walk to Disneyland so we Ubered for $8 each way which was convenient to be dropped off at either Downtown Disney or at the front gate.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Check in was very fast and the room was very big, clean and comfortable. There was only two of us but the space was huge and the bed/pillows were extremely comfortable. Probably the only hotel in the world not to give me a bad back (but I understand that's personal preference!)  Breakfast was good: eggs, sausage/bacon (changed on a daily basis), spinach, cheese, bread & pastry, cereals, yogurts and waffles. Couldn't have wished for more and that was certainly a great way to start the day before the parks or meetings! Yes, it did get busy in the mornings (especially as we had a couple of schools in at the same time), but the staff worked tirelessly to keep everything clean and food replenished.  We also used the swimming pool which got the sun most of the day and a small gym room
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel has the best staff, breakfast was excellent every day, when a box went missing for an item to come home to Canada they found it. Felt like we were being treated like royalty!! Everytime we had a question or concern they were dealt with on the spot thank you so much for a fantastic stay!!! Will definitely stay again!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Rooms fit 5 big people...6 people if two or more of them are small children
Summary: This hotel was a great value and close to the Disney parks, which was our main destination. The staff was very helpful and it was very clean and updayed. The pool was nice, though the music was a little loud and we could hear it from our room, but we asked them to turn it down and they did. The free breakfast was very filling (waffles)!  We have a family of six, and three of our children are teenagers. We really needed something to sleep six people. The suite we got said it slept six, and had two queens and a pull out couch. We are fine with pullouts, but this one was TINY... Maybe just over twin size (full size)? Anyway, it honestly wouldn't fit two of my family members, so my 10-year-old ended up sleeping on the floor for six nights. I read reviews before we came about the
Manager Response: Hello mombug6, Thank you for staying with us on your recent trip to Anaheim and for taking the opportunity to share your feedback with us. Iâ€™m very glad to hear that felt our hotel offered a great value to you and your family while visiting Disneyland, and Thank You for your kind words regarding the cleanliness and staff at the hotel! I believe you occupied one of our Studio Suites with 2 Queen Beds and the pullout sofa (full), and Iâ€™m sorry to hear it did not accommodate your entire family. In the future we do also have One Bedroom Suites available that accommodate more (or bigger) people and give you the space to stretch out and relax while youâ€™re here. I hope youâ€™ll come back and experience one of those on your next visit, weâ€™d love to have you stay with us again!  Sincerely, Darrell Buettner General Manager

Summary: Stayed 3 nights here for Disneyland vacation.  Our flight arrived at 8 a.m. and hotel was nice enough to let us check in at 9 a.m.  Hotel room was very spacious and clean.  Very large bathroom, and huge closet.  Sitting area with TV , desk, and couch.  Tiny kitchenette with microwave, fridge and counter with coffee maker, paper plates, and utensils.  Comfortable beds. Lovely lounge area in front of hotel with table and chairs and fire pit.  Hotel is farther away from Disneyland but hotel offeres ART(Anaheim Resort Transit) for small fee, but we took an Uber each way for a mere $6-8 each way. Disneyland has Uber, Taxi, car drop off area located at park entrance.  Hotel is highly recommended.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: In town for a Christmas concert
Summary: Let me start off by saying we almost exclusively stay at one of the Marriot brand hotels when we travel and usually we're extremely happy .   To start before our departure I used the app. to request an early check in and room upgrade . App notification that there was an error and to try again later . After several tries I gave up and decided to call . When I called I was told they would notify me if either would be available . Needless to say I got neither an upgrade or an early a check nor did I hear back about my request .   Upon arrival after driving 3 hours thru rough holiday traffic we were checked in by a hateful member of the staff who couldn't find anything on my request.  It also appeared we were checking in at a shift change so we may have been a bother.  The room was
Manager Response: Hello P2701XGtimm, Thank you for staying with us on your recent visit to Anaheim and for taking the opportunity to share your honest feedback with us here. On behalf of our entire Team here at the hotel I would like to apologize for not providing the type of warm and welcoming service youâ€™ve come to know and expect when choosing Marriott. Our goal is to provide memorable experiences and exceed our guestsâ€™ expectations each and every time and I am truly sorry that we fell short of that during your visit with us. I have taken this opportunity to share your feedback with our Team to ensure we deliver on that promise in the future and hope that youâ€™ll come back to give us another opportunity next time you are traveling to the area. Thank you again for choosing our hotel, if I may be of any assistance in the future please feel free to contact me directly.   Thank you, Darrell Buettner General Manager

Summary: The is a great hotel for visitors to  Disneyland.  It is a short walk to  the park entrance or the parking structure a Disneyland where you can board the free Disney shuttle. The rooms are spacious and updated. The room was comfortable and clean and quiet. In addition to two queen beds there is a separate area with a desk and a couch and table and a microwave and coffee maker. The bathroom is nice size. The room has a large flat screen tv. that  can face the beds or the seating area. They offer a morning buffet breakfast which offered a nice selection of choices -  fresh fruit, juices, and beverages. A large selection of baked items (bagels, bread, danish, muffins, etc), yogurt. and you can also make your own waffles.  Cereal is also available.  They keep the food restocked as
Manager Response: none

Summary: Terrific place to stay prior to visiting the Disneyland the next day. Great location, only had to exit the property and make a quick right to enter Disneyland Drive. Check-in was flawless even at 10:30PM. The guest agent accommodated my request to be on the first floor and close to an exit, which made it great for going back to my vehicle to grab my belongings. parking lot is well lit and is monitored by cameras.Even though it is right next to Disneyland and you would expect high volume of foot traffic and room turnover, the property itself was in great shape and my guest room was immaculate. (modern, clean) and had all the standard amenities (fridge, microwave) that make a stay pleasant. The property offers a wonderful breakfast. A perfect way to start your day with a full day
Manager Response: none

Summary: We were pleased to be able to check in early after a long international flight. Room very comfortable and staff helpful and friendly. Free breakfast great. Close to Disneyland..we purchased tickets and shuttle ticket from the hotel which was easy.only downside no restaurant on site but you can purchase snacks to heat up in microwave in your room. Ideal for people wanting to visit Disneyland. Also booked a few day trips through front desk which were great and we were picked up from hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Nice place to stay in Temecula
Summary: We were only here for a day of Wine Tasting and stayed at the SpringHill Suites. Our rooms were modern, clean, with plenty of room and rates were very reasonable. The rooms had a mini refrigerator and microwave in each room.  The free morning Breakfast was very good with lots of selections. The Front Desk people were friendly and fast.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Nice Hotel 15 minutes Walk from Disney
Summary: This hotel ticks all the boxes - itâ€™s big, clean, 15 minutes walk from main gate and is really quiet. Breakfast is OK - pastries, cereal, a couple of hot options....front desk staff are really good, and you can leave your luggage if you need one more day in the parks!!  Overall - a really good start to our vacation, did exactly what we needed!!
Manager Response: Hi Trevor P,   We're really glad that you chose to stay at our property for your vacation. Thank you so much for taking some time to not only tell us about your stay but also our future guests. I'm thrilled that we were able to provide you with a home away from home and that you had such a great start to your vacation. We would love to host you the next time you are in Anaheim or looking to plan another trip.   Best,   David Dumond

Summary: This is a great option, if you want to be close to the park. It's within walking distance (took about 10-15 minutes) to the tram. It's nothing fancy, but has relatively good rates, clean, decent free breakfast, which was all I was looking for on my recent trip.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Our stay at the Springhill suites in Anaheim was terrific. This hotel is very near the park yet still had great rates and very spacious rooms. This hotel is clean, well lit and very tastefully decorated.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great hotel, really friendly staff and helpful. I personally didnâ€™t eat much of the breakfast ( not a morning person) but my husband said it was pretty good food. Not much change between the days though, We stayed 11 days too.  Loved the water pressure in the shower, and liked the design of the rooms. However didnâ€™t like how you could almost make out what people were talking about in the next room when it was quiet...
Manager Response: none

Summary: Nice new hotel close to Disneyland. New everything and good location. You can walk to the park, but it is a hike of about 20 minutes. Parking is $15.00 for your car, which is less than parking at the garage.Their is a bus that picks up at the hotel for a small fee. Location is on the north end of the Disney property, which is opposite from most of the other hotels. Nice area and police patrol S Walnut street on a bike.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Brand new, nice and good for Disney Park visits,  but some drawbacks
Summary: Nice new hotel in walking distance to Disney Tram.  Strange State of California Warning Signs at all entrances, stating the building is containing chemicals, potentially causing cancer is not really appealing.  The rooms are a little tiny and the couch area quickly turned into a luggage area. Fridge was ok size wise, as the room had no kitchenette anyway. Shower more torture than pleasure, shower head not adjustable, shoots out thin jets under high pressure, making u want to get  over with your morning shower quickly. Very odd for a brand new hotel, bad design.  Only one choice of breakfast toast, unfortunately a super dry wheat with hard to chew grains, had to buy our own, as my son even refused to eat it. One toaster only, for a hotel mainly dealing with guests heading to the
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Huge suites, friendly staff, and reasonable walk to Disney's entrance
Summary: We couldn't stand the thought of paying such a high premium to stay at a Disney property, so found SpringHill Suites. Boy were we glad! It is a 10-12 minute walk to Disney downtown and then another 5 minutes to the main gate. The staff is friendly and very helpful. The lobby and rooms were very clean and our suite was huge! One room had two queen beds and a desk/study area. The other room had a sleeper sofa and kitchenette. The beds were very comfortable. There's a small pool that looks nice, but that's not why you're there, right? We were lured by the free breakfast, which was pretty blah, and is the reason for the 4 stars instead of 5. Still it was substantial enough to get us through a long day at Disney.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: This place is a diamond in the rough!
Summary: I LOVE this placem. Everyone wants to stay on the other side of Disneylabd, but this place is not that long of a walk. It is extremely affordable, very clean, and the staff is stellar. I highly recommend this place over every other hotel near Disneyland. Great value, extremely convenient.  The only negative I can think of was that the dryers were having issues. I think they need an extra laundry room, or maybe they can expand the current facility.  No other complaints at all. Oh, and the breakfast is awesome!! Well worth it for the six days we spent there. Home away from home.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stayed here from August 17-19 2018. I called a few days prior to see if I could get some balloons in the room for my boyfriends birthday. I was willing to pay the extra money for it. Unfortunately they said unless I got them myself they couldnâ€™t provide them. But Gladys in front desk told me she could do a banner and a goody bag. That was great and I was happy she suggested it. I tried checking in early but my room wasnâ€™t ready. Which wasnâ€™t a problem at all. When I came back the gentleman David checked me in. And waived my parking fee. Which is amazing!! I thanked him and went to my room. My Bf opened the room and right in front was a huge banner saying happy birthday with Disney characters which was amazing. Since the trip was for Disneyland to celebrate his birthday.
Manager Response: Hey lupeflores1290,   It was such a pleasure celebrating with you! Thank you so much for taking the time share your experience with all of us, it means the world to us hear at Springhill Suites. We would love to have you back and celebrating with us again soon. I'm glad we were able to give you a little extra magic on your boyfriend's birthday. We'll see you again soon!

Summary: We stay here every time we go to Disneyland. The Disney parking structure is right behind the hotel, so we just walk to the trams and ride those to the park entrance. Breakfast is goodâ€”Eggs, bacon, cereal, waffles, fruit, yogurt, etc. Housekeeping does an amazing job and the beds are super comfortable. Love how spacious our rooms are. The decor of the hotel is pretty cool. The front staff is nice and very helpful. We always have good water pressure and plenty of hot water. Their system was rejecting cards for everyone the afternoon we checked in and they gave us some treats to make up for it. Great place.
Manager Response: Hi Lillybean5,   Thank you so much for taking the time to give us some feedback about your stay with us! I'm really glad to hear that you had such a fantastic stay with us and took advantage of our convenient location. One of the most important parts of a vacation is a great nights sleep and it sounds like we exceeded your expectations in that department. We would love to see you back the next time you're doing a Disney trip or just visiting the Anaheim area.

Summary Heading: not for the buisness traveler better for family
Summary: Had occasion to stay at this hotel for business in the area, room was nice, spacious and well designed and parking was very crowded. Front desk staff was nice and very helpful. many kids wandering aournd hotel in evening without adult.breakfast was a madhouse with all the kids running around and parents letting them run loose. I opted for breakfast elsewhere. Even when the kids are with me, they are not this out of control. the location was close to plenty of stores and food options and it was easy to find, not far form the freeway.
Manager Response: Hello seasunsounds, Thank you for staying with us on your recent visit to Anaheim and for taking the time to post your honest feedback about your experience. I appreciate your kind words regarding our staff and Iâ€™m happy to hear that you enjoyed your spacious suite! I apologize that morning crowds prevented you from enjoying our delicious complimentary breakfast during your stay, I hope youâ€™ll come back and stay with us again (and bring the family!) so you can enjoy it on your next visit. Thank you again for staying with us.  Sincerely, Darrell Buettner General Manager

Summary Heading: Lots of integrity and very flexible!
Summary: Wow! We had an awesome experience. Greeting by friendly and patient Joy who was informative right away. We had a few last minute changes and she was very flexible with us. She understood our situation and she worked with us so that it wouldn't cost an arm and a leg to shorten our time there. And she gave a few suggestions that really worked for our plans. They were really there to help us and I didn't feel the tired of dealing with people vibe that you see at a lot of other hotels.  The rooms are stocked and clean, and they have all the info you need in there so you don't need to call down if you don't want to.   The next morning the breakfast staff was working furiously to keep everything clean and stocked, while the desk staff were working quickly to keep things going. It was
Manager Response: none

Summary: The hotel itself is clean, new and modern. The staff is phenomenal. I received the most amazing customer service for the duration of our stay. The only complaint is the eggs that they serve at breakfast. Theyâ€™re not good. Everything else is. This hotel is short walk to Downtown Disney and the park. We purchased ART passes but honestly, we walked most days. It took 10 minutes and itâ€™s a nice walk. Also, you can view the fireworks from the outside sitting area!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Quiet location with modern and comfortable rooms!
Summary: I stayed here recently and was not disappointed. It wasn't really within walking distance to Disneyland, but that's ok! I didn't want to walk because of all the walking I knew I would be doing in the park. The hotel does have a shuttle/bus that stops to pick up people to take them to the park; however, you have to buy tickets in advance from the front desk. The room was great. My favorite part was the nice shower. It was modern and not a bathtub/shower combo. The bed was comfortable, too. The hotel offers a full breakfast and there were plenty of hot and cold items to choose from.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This was a really awesome hotel. Our flight got in ridiculously early and they held our bags while we went to Downtown Disney. They even let us check in a couple hours early.  The beds were comfy and the room (a suite) was spacious and clean. I was a bit surprised by the carpet in the rooms. Since this a new hotel I sort of assumed there would be no carpet in the rooms. Of course, said carpet looked a little worse for the wear but otherwise it was a great room. Water pressure in the shower is no joke so if you have little ones consider giving them a bath and bring a cup for rinsing.  The breakfast was plentiful but if you arrive late in the morning during summer rush just pretend you are at the parks because there are lines for everything. All the staff we encountered were very
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: A fine place to stay near Disney
Summary: We stayed here a week and used it as a base camp for adventures all over Southern California.  Get the not-great out of the way first: There may be rooms mentioned in other reviews that have great views and ability to see fireworks, but not ours. We did get to hear them every night, along with the car alarms that they set off!  The air conditioning in our room had two options: Off, and hotter then the lowest layer of the 7 Dwarves mine, or On, and cold enough to store Walt Disney's cryogenically-frozen head. There was simply no in between. I like my room cold, but even I had a really hard time with the AC.  As far as the great, the staff was wonderful all week. The ART line to the park was a great way to get there without wearing out the kid's legs with the walk. If the weather
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is the fourth different hotel we've tried for Disneyland trips and so far our family's favorite. The rooms offer plenty of space to handle five people comfortably. Our room had a great view of the park, including the new Star Wars area being built and the fireworks show each night. The rooms were very clean and the breakfast was much better than we expected. We appreciated the large lobby where breakfast was served so it didn't feel cramped and crowded as other Marriott properties in the area. The pool is a decent size and was a great escape from the daily Disney grind.  The only negative, which was minor, is that the toilet is not separated from the rest of the bathroom making it difficult to share with a handful of people trying to get ready in the mornings. Overall, it
Manager Response: Hey Mark R,   Thank you so much for taking the time to tell us about your stay with us. I'm glad that after three other hotels, you finally found us! I'm also really glad that you enjoyed the firework views from our rooms and the breakfast as well. Pool days are definitely a necessity during a packed Disney trip. It's fantastic to hear that we exceeded your expectations during your stay and we'd love to see you again soon! Thank you again for taking time out of your day to give us feedback about your stay.   David Dumond Front Desk Supervisor

Summary: The hotel is well-maintained, rooms are clean, and staff couldn't have been nicer. The real selling point to staying here is the convenience to Disneyland, especially the fact that ART #11 picks up and drops off right in the hotel's parking lot and takes you right to the front entrance to the park. A 1-day pass is $5.50 - hard to beat the price and convenience.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We brought our son and his future wife, along with our daughter and our sister for a visit. The place was roomy and very clean. We enjoyed a very nice team working very well together to do all they could to make our trip pleasant. I am not sure there was anything else they could have done to make it any better than it was. We look for cleanliness, friendliness and comfort. We got ALL this at a nice price. Thank you and we will be back!!!
Manager Response: Hi Teri A,   Thank you so much for taking the time to tell us about your stay with us. I'm so glad that you all enjoyed your time here with us. We're all glad to be a part of a special memory for you. One of our biggest goals at Springhill Suites Anaheim Maingate is to provide you with exceptional service and it's great to hear that you had a great stay. Your son, his future wife, your daughter, your sister and you are welcome back anytime. We look forward to seeing you again soon!   David Dumond Front Desk Supervisor

Summary: The room was good but the A/C was so loud at night. Breakfast was good but the same. Saved us money so it didnâ€™t bother us. About a 20 minute walk to Disney.   My only issue was the credit card hold. The first day I was charged an extra $100. Then the next day it was and extra $80. They took off the $100 and the $80 but it wasnâ€™t returned right away. After the $80 I put a hold on my card. I received multiple emails a day from Capital One that Springhill Suites was trying to charge more money...$60, $40,etc. The front desk staff couldnâ€™t explain it or help. I wasnâ€™t able to use that card for our trip which stunk. The day we left was when my money was returned.
Manager Response: Hello tia9489, Thank you for staying with us on your recent visit to Anaheim and for taking the opportunity to share your feedback with us here. I apologize for the billing error with the duplicate authorizations to your credit card and understand how this situation could affect your ability to fully enjoy your stay with us. We do authorize all credit cards at time of check in to cover the anticipated charges of room and tax plus an additional $20 per day, with any unused funds being returned back your card at the time of check out. I have shared your feedback with our Team to ensure that we are only holding the appropriate level of funds for each guest to prevent this from happening in the future. I do hope that you enjoyed your visit in Anaheim and hope to have the opportunity to serve you again next time you are in the area.  Sincerely, Darrell Buettner General Manager

Summary: We were a 3 generation family going to Disneyland (3 rooms). A 17 minute walk to Disneyland. We also used the ART bus. Bus tickets were sold at the hotel desk. We were greeted by an amazing front desk staff. We were informed of all the hotel amenities (pool , breakfast, laundry & distance to Disneyland) The rooms were SPOTLESS. There was something for each of us at breakfast and great coffee to start the day. Top floor quiet, other family found floor 1 noisy, due to proximity of the pool. We will certainly stay here again and have recommended it to our Canadian friends heading to Disneyland. All hotels should inspire  to provide this  kind ofservice. THANK-YOU for being part of making our vacation amazing
Manager Response: Hello  _srig4,   Thank you so much for taking your family here to Anaheim to visit. It makes us all so happy to hear that you had such an exemplary stay with us at Springhill Suites Anaheim Maingate. It is always our goal to make your stay magical and for you to feel like you are at home so I'm glad that our front desk staff and spotless rooms were able to bring that to life during your visit. Also, thank you so much for taking some time to tell us about your experience with us and we look forward to seeing you again when you are in the area! We'll also keep an eye out for your Canadian friends!  David Dumond Front Desk Supervisor

Summary: The SpringHill Suites follows the same format as all the brandâ€™s hotels do. The rooms are spacious and new with modern bathrooms and functional furnishings. The beds are good but not luxurious. Breakfast is served everyday and has something for most people. There is a small shop that has beverages and snacks that you can charge to your room. There is a small fitness gym. Parking here is for fee but is $5 a day which can not be beat in this area. It is about 7/10 of a mile to Downtown Disney and a short walk further to the gates for Disneyland and California Adventure. They also have a shuttle that runs frequently to the parks but I believe there is a small fee. The staff here was more friendly than most I have encountered in other SpringHill Suites. Prices were reasonable too.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Close to Disneyland (you could walk if you really wanted to but we took the ART bus which was very convenient and good value) this hotel was ideal for our Disneyland holiday.  The staff were so obliging from an early checkin for us to helping us hire a stroller and then holding our bags and letting us enjoy the pool after checkout because we had a nighttime flight.  You wonâ€™t go wrong with this hotel. Breakfast is free and is fine. There is sufficient choice although no herbal tea but that is not a big deal.  We had a ball and our 5yo told me this morning that â€œSpring Hill is her favourite hillâ€.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Hey, these guys read the manual on customer service. They are very friendly and accomodating staff. They let us have an early check in. They received and stored our grocery delivery until we got back to the hotel. The front desk staff recommended the ART for visiting Disneyland. The rooms are nice and clean, the breakfasts are great, and the staff goes above and beyond.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for Disneyland
Summary: My wife and I stayed here when meeting some friends at Disneyland. The hotel is about 1 mile from the gate, so it is a bit of a walk, but not too bad. The hotel was clean and quiet. We enjoyed our stay and would stay again. That said, it wasn't really anything special for a SpringHill Suites, so I felt a 4/5 was a reasonable rating. Not that they did anything wrong, just nothing exceptional either.
Manager Response: Hi Ryan M,   Thanks for taking the time to give us some feedback, we really appreciate it! I'm glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay and I hope that you enjoyed your time at Disneyland as well. I look forward to seeing you again the next time you stay in the Anaheim area!  David Dumond Front Desk Supervisor

Summary: Just checkout from the hotel after 5 days of wonderful stay. We spent 3 days at Disneyland, there is a shuttle that picks up from the hotel entrance which is very convenient with young kids which whom you don't wanna get tired by walking to the Disneyland, which is about 15 minutes walk ( you enter thru the disney downtown entrance). First day of the ride of the shuttle, we didn't know that hotel actually sells bus pass, bus driver mentioned that and we just bought that the next day. Otherwise, you.would need to carry exact dollar bills as thry don't take coins or credit card. As for the stay at the hotel, you never go wrong with springhill suits. We arrived at LAX little late as our flight was delayed, i called the hotel around 11:45PM to make sure our reservation doesn't get
Manager Response: Hello mshah2015,        First of all thank you so much for taking the time to provide us with such a great review. We're so happy that you enjoyed your week long Disney trip and stay with us. Thanks for providing some advice for the ART shuttle service to some of our future guests. It is always nice to have some first hand experience.             Again, I appreciate you taking the time and we look forward to seeing you again soon when you visit the Anaheim area!  David Dumond Front Desk Supervisor

Summary Heading: Good quality hotel close to the Disneyland Parks entrances
Summary: We stayed for one night at the Springhill Suites after a day at the Disneyland parks. Luckily on arrival that morning we were informed that there were rooms available, so we were able to check in immediately. The staff on reception were very friendly and helpful, pointing out to us how to walk to Disney and the different transport options available. The walk to the parks takes about 20 mins in total, with 10 mins to get to Downtown Disney and another 10 mins to walk through to the parks.   The room was very large with very comfortable Queen beds. Lots of towels and toiletries were provided, as well as a tea and coffee machine and a big TV. The only negative is that herbal tea options aren't available, and the hotel has no facilities to make these otherwise as there isn't a bar.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We arrived at the hotel at 8 am on a Saturday expecting to just park our car and walk to Disneyland, however Gladys said a room was available and she could upgrade us to a king suite!  We were very pleased!  She gave us walking directions to disneyland which is about a 15 min easy walk.  The room was very nice and upgraded and very quiet.  The breakfast was great as well.  We would stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We had an amazing stay. We have stayed here twice now and LOVE it!! All the employees are super helpful and nice. We had an issue with something in our room, and it was taken care of in less than 10 minutes. The breakfast buffet is typical, but it is nice to have some decent food before heading to Disneyland! Anything I asked for (because they ran out) was restocked immediately. Our room was comfy and clean. It was worth the walk to stay here. We will stay here again on our next Disney vacation!!
Manager Response: none

Summary: What an awesome hotel. People are helpful and friendly. Close to Disneyland (15 min walk) or take the shuttle bus 11. Highly recommend. Clean, great outdoor fire area with couches etc. We will return here. Xxxooo
Manager Response: none

Summary: A place to stay off the beaten path but close to Disney Parks, that includes breakfast. A clean room and a separate sitting area. All our requests were checked off. Gladys at the desk was able to check us in early (as I used the easy app to request an early check in, and the app has to be easy for me to use it). After a typical frustrating drive through LA, it was nice to be able to bring things up to room, freshen up and then head out to Disney Parks. Gladys told us about the Anaheim Rapid Transit (ART) that picked up at the door , was. VERY reasonably priced and with the pleasant driver, we got to the park in no time. We were able to walk back to the hotel in the late evening, not a long walk at all for these 60 something folks. Breakfast was very nice for a little Buffet ,
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Train your check in staff to use "the system" correctly
Summary: Travelled there from 3 - 7th January 2018. Had prepaid (through travel agent) a 4 night stay for 2 double queen rooms. Hotel policy required a credit card to hold $20 per night for incidentals. That was fine. My husband gave them his credit card. My adult daughter's room was ready so we put all our bags in there. We waited until 2.30pm for our room to be ready, but it wasn't, so we left. My husband went with his friend. Upon returning to the room, my daughter said she would check in for me as I was exhausted.  My daughter was told she had to use her card for the $20/night for incidentals. She asked why they couldn't use her father's card details and was informed that he had to be there. She then authorised them to hold $20 only because this card contained all her spending money.
Manager Response: Hello D D, Thank you for staying with us on your recent visit to Anaheim and for taking a moment to share your feedback with us. First, I would like to take the opportunity to apologize for the billing error that created this issue to begin with. Our goal is to ensure the billing accuracy of each of our guests and we understand how failing to do so can severely affect our guestsâ€™ ability to maximize and enjoy their time while on vacation. On behalf of my entire Team, I sincerely apologize for the mistake. I will certainly take this opportunity to share your feedback with my Team to ensure this is corrected moving forward, and in the rare event that an error is made that we are dedicating the appropriate attention to get it rectified. Again, I would like to thank you for choosing our hotel and hope that you will consider giving us a chance to redeem ourselves next time you are traveling to the area. If I can be of any assistance to you in the future, please feel free to contact me directly. Thank you. Sincerely, Darrell Buettner General Manager

Summary: It was good. ... The room was big enough and the bus shuttle going to Disney was good too. ... Breakfast was nice but not enough tables and chairs to accommodate all. ... The room was big enough and it was clean. ...
Manager Response: Hello Phia V, Thank you for staying with us on your recent visit to Anaheim and for sharing your feedback on your experience with us here on TripAdvisor. Iâ€™m glad to hear that you enjoyed the space and cleanliness of our guest rooms during your stay with us! And yes our breakfast can get quite busy in the mornings, Iâ€™m sorry hear that there wasnâ€™t enough seating to accommodate you. We have recently added some additional seating on the patio adjacent to the breakfast room to help improve this for our guests and accommodate more guests. I hope that you enjoyed your time here in Anaheim and at the Parks and that youâ€™ll come back and stay with us again next time you visit the area. Thank you again for choosing our hotel! Sincerely, Darrell Buettner General Manager

Summary: Our team really enjoyed our stay at SpringHill. The rooms were clean and the staff were very friendly and helpful. The first class accommodations matched our first place team finish. Thank you for making this a team trip to remember!
Manager Response: none

Summary: My wife and I arrived here yesterday for an overnight stay before joining a Cruise Ship. We were greeted by David and Tyler who were amazing, giving us above and beyond service, a credit to the hotel, making two very tired travellers feel welcomed.the room is amazing, light, roomy, great bathroom and amazing bed, lots of zzzzzzzzzs. We have just had the breakfast which is included in the room price, what can I say, weâ€™ll yet again amazing, one of the best breakfasts we have ever had, in the USA feeling stuffed!!!!! During breakfast we had a lovely conversation with another member of staff Cindy, who was lovely and most helpful. We also were greeted by so many other members of the team, this hotel and its management are truly blessed to have the exemplary staff they have. This is
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed 4 nights in this hotel while visiting Disneyland. It is close to the Disney parking garage, so it should only be a 10-15 minute walk to the trams into the park. The parking is $15, but we booked through an agency and got free parking.  The free breakfast is adequate, but nothing spectacular. The rooms have space. 2 queens or 1 king bed with a sofa bed. Fit our family of 5. The pool and hot tub were nice. The service was friendly I would stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Iâ€™m here now. Room wasnâ€™t ready on time. It was 300p at check in and I requested 1pm so they had 2 extra hours! So they switched rooms. As a gold member I asked if there were any upgrades. I was told yes that I was upgraded to a one bedroom. When getting to my room, it wasnâ€™t an upgrade.  Also Iâ€™ve never been in a Springhill Suites that didnâ€™t have two TVs. The one in the sitting area is too far from the bed nearest the window.  Donâ€™t stay at this Springhill Suites in Anaheim. They donâ€™t know what theyâ€™re doing. Really after Iâ€™m unpacked and checked in after a long drive Iâ€™m not going to go complain to the front desk.
Manager Response: Hello BurningSnow, Thank you for staying with us on your current visit to Anaheim and for taking the time to share your feedback with us here on TripAdvisor. I am terribly sorry to hear about the issues you had at check in and having your room ready. Our goal is to have our guestâ€™s rooms ready and available by 3:00pm check in time daily and do our absolute best to accommodate all requests including room upgrades when available. I apologize we fell short of this goal in your instance and understand how this would be frustrating after a long day of traveling. If you have the opportunity to see this please feel free to contact me, I would love to understand more about the situation and how we can make it up to you. I hope that your stay with us in Anaheim is pleasant and would love the chance to earn your business again in the future. Sincerely, Darrell Buettner General Manager

Summary: I loved staying in the Springhill Suites.  The rooms are super clean and nicely decorated.  It was very pleasant to come back to after a long day in the parks.  It's an easy walk to Disney, about 15 minutes.  There is also a city bus that picks up right in front of the hotel.  The free breakfast is much better than most hotel breakfasts, including sausage hash, scrambled eggs with salsa, good bacon, waffles, fruit and pastries.  The staff was excellent.  The fire pit and pool were relaxing.  I would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Family of 4 adults. Our room was perfect. Free breakfast and was a very good selection of breakfast.  Ubered from airport and to knottsberry farms. Walking distance to Disney.  Staff was great and very informative. Housekeeping did a phenomenal job - thank you! Will def stay here if we visit again
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here for our first trip to Disney! The staff were friendly and helpful, it was within walking distance to downtown Disney but had shuttles available - $1 for kids $3 for adults per day. We used these, as by the end of the night it was tough to walk with the kids. The breakfast buffet was perfect and had many options for everyone. Everyone filled up before heading out. We took advantage of the heated pool and hot tub. It was a super clean - we picked up extra milk and bread from the gas station next door for those late night snacks!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We liked this hotel. We had teens who can walk so the extra walking was doable. It is about 15-20 mins. Convenient gas station next door, has the extras you may want need. The closest restaurant is in the nearby Holiday Inn called Onyx. It was good. Wish there was a grocery store or at least a couple of options for eating/restaurants nearby. It should not be called Maingate as it is really not Compared to our several other stays near Disneyland. The staff were very friendly, cleaning staff were efficient and did little extras that we appreciated. The breakfast is included but can get stagnant after a week but still adequate and there was usually enough food as the ladies kept busy keeping the trays full. I would go back to this hotel in future.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed in this hotel last week during our family's Disneyland vacation. The hotel is around the corner from the Downtown Disney parking lot (and the back end of Downtown Disney), which made it about a 10-15 minute walk getting to/from the park. Overall, we were satisfied with our stay here. We had a room with two queen beds and a pull-out sofa, which was comfortable for our family of five.   They offer a complimentary breakfast, which included a rotating menu of hashbrowns with sausage, sausage patties, or bacon as well as daily offerings of eggs, waffles, and cold items. The staff members were friendly and the hotel appeared clean. We were also able to see the Disneyland fireworks from our hotel room, which was an added bonus.   The only issue that we had during our stay was
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Charged my husband $580 on credit card by mistake!!
Summary: Myself, my husband and my daughter stayed here December 11th - 15th 2017.  Hotel is nice, not what I would consider walking distance to the park but we ubered everyday so this was no problem.  I knew this coming in.  There is also the ART shuttle that goes to Disneyland that stops right in front of the hotel.  We stayed here only because our travel agent got us a fantastic deal, and I am really not too picky where I stay in Anaheim as I will be mainly in the parks and only at the hotel for sleeping.  Beds are firm but decent.  Pull out couch my daughter said wasnt that great, but again, not really a problem.  "free wifi" SUCKED.  I could barely even use my data in my room, service in our room was that horrible.  I had to go in to the lobby to get an uber.  If you want "better"
Manager Response: Hello redvancity, Thank you for staying with us on your recent visit to Anaheim and for taking a moment to share your experience with us. I am very sorry to hear about the billing error for your reservations, and completely understand your frustration with this situation. I was able to verify that billing issue was corrected after you spoke to a member of my Team and that that credit was issued back to your husbandâ€™s card. Again I do apologize for the error on behalf of the entire Team here at the hotel, our goal is to ensure accurate billing for all of our guests and have unfortunately fallen short of that in this instance. I would love the opportunity to make this up to you on your next visit to Anaheim and redeem ourselves to you. Please feel free to contact me directly if I can be of assistance to helping you on your next visit to Anaheim.  Sincerely, Darrell Buettner General Manager

Summary: The room was comfortable, we were in a good spot where we could see the fire works from our room. Our kids liked the extra effort put into the decorating there beds with our kids special blankets. We didn't have any issues. We walked to the park every day took about 20 min. The only down fall is there was there was no grocery close to the hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We were excied to be in a newer hotel. Pros: pretty lobby. Beds comfortable. Nice walk in shower. Ok free breakfast. Cons:was charged for an extra night. Had a difficult time getting reimbursed for the money.All desk people were new and Night manager put me on hold for a VIP guest three times hurt my while trying to resolve charges.Nothing to warrant the the good reviews that made me book. We will go elsewhere next time.
Manager Response: Hello travelingmom17, Thank you for staying with us on your recent visit to Anaheim and for sharing your feedback with us on your experience. While I was happy to hear that you liked our facilities and our comfortable beds, I am sorry to hear about the billing issues and the difficulty in getting that resolved. We strive to ensure that each guest is provided a memorable experience at our hotel, I apologize for the issues you encountered and understand how that could leave a negative impression with you. Please feel free to contact me directly if the billing issue has not been resolved to your satisfaction and I will be happy to look into this matter for you directly. We hope that weâ€™ll have the opportunity to have you as a guest again in the future. Thank you again for staying with us. Sincerely, Darrell Buettner General Manager

Summary Heading: Hotels is ok, breakfast is good
Summary: The hotel itself was fine.  Nothing was outstanding except the nightly cookies.  The breakfast was good with many hot choices.  The walking distance to Disneyland is about 20 minutes and not too fun with young children.  The bus option is $5/per person per day.  That adds up, as does the parking fee for the car at the hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Hotel was good. Room was nice and spacious! Free breakfast was ok. Would have like to see more fresh fruit and it would be nice if coffee and tea were available ALL day, like other hotels we have stayed at. Also trays for food, so you can take things to your room. After 10 am you are out of luck, Everything is gone. The gas station next door has coffee but itâ€™s not great. This hotel has NOTHING around it, It is on the back side of the park and has no restaurants nearby. It is walking distance for adults to the park and downtown Disney. Little kids will not want to walk this far after a day at the park. There is a shuttle for a fee and it came every 30mins, we ended up using this.  If you donâ€™t mind the extra walk, or not having any amenities near by, This is a nice hotel but I
Manager Response: Hi Courtney L, Thank you for staying with us on your recent visit to Anaheim and for taking a moment to share your experience with us here on TripAdvisor. Iâ€™m glad that you liked our hotel and that you enjoyed our spacious suites during your stay with us, but Iâ€™m sorry to hear that it was not as conveniently located as you had hoped for. As you mentioned, DownTown Disney is just a 10 minute walk from the hotel and has multiple options for dining and shopping, we also keep a variety of menus and recommendations for delivery options in case you want to stay in and food delivered after a long day at the Parks. I hope that youâ€™ll consider coming back and staying with us again, weâ€™d love to have you back!  Sincerely, Darrell Buettner General Manager

Summary: We had a studio king room and wow it was wonderful.  So clear fresh great size bathroom the bed was so comfortable, nice to have a separate seating area.  It was so close to disneyland just a short walk to downtown.  Can see the nightly fireworks a bonus.   Breakfast was included nice, great waffle  machine.  Catch coaches to all the top places. Friendly staff most helpful.  Very happy would go back
Manager Response: none

Summary: Kind-a close to Disneyland. We walked, but it is a little far for small kids. Jose at the desk was really great. We arrived at 1 am with no reservation. He was able to get us a couple of rooms, and match online pricing. Room to room was pretty quiet, but the noise from the upstairs rooms was really loud. I could hear every footstep. Maybe it would have been better if we were on the very top floor. Breakfast was decent for the kids, but the coffee was terrible.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Had an awesome week-long stay in September.    The check in process was super fast and seamless.  The front desk clerk (I forgot his name) was great.  Really nice guy.  We had a 2 Queen and Sofa-Bed suite which was really nice.  The beds are very comfortable.  The sofa was also comfortable.  The throw pillows and cushions was a little dirty with a few spots/stains here and there, but nothing too bad, we just put a sheet over it.  In all honesty, the sofa itself was a lot more comfortable than the bed it gets turned into.  When the bed is pulled out, it's also very noisy and squeaks with every movement, so halfway through our stay we just kept it as a sofa and slept on that.    The layout of the room is a little strange.  The desk and a glass window separates the living area from
Manager Response: none

Summary: Booked the multi bed room with family including our 2 20 something daughters. Pull out couch was handy but maybe not the most comfortable. Fridge and microwave were great! large walk in closet and plenty of drawer space plus a desk area. Great view of fireworks out our window every night(can't see from the pool if you wanted to view there). You can walk  to Disney but we chose to pay $5.50 I think for the shuttle that will take you right to gates as much as you want for the day. Came every 20 minutes or so. Pool was adequate and hot tub good but could use to stay open later. After a full park day it would be nice to enjoy without rushing or getting kicked out. Breakfast was great but did get monotonous after a few days will admit. Waffles, scrambled eggs, hash browns of some
Manager Response: none

Summary: We had an incredible experience here at the Springhill Suites. Staff was incredibly helpful and caring. The hotel is about a mile from Disneyland. There is bus stop right outside of the hotel which is very convenient.  I would definitely stay at this hotel next time I visit Disneyland :)
Manager Response: none

Summary: Don't be fooled by the "Maingate" name. It is not, by any stretch of the imagination.... The confusion in the reviews arises from the fact that there are two (2) Springhill Suites Hotels. One might indeed be a 10-minute walk from the main entrance: the SpringHill Suite Resort Area, 1801 S Harbor Blvd.  We stayed 3 nights at the one on W. Ball Road (the "-pring---- Suites"), with our children and grandson. Count on a good 35 to 40 minute walk to get to the entrance, for us, mobile seniors.  The hotel is fine. It's clean, new and affordable. Beds are very comfortable. Room and bathroom layouts adequate (funky shower door opens in an awkward direction; same with the closet door). The suite our children stayed in was gigantic.   The staff is terrific. Friendly, efficient and
Manager Response: Hi jpviel, Thank you for staying with us on your recent visit to Anaheim and for taking a moment to share your experience with us. I am glad to hear that our spacious suites gave you and the family plenty of room and that you enjoyed our comfortable beds and friendly staff! I apologize that our location was not as convenient as you had hoped for and that this impacted your stay with us. We do have additional recommendations on alternatives to the gas station convenience store that are within 1 mile from the hotel that have more options, I apologize if we did not present those to you while you were with us. I do hope that you and your family enjoyed your time here in Anaheim and hope that you will consider our hotel again in the future. Thank you again for staying with us. Sincerely, Darrell Buettner General Manager

Summary: We stayed here for our Disney vacation. The walking distance wasn't bad at all. Most of the staff was extremely friendly.  I wish I would've taken a picture of the room to share. We stayed in a 2 bed room with a pullout twin bed in the sectional couch as well. The room was huge! The complimentary breakfast had a nice variety. The hotel also has a gym, pool, and hot tub. We didn't use these features, but they keep the gym nice and cool.  Our friends in a nearby room and ourselves had an issue with lukewarm water in the showers. One of the employees didn't seem to believe us because they are all on the same system and nobody else had complained. However, the manager offered to move us to a different room.   Overall the stay was well worth what you get for the price. The only
Manager Response: Hello AnEasyGoing1, Thank you so much for the review and for choosing our hotel for your recent trip to Disneyland! Iâ€™m glad to hear you were pleasantly surprised with size of our suites and that you were able to enjoy the complimentary breakfast in the morning. I apologize for the issue your friend had with the hotel water, but glad to hear that my Team were able to make accommodations to get that resolved for them. I hope that youâ€™ll come back and stay with us again next time youâ€™re visiting Anaheim, our friendly staff and huge rooms will be waiting for you! Thank you again for choosing our hotel. Sincerely, Darrell Buettner General Manager

Summary: The staff are very friendly at this hotel and the rooms are clean and modern. The beds are very comfortable.   The one amazing thing about some of the rooms is that there huge.  My daughter, son- in- law, baby and son were given a suite with a tiny full kitchen with pots and pans, and cooking utensils (no dishes and only three forks), dining table, two sofa beds, two queen beds and enough room in the living room to put at least two bunk beds but there aren't bunk beds...  our room had a king bed, sofa bed, microwave, tiny fridge.  The hotel has a small pool and a gym.  The free, full breakfast was...adequate.  Microwaved bacon, watery eggs.  There are waffle machines (2) various breads, cereals, and fresh fruit.  I'm sorry, but after trying it once, we won't return.   Don't be
Manager Response: Hello TakeMeAlong, Thank you for staying with us on your recent visit to Disneyland, and for taking the time to share your feedback with us here on TripAdvisor. Iâ€™m glad to hear that you enjoyed our clean, spacious suites and that my staff treated you well during your time with us. I am sorry that you did not find our location to be as convenient as you had hoped for. You are correct that the walk to the main entrance can take around 20 minutes if you walk through DownTown Disney but you can also reach the free tram at the Mickey and Friends parking structure in less than 10 minutes if you would like to shorten that, or as you mentioned skip the walk entirely and use the ART that drops off and picks up here at the hotel for a nominal daily fee. I do hope that you will consider our hotel again in the future if you decide you want to skip the congestion of the other hotels located on Harbor Blvd, weâ€™d love to have you come back and stay with us again in the future! Thank you again for choosing our hotel!  Sincerely, Darrell Buettner General Manager

Summary: This was our third trip to Disneyland in as many years, and the third hotel we've tried. The short version of what will be expanded on below is the hotel is nice, but if you drove there, prepare to tack on $15 per night to park in their lot. I find this negates the benefit of staying in a walking-distance hotel, especially since the walk wouldn't be very reasonable if done with little kids in tow.   The pros: The hotel was immaculately clean, and had a modern, bright, pleasant feel to it. The staff we encountered were extraordinarily friendly, and seemed capable of doing their jobs competently (this shouldn't be something noteworthy, in my opinion, but I think we've all stayed somewhere this wasn't the norm). Our room, a two queen "suite" (more on that later), was clean and
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: We liked everything about this hotel except ...
Summary: We just finished a 3 night stay at the SpringHill Suites.  There was a lot that we liked about this hotel, but one clear negative.  On the positive side, the price was reasonable.  It is very conveniently located within walking distance to the parks.  This is important because if you stay for the fireworks or other shows at night, there is a huge crowd that leaves the parks all at the same time and there are long lines to get onto buses and shuttles.  It is a huge advantage to be able to just walk back to the hotel and skip the bus lines.  The hotel is modern, efficiently designed and a nice environment.  The staff is friendly.  When we asked, they were able to give us a different room at check in on the 4th floor with a view of the fireworks.  The pool is on the 5th floor and
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Surpassed our high expectations! Thank you!
Summary: My manager at my work had stayed here (here family also loves Disneyland). I have never had such good amenities and service in this price range and so accessible to the Park via shuttle. Shout out to Mayra and the other front desk staff - not for solving problems - there weren't any - but for great friendly service and finding extra ways to make our stay even better.  Like early check in and late check out - offered by them - i did not even ask - they could just see it would be a great help and mentioned it. They even offered for us to grab a bite at the breakfast bar as we were checking in!  My experience has been that these things just never happen at this price level unless there has been some big mistake on the hotel's part. The list of things we liked is just too long
Manager Response: none

Summary: The staff was superb.  At check in there was a problem created by one of the third party well advertised online reservation services (not TripAdvisor).  The office staff persisted in researching and found the reservation under a combination of our middle & last name. We chose SpringHill Suites Anaheim Maingate because it's location was very near Disneyland resort and a short non-highway drive to MLB Angel's Stadium.  It was a great call.  It was an easy walk to Disney Downtown and a little further thru Disney Downtown to both Disneyland park entrances (see photo).   But if you prefer to ride, their is a fee based bus service to Disneyland.   Our drive to Angel Stadium for a night game might have been 15 minutes with no need to get on a highway.   But If your exploring the
Manager Response: none

Summary: The Springhill Suites Anheim Maingate was very clean and comfortable. If you are just going to spend your days in Disneyland I recommend it totally. The beds were so comfortable I wanted to take the mattress home. Next time I'll brig a bigger suitcase. There was very little within walking distance. The breakfast was just ok but had very little variety and was set up very poorly.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: This is a great place to stay, just a short walk to Disneyland.
Summary: We decided to stay 1 night in Anaheim on our way to Newport Beach.  This hotel is an all-suite hotel and very convenient to Downtown Disney where we decided to eat dinner.  So glad we did!  There were 4 of us so we reserved a room with 2 queen beds.  We were very comfortable but with four adult females, we could have used another bathroom.  We asked for a quiet room and surprising enough we actually got a very quiet room which is something we have never gotten at the California Grand Hotel.  Our room was clean and the beds were very comfortable.  Our room had a small refrigerator which was very convenient.  The complimentary breakfast was great!  Eggs, waffles, yogurt, cereal, fruit and bakery goods, yummy!  This hotel is a bargain.  Something you don't usually find within 1/2
Manager Response: Hello mackimouse, Thank you for amazing review and for staying with us on your way to the beach! Iâ€™m glad to hear that our spacious suites provided you the room and comfort you were looking for and that you were able to enjoy our yummy breakfast in the morning! We look forward to having you here as our guest again next time youâ€™re in the area! Thank you again for staying with us! Sincerely, Darrell Buettner General Manager

Summary: Had a great time with large group.  Walk to Disneyland was a little longer than expected (hotel explained that Disney recently changed security which added a little walking distance).  We considered staying at the other Springhill which also looked nice - my wife walked to the CVS near the other property and said that she felt safer with the location that we stayed at (Ball Road) - the walk to and from the park was not crowded and we felt safe.  Staff at this location was friendly and breakfast was well stocked and consistent with Marriott quality.  My only complaint is that parking is $15 per day.
Manager Response: Hi Bill M, Thank you for staying with us on recent visit to Anaheim and for sharing your feedback with us here on TripAdvisor. Weâ€™re glad to hear that you and your group had a great time on your visit, and weâ€™re really glad you chose to avoid the crowd remain with us throughout your stay! I hope that youâ€™ll come back and stay with us again and be your hotel of choice next time you are in the Anaheim area. Thank you again for choosing our hotel! Sincerely, Darrell Buettner General Manager

Summary: We stayed here as part of our two week California trip for two nights. The hotel is ten minutes walk to Disney. The hotel itself has new large rooms and was priced well.  Free breakfast also. We got a room with two large double beds right in the front corner of the hotel with floor to ceiling windows overlooking the main crossroads.  Great hotel.
Manager Response: Hi RennieFamilyHolidays, Thank you taking the time to post your review, it sounds like you really enjoyed your time here in Anaheim! Based on the details of your review, I believe you may have stayed at the SpringHill Suites by the Convention Center and not at this hotel. While we are both a quick walk to Disneyland, have large, new rooms, and complimentary breakfast, our hotel does not have the floor to ceiling windows that you mentioned. If you happen to see this response I hope you take the opportunity to post the review to their page as it sounds like they did a great job taking care of you and your family. I hope you keep our hotel in mind if you ever come back to Anaheim, weâ€™d love to have you as our guest here next time! Sincerely, Darrell Buettner General Manager

Summary Heading: Great place to stay and minutes from Disneyland!
Summary: The room was clean, breakfast was great, and the hotel is a 1/2 mile from Disneyland.  the only caveat is that they do charge for parking, which was clear to us.  Lots of other stores nearby.  The staff was very friendly and willing to help.
Manager Response: Hello Sajjad K, Thank you so much for staying with us and for posting your review for our hotel! Iâ€™m very pleased that you enjoyed your stay with us and hope youâ€™ll return next time you are in the Anaheim area. Our friendly staff, clean rooms and great breakfast will all be here waiting for you! Sincerely, Darrell Buettner General Manager

Summary: Great time, comfortable room and beds.  So close to parks. Convenient  breakfast and art bus pickup right out front. Previous reviews talked about art buses, front desk sold passes.  Easy-peezy transportation to and from Disneyland. Check in and front desk staff were friendly and welcoming.  Ryan (name?) had great recommendations for us... dukes and nachos lol.  Along with enjoying the fireworks by the outdoor fireplace. Cleaning staff on the 4th floor did a great job!  Everyone including breakfast staff helped make a vacation memorable for the right reasons. Family friendly whether you children are young or old.  If back in the area I would go back to SpringHill Maingate.
Manager Response: Livetodaycjcajlja,  Thank you for writing a review on our property! On behalf of all of our staff, we are thrilled to hear we upheld our commitment to not just providing you and your family a place to stay, but memories that last a lifetime! Our property is perfectly located only a half mile from the Disneyland Resort, in which our guests utilize to main options when traveling to Disneyland. The first option is the ART shuttle, which picks up right in front of our hotel and takes you to the main entrance, for a small fee. Another option is to walk to the Mickeyâ€™s and Friends Parking Structure and take the complimentary Disneyland tram, and we even sell the ART shuttle tickets and have a detailed walking map right at the front desk! Our complimentary breakfast gives our guests different options to fulfill all of our guestsâ€™ tastes. Once again, thank you for staying with us and taking my advice, Dukes is a great place! If you travels bring you and your family back to the Anaheim area, remember â€œour doors are always openâ€ and we would love to accommodate you again.  Warmest Regards,  Ryan Nourse Front Office Supervisor

Summary: Stayed for 2 nights in July for a family trip to Disney.  Woman and the front desk, Jacqui, was lovely, welcoming and very helpful.  Rooms are great. Beds are comfortable. 2 queen beds, a bunk bed and a small couch. 6 could easily stay in 1 room.  The hotel is attached to a 24 hour CVS. We walked to Disney.   Free breakfast was nothing special but adequate and there was something for everyone.  Hotel was very clean. The only exception was the cords of the hanging lights in the dining area were literally caked with dust. This was sort of gross. Aside from that small detail, the place is fabulous!
Manager Response: Lkezmoh,  Thank you for writing us a review on TripAdvisor! It looks like you may have stayed at the Springhill Suites Convention Center, since we do not have a CVS pharmacy attached to our hotel and also do not have bunk beds at this location. But it does look like you and your family had a wonderful stay! If you happen to read this TripAdvisor response, feel free to write a review on their property. If your travels bring you back to the Anaheim area, we would love to have you give our hotel a try and stay with us!  Warmest Regards,  Ryan Nourse Front Office Supervisor

Summary Heading: Reliable home port while at Disney
Summary: ART bus very reliable,every 30 minutes took us almost to entrance of Disney. Rooms pleasant. Carpet could have been cleaner. Service employees the BEST.  Small pool had palm tree flowers in it all the time we were there. People who got hotels "across the street" still had to walk quite a way where the bus brought us right to door. We packed too much when WalMart only next exit north on Euclid St.on I-5 freeway. We didn't allow enough time for trip to airport with constant commute traffic & road construction of CA.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is an awesome place to stay for the whole family! Close to Disneyland, great breakfast, clean rooms, super-friendly staff and pool to relax in! If you are looking for affordable and convenient, you have found it.
Manager Response: Chewyisbest,  Thank you for writing a review on our property! On behalf of all of our staff, we are glad to hear we upheld our commitment to providing you and your family a great all-around guest experience! Our hotel is conveniently located only a half mile away from the Disneyland Resort. Our buffet-style breakfast, complimentary with your stay, gives our guests lots of breakfast options to choose from. Once again, thank you for staying with us and if you come back to the Anaheim area, we would love to accommodate you again.  Warmest Regards,  Ryan Nourse Front Office Supervisor

Summary: We enjoyed our stay here. Pool and spa weren't overly big or exciting but they did the job and where clean and inviting. Not to far to walk to the fun parks. Everything we needed in our room. Breakfast was ok. The only thing we didn't like was no where to eat right outside hotel either had to eat at park or there was a few delivery options. An on site restaurant would push this rating right up. However would stay here again but just make sure I eat out before returning to hotelðŸ˜œ
Manager Response: Hello Izyus, Thank you for staying with us on your recent visit to Disneyland and for taking the time to share your feedback with us here on Tripadvisor. Iâ€™m glad to hear that you found our hotel to conveniently located with easy access to the parks and that our rooms provided you everything you needed. Iâ€™m sorry to hear that the lack of dining options prevented from making your stay fantastic.  As you mentioned we do keep a variety of takeout and delivery menus available at the Front Desk to provide options to our guests, and DownTown Disney is just a short walk away with a number of great dining options as well. I hope that you enjoyed your time here in Anaheim and Iâ€™m happy to hear that youâ€™ll come back and see us again, weâ€™d love to have you as our guest next time youâ€™re in the area! Sincerely, Darrell Buettner General Manager

Summary Heading: An amazing stay in every way!!!!
Summary: The most consistent hotel on every visit.  I'm not sure if you have ever stayed near the park but is so worth it!  We stayed 4 nights and every time we went to Disney we had an Uber driver pick us up.  The cost for the Uber pickup was only $5.00 each way.  This hotel is less than a mile away from the entrance and  is convenient to all attractions.  The staff is always welcoming at this hotel!! Hats off to the breakfast attendants for always keeping the food replenished.    Loved watching the Disney Fireworks from the front patio of the hotel.
Manager Response: Greg B,  Thank you for writing a review on our hotel! Our location makes our hotel an ideal place to stay when traveling to Disneyland, as we are only about a half mile away and only about a 15 minute walk away from Downtown Disney. Our breakfast, complimentary with your stay, gives our guests different food options to make sure everyone is off to a great start in the morning! On behalf of all of our staff here, we are ecstatic to hear we made your stay great! If your travels bring you back to the Anaheim area, we would love to accommodate you and your family again.   Best Regards,  Ryan Nourse Front Office Supervisor

Summary: We booked this hotel to be close to Disneyland and also central to the sights in LA and the southern beaches.  It was perfect!  The hotel was VERY clean and relaxing.  The staff was great and so friendly, especially the two guys who worked the night of July 4th.  (I'm sorry I forget their names).  They lit the fire outside so we could watch the fireworks from Disney and they were very helpful in suggesting sightseeing for our family.  The walk to Disney took about 20 minutes total from the hotel to the entrance of Disneyland and the morning complimentary breakfast was very satisfying.  We drove to Laguna Beach from this hotel and it took about 45 minutes with traffic.  We also booked the LuxBus tour to LA and they picked us up right at our hotel.  We used the pool and the kids
Manager Response: Travelagent35,  Thank you for writing a review of our hotel! Our hotel is always striving toward perfection in every aspect of our guestsâ€™ stay. On behalf of our entire staff, we are ecstatic to hear we upheld our commitment to providing you and your guests not just a hotel to stay at, but memories that you will never forget! Our location is perfect when wanting to go to Disneyland as we are short walk from the Mickeyâ€™s and Friends Parking Structure where you and your guests can take the complimentary Disney tram right up to the main entrance. Another option is the ART shuttle which picks up right in front of our hotel, for a small fee. If these options best suit you and your guests, our front office staff even provides a detailed walking map and sell the ART shuttle tickets right here at the front desk! Our buffet-style breakfast aims to cater to all of guests individual tastes, and even have gluten free options! Thank you so much for staying with us and if your travels bring you back to the Anaheim area, remember â€œour doors are always openâ€ and we would love to accommodate you again!  Warmest Regards,  Ryan Nourse Front Office Supervisor

Summary Heading: Great hotel in all aspects except the walking distance to shuttle for a preschooler
Summary: We had a great time at the hotel. The rooms were comfortable and clean, pool was a nice respite from Disney chaos, parking was easy, wifi reliable and breakfast was pretty good! Overall, we had a great time. My only negative comment is that the walk from hotel to the tram is too far for my four-year old, especially after a long day at Disneyland. We ended up driving and paying for parking at the Mickey Mouse parkade after the first day. Uber/Lyft would be an inexpensive alternative except we would require a booster seat so that was not an option for us. We may do the paid shuttle from hotel door to Disneyland next time. The walk to tram or even Disneyland would of been fine if it was just us adults.
Manager Response: Moolie_loo,  Thank you for writing a review on our property! On behalf of all of our staff, we are excited to hear you and your family had a great stay here with us. Our location is perfect for our travelers deciding to go to Disneyland, as we are about a 10-15 minute walk to the Mickey and Friends Parking Structure where our guests can take the complimentary Disneyland tram to the main entrance. Sometimes having little kids can make this walk a little more difficult for some, so we do have the ART shuttle that picks up every 20-25 minutes right in front of our hotel and will also take you and your guests to the main entrance, for a small fee. To see which option is best for you, just ask any of our friendly front desk associates and they will be glad to assist you! Our breakfast buffet is a huge hit with our guests, as we have many different breakfast food options to cater to everyoneâ€™s individual tastes. Once again thank you for staying with us, and if you come back to the Anaheim area, we would love to accommodate you again!  Best Regards,  Ryan Nourse Front Office Supervisor

Summary Heading: Perfect Family Stay Close to Disneyland!
Summary: The reception staff were friendly, attentive, and caring- they went above and beyond to help us feel welcome and comfortable. Hotel was super clean, and very family-friendly. Rooms were spic n span, breakfast was one of the best we've ever had at a hotel that includes breakfast- delicious coffee, eggs, bacon, sausage, waffles, cereals, etc., etc.! Pool was sparkling and kids had lots of fun swimming and relaxing in the hot tub after a long day at the park. Could not have asked for a better stay. Thank you to Manager Darrell and his awesome team!
Manager Response: Cara E,  Thank you for writing a review on our hotel! On behalf of all of our staff, we are pleased to hear you and your family had a wonderful stay with us. Our location is perfect for our travelers headed to Disneyland, as we are only about a half mile away. Our complimentary buffet-style breakfast gives our guests many different food options, as well as gluten free options, to get your day started right! Once again, thank you for staying with us and if your travels bring you back to the Anaheim area, we would love to have you stay with us again!  Warmest Regards,  Ryan Nourse Front Office Supervisor

Summary: We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel.  Our room was clean and breakfast was easy to grab and go.
