Summary: We stayed here last week for four nights and thoroughly enjoyed this hotel. Upon check in - Mayra and Cindy at the front desk were welcoming, eager to assist and had answers to the many questions I had.  Rooms were quite clean, limited kitchen supplies but housekeeping did a great job every day in restocking. The pool was only about 4 feet deep and rather small - but it was a joy to jump in and swim after our long days of fun at Disney/California Adventure. Pool towels were provided poolside and consistently resupplied.   The breakfast provided included both hot and cold choices - and provided plenty of both food and places to eat during the 'rush hour' prior to leaving for the day.   Parking is $14 per day and there are limited washers and dryers on the 1st floor - $2.00 per
Manager Response: Hello Sherri S,  I enjoyed hearing your feedback about our property. We are thrilled to hear that our front desk agents set the tone for the rest of your day! We pride ourselves on giving our guests the best guest servicing experience from the minute you walk in our doors to the minute you checkout, trying to answer all of our guestsâ€™ questions and accommodate them in any way possible. Our pool and Jacuzzi is great way to relax after a long day at Disneyland, or for a relaxing day out in the sun. We are glad to hear you took advantage of our complimentary buffet style breakfast that comes with eggs, a waffle bar, cereal, bacon, sausage, etc. that is a great start to the day. The Mickeyâ€™s and Friends parking structure is conveniently located behind us which is a great option for our guests who want to walk to the park and catch the tram and we do provide visual directions at the front desk. Another option is the ART shuttle that does pick up in front of our hotel and will take you straight to the main entrance for a nominal fee, which is good for a round trip pass. Once again, thank you so much Sherri S, for staying with us. If you or your family find yourselves traveling to the Anaheim area again, we would love to accommodate you!   Best Regards, Ryan Nourse Front Office Supervisor

Summary Heading: Decent hotel--convenient to Disney--Great for Families
Summary: This hotel is convenient to Disney. They offer a shuttle than runs every 20 minutes and for $5 per person will allow unlimited trips to and from the hotel during the day. The hotel itself is nicely appointed, with a modern decor. The lobby area show minor (though still noticeable) signs of mild wear--a few noticeable spots on lobby furniture, minor knicks and scratches on some of the furniture.  Our guest room (King suite with sleeper sofa) was pristeen. We made use of the self service laundry which was a big plus for us as we stayed at the halfway point of an 8 day trip. My teenagers used the sleeper sofa and had no complaints about it. The king bed was very comfortable.  I used the free wifi without issue. Connectivity was quick and easy.  The free breakfast was the standard
Manager Response: Hello Ollie501,  Thank you for writing a review about our property! We are conveniently located near the main entrance of Disneyland. The ART shuttle is a great option when heading to Disneyland, as it picks up right in front of our property and drops off at the main entrance for a nominal fee. It really has its advantages after a long day at Disneyland. Our self-service laundry facility gives our guests the opportunity to wash their clothes, and we have supplies and quarters for our guests right here at the front desk. We are thrilled to hear you took advantage of our complimentary buffet style breakfast, which includes eggs, fruit, waffle bar, sausage, etc.  We are glad that our staff gave you a magnificent stay and on behalf of all of our staff here at the Springhill Suites, thank you for staying with us. If your travels bring you or your family back to the Anaheim area, we would love to have you stay with us again!   Warmest Regards,  Ryan Nourse Front Office Supervisor

Summary: This is a pretty decent place for launching your trip to Disneyland. It's not a short walk to Disneyland, count on 20 minutes or so to downtown Disney, but it's quiet and there's free breakfast in the morning (some sort of egg substance, toast, bagels, yogurts and coffee). Nicest thing about this hotel is that it is quiet, likely due to the fact that nobody is there during the day and at night, as everyone returns, exhaustion takes over.  A friendly staff, nice, though small workout facility and clean pool area add to the value. Note - the elevators are slow and the arrival bell for the elevator is loud enough that you want to be a good ten room doors away from the elevator bank.  The free wifi is a nice add on but slow as hell.
Manager Response: Brian S,  Hi Brian S thank you so much for taking the time to write a review on our property! We love that you took advantage of the walk to the parking structure and hopped onto the Disneyland tram, which is conveniently located behind our hotel. As you noticed, during the day most of our guests are out and about, so it can be quiet around the hotel. This is a perfect time to go relax by our large heated pool and Jacuzzi. We do provide our guests with complimentary Wi-Fi, and if you need a higher speed, we do offer that for a low fee. Thank you again, Brian S, for staying with us and if your travels bring back to the Anaheim area, we would love to have you stay with us again!  Best Regards, Ryan Nourse Front Office Supervisor

Summary: There are so many "good neighbor" hotels in the area, and it's quite the chore to search out a good one, then sort through the reviews.  I had a specific list I wanted from wherever I stayed:  Good price without scrimping on quality, decent free breakfast to get us out the door, easy access to Disneyland.  Read the reviews on SpringHill Suites and hit it out of the park--for the most part.  This is a fairly new hotel, and you can see the difference, the moment you step into the spacious lobby. It's fresh, smart and the front staff are friendly. (My daughter works in a 5 star hotel and said that whoever was working the front desk on our arrival on 3/16/16 at around 10-11 AM--in case the manager is reviewing--could easily fit in at her hotel in Pebble Beach. Very helpful and
Manager Response: RobinBurcell,  On behalf of all of our staff here at the Springhill Suites, we are pleased to hear you and your family had a wonderful stay with us! When booking a family vacation, it is very important to go through and research each hotel. We are glad you read our positive reviews and chose to stay with us. Our staff always tries to make themselves available to all of our guests, in order to accommodate each and every request, and I am delighted to hear that you and your family received superior guest service while staying with us. The Disneyland tram is a quick and convenient way to get to Disneyland, in which we have directions right at our front desk and is only a 15-minute walk away from us. On behalf of our staff thank you so much again for staying with us and if you come back to the Anaheim area we would love to see you again!  Warm Regards, Ryan Nourse Front Office Supervisor

Summary Heading: Great Hotel, Great Staff, Great Price
Summary: This hotel made our trip. It was new, well laid out and close to Disneyland. An exceptional value for sure. The grounds and pool area were very clean as well. The breakfast was good as well, lots to choose from and more than enough to go around. The room was awesome....it had the hide-a-bed in a sort of seperate room that was like a second bedroom. The square footage was a very pleasant (and welcome) surprise. It made it quite nice for our family of four to have the extra room. The staff was excellent as well. From the front desk to the maids, everyone had a smile and were very pleasant. We'd stay here again.
Manager Response: Hello Tony P,  Thank you for writing a review about our property, the Springhill Suites! We are so excited to hear that you and your family had a spectacular stay with us. We pride ourselves on maintaining a superior guest experience in every aspect of your stay. We are delighted to hear our buffet style breakfast was very appetizing, as our breakfast staff always goes out of their way to accommodate all of our guests. We are one of the newest hotels in the Disney resort area and we try to give our guests that wow factor with our stylish and modern look. Our staff always goes out of their way to accommodate all of our guestsâ€™ needs and to provide the superior guest service experience which has us standing out from the rest! We are enchanted that you stayed with us and are thrilled to hear that your overall experience was â€œmagical.â€  If you or your family come back to the Anaheim area, we would love to accommodate you again!   Best Regards, Ryan Nourse Front Office Supervisor

Summary Heading: Great service, reasonably priced, good choice for Disney
Summary: We stayed here one night while visiting Disneyland.    Pros: new hotel, clean, comfortable beds, great service. Busy but quiet.  Free breakfast.  Reasonably priced for the area.  Complimentary WiFi.  Decent fitness room (treadmills, bicycles, ellipticals and some weights) and pool.  Walk to Disney Trams in 10 minutes.  Grocery store and several fast-food restaurants just up the street.   Cons: breakfast was not very appealing.  Eggs not good and fruit over ripened but had breads, waffles, yogurt, juices.  Kids will like it.  Charge $14.95 a day to park car.  Was very disappointed to find that out.    Overall, great place to stay while visiting Disney.  Highly recommend.
Manager Response: Hello tgdow,  We really appreciate you taking the time to write a review on our property! We are delighted to hear you and your family slept comfortably on our nice clean beds and to hear that you enjoyed our amenities here at the Springhill Suites. We always try to provide our guests with nice amenities throughout our hotel including a buffet style breakfast, high-speed Wi-Fi throughout the hotel, a 24-hour fitness center, and a large pool and Jacuzzi to relax at. We always try to uphold our commitment to our guests by having a superior guest service experience. I am glad to hear that our entire staff provided you and your family with a great guest experience. We do have to charge for parking because of our proximity to Disneyland, which is common throughout the Disney resort area. We really appreciate you staying with us and recommending us to others, and if your travels bring you back to the Anaheim area we would love to accommodate you again!  Warmest Regards, Ryan Nourse Front Office Supervisor

Summary: My family stayed here before Christmas (sorry for the late review) and it was our second visit.  I cannot say enough positive comments about this hotel.  The lobby and rooms are modern, fresh and clean.  The staff went out of their way to make us feel comfortable and accommodate our every need.  Our two young boys slept on the pull out couch and found it very comfortable.  It almost feels like a one bedroom suite because the room is spacious and there is a partition between the main bed and the sitting area with the pull-out.  The morning breakfast is great - good variety!  The General Manager treated us like guests in his home.  It is clear that he values every guest who chooses his hotel.  We walked to Disney each day and cut through the parkade.  If you are bringing a
Manager Response: Hello cartan,   Thank you so much for taking the time to write a review about our hotel! On behalf of all of our staff here we are delighted to hear your stay with us was extremely positive. Here at the Springhill Suites we pride ourselves on creating a superior guest experience during the entire duration of your stay. I am tremendously happy to hear our staff went out of their way to accommodate your every need, and that you and your family enjoyed our complimentary buffet style breakfast, as we like to say â€œevery guest every timeâ€. Our General Manager, Darrell, always goes out of his way to make our guests feel at home.  If your travels bring you back to the Anaheim area, we would love to accommodate you and your family!    Many Thanks, Ryan Nourse Front Office Supervisor

Summary Heading: Clean, Modern & Great Service - Close to Disneyland
Summary: We stayed 4 nights Feb 2016 for our Disneyland visit. The service from the staff was great, they accommodated our every need and request. The hotel was clean, modern and included an amazing breakfast. The price was a steal, we updated our booking last minute and got a better rate, which really helped us with the poor CAD dollar right now. We booked a one bedroom suite and loved the kitchen and extra space for our kids. You can see the fireworks from their front sitting area, and they have all the disneyland info in the lobby you need. We'll stay here again, for sure!
Manager Response: Hello mellyjelly79,  Thank your for taking the time to write a review about our hotel. I am pleased to hear that you found the staff to be accommodating! We are always available to answer questions and to help in any way that we can. That is great to hear that you were able to book our one bedroom suite at the best rate available! We appreciate you staying with us and we look forward to seeing you again on your next trip to Anaheim.  Warm regards,  Lynsey Marrinan Front Office Supervisor

Summary Heading: Great Hotel close to Disney Parks
Summary: Brand new clean hotel close to Disney Parks. Can walk or take the ART. Breakfast was very good with a wide variety of choices.  Breakfast room was very clean and hotel staff was continually cleaning up and replacing food items. Rooms well appointed. Sleeper sofa mattress was not comfortable but the bed was. Nice pool! Business center allows you to print your boarding passes free of charge. Laundromat on site. Myra at the front desk is as great as everyone says! All hotel staff was friendly and helpful! We would definitely stay here again!
Manager Response: Hello Norskie56,  Thank you for reviewing our hotel! As you said, we are a new hotel and close to Disneyland. We are within walking distance to the parks, but the ART shuttle is a nice option if you do not want to walk. I am glad to hear that you enjoyed the breakfast and variety of items we offer. Thank you for recognizing Mayra for her service; she is an outstanding employee and great asset to our team. I am sorry to hear that you did not find the sofa bed to be comfortable. I will inform our management team to see if we can find a solution to make the beds more comfortable. We appreciate you choosing to stay with us and we hope to see you again soon! Warm regards,  Lynsey Marrinan  Front Office Supervisor

Summary: Got a one bedroom suite for one night. Very convenient for Disneylanders. Lots of food in a short drive and many that offer delivery to the hotel. Ask hotel for handout on food places..they have coupons in it. Long Weird layout of the bathroom...no tubs and bad lighting for applying makeup, but very nice room, king bed, desk area, refrig, microwave, plenty of places to plug in electronics. No kitchen sink tho, and the way to turn on the lights over the refrig/micro I imagine most ppl will not figure out. No switch! [use key card at door] weird! Nice pool and strong Jacuzzi, big spread for breakfast with the normal hotel offerings. Friendly staff. Elevator doors were open before you get to them, nice feature. Very pretty hotel. I will use them again.  Quiet except ... Fireworks
Manager Response: Hello prescottmtngal,  Thank you for sharing about your stay! I am pleased to know you found the room and location of the hotel to be convenient for you and your family. The front desk staff is always available to answer questions and offer suggestions. Plus, we have a variety of menus and maps for our guests. I see you noticed our energy efficient lighting feature in the room. It is a unique lighting system compared to other hotels, but better for the environment! I am sorry that you found the bathroom to be weird. Some of our rooms do have bathtubs and we would be happy to get you in a room with one next time. Disneyland does have a firework show every night and if you donâ€™t watch them at the park, we have  outside seating near a fire pit where you can enjoy them. Thank you for staying with us and we hope to see you on your next trip to Disneyland! Warm regards,  Lynsey Marrinan Front Office Supervisor

Summary Heading: Very nice hotel close to Disney
Summary: My daughter and I stayed here January 30th to February 5th.  Our room was very spacious, clean and comfortable.  The free breakfast was excellent!  We filled up on delicious waffles, eggs and bacon or breakfast patties everyday of our stay.  Got a little crazy some mornings, but everyone still managed to get fed and through the line.  The staff were great at filling up the items that were gone and tidying up as people went through.  We loved the location.  A quick 5 minute walk to the Mickey and Friends Parking Structure then aboard the free tram to the parks!  Only downside is there are no close by restaurants to walk to, but we managed to order in or eat before we left Disney.  We would definitely stay here again!
Manager Response: Hello Albertagirl80, Thank you for taking the time to write a review about your stay. I am glad to hear you found the room to be spacious, clean, and comfortable for you and your daughter! It sounds like you really enjoyed the breakfast. We do our best to keep a variety of options available for our guests. Our breakfast team works diligently to keep the items stocked and the area clean, so we appreciate you recognizing them. Thank you for choosing to stay with us and we look forward to seeing you again!  Warm regards,  Lynsey Marrinan  Front Office Supervisor

Summary: Every time we entered the property we were greeted with a "welcome back"! The front desk staff provided a wealth of information when we checked in and made sure we knew not to hesitate to ask if we had any questions...which we did and were always given a clear answer.  The pool (slightly heated in February), jacuzzi and deck were very clean with plenty of clean towels on hand. There was a guest area with 2 desktop computers equipped with a printer, there was an ATM and a coin operated laundry facility that was very clean! The complimentary wifi in the room was pretty good but you could upgrade for $6.95 per day if you found it wasn't adequate for your needs.  The complimentary breakfast had a decent variety of items: apples, oranges, bananas, cold cereal, milk, juice, coffee,
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is a fantastic property. The facility is clean, has a more than adequate breakfast, very convenient to Disneyland, and a good price. The bed was comfortable the fixtures in furnishings were all new, I enjoyed my stay immensely! I would come back to this place without hesitation!
Manager Response: Hello WheelerTempe_AZ,  Thank you for taking the time to write us a review on trip advisor. Thank you for noticing on how the property is well maintained and clean. It was also nice to see that you were able to take part in our breakfast that we serve every morning and that you enjoyed it. We appreciate you choosing to stay with us! Please come see us again as we will be delighted to serve you! Warm regards, Lynsey Marrinan Front Office Supervisor

Summary: My family of 5 stayed here in October and had a wonderful experience! The room was spacious and very clean and had plenty of room for a pack n play for our youngest. We loved the pool area, which we used every day (it was 104 degrees our whole trip !) and the breakfast had a good variety. We used the ART shuttle that stops right in front of the hotel and it always got us to Disneyland before the gates opened. We would definitely stay here again!
Manager Response: Hello RissMax,  Thank you for writing your amazing review. So very happy to hear that the rooms were large enough to accommodate you and your family, and that we were able to provide sleeping accommodations for your little one! You are right. The ART shuttles that run through our hotel try to be as efficient as they can in providing you fast transportation to the front gates of Disneyland. We would like to thank you again for staying with us here at the Springhill Suites as we hope to accommodate you the next time you are in town! Warm regards,  Lynsey Marrinan Front Office Supervisor

Summary Heading: Another great place to stay for Disney
Summary: Was on a group trip this time as a chaperone. Honestly isn't the BEST set up for a group based soley on the bathroom set up. *first world problems* haha! The door is frosted and so if someone is in there the light shines through.  The property is VERY clean and it's a little walk to the Mickey and friends tram station to get to the park. FREE! There's a pull out sofa bed (twin size) so could put 5 kids/students in a room! Small microwave and fridge. Includes BREAKFAST!! Hooray! I read that wifi wasn't awesome for some travelers, but it WAS AWESOME for us. Of course we only used it to update social media with pictures.  Will for sure be an option on our next family trip! I will be sure to request a room away from the outside doors though as they slam shut! Don't know if that's a
Manager Response: Hello Jamaica H, Thank you so much for your positive review. I would like to also thank you on highlighting the most positive things about our hotel. We are just located under a mile to the front gates of Disneyland, which is only about a twelve-minute walk to the Mickey and Friends tram that takes you straight to the front gates of Disneyland! So good to hear that our breakfast buffet was accommodating enough for you, we try to provide as many options as we can. I would like to apologize about the bathroom door during your stay. We are currently working on solutions to fix the doors, so hopefully by the next time you stay with us that problem will be solved. Thank you again for staying with us, we look forward to accommodating you in the future.     Warm regards,  Lynsey Marrinan Front Office Supervisor

Summary: Super nice, pretty new hotel.  The room was very large with nice amenities.  Everything was clean and spotless.  Beds and bedding very comfortable.  Large walk in closet for extra space.  Staff was friendly and helpful, breakfast was much better than most free hotel breakfast.  I highly recommend using ART transportation to go to Disneyland (we walked it once and ART is so much easier).  You can buy your ART tickets at the front desk.  If not staying at a Disney Hotel this is a great alternative.
Manager Response: Thank you WDWfan81, Thank you so much for taking time to write us a wonderful review. It is extremely delightful to hear that you had such a positive experience at our property. You are correct. We have comfortable beddings and large closets in order to accommodate the large families who stay with us for Disneyland. Our full hot breakfast buffet has a wide variety of options to support the nutritional needs of our guests. The ART shuttle is indeed our most convenient mode of transportation to the front gates as opposed to walking to the Mickey and Friends tram. Most importantly, we are lucky enough to have such a wonderful staff working for us to help provide a positive experience. Thank you for staying with us, we hope to accommodate you soon.   Warm regards, Lynsey Marrinan Front Office Supervisor

Summary: We arrived early one day after a dawn start to our travels, and were fortunate to be able to check in. The hotel was well appointed, the rooms were a great size with a microwave and a fridge and fitted four of us comfortably. The staff were fabulous, they honestly couldn't do more for us if they tried. A real asset to the place.  Breakfast is included, and it was serviceable. Enough to get us going for our trip to Disneyland. The hotel is within walking distance to Disney, which was great!  And they have an amazing taxi service run by Sammy. Can't beat the price or the service!
Manager Response: Hello Wheelfam, I would like to thank you on behalf of all of us here at Springhill Suites for taking the time out of your day to write us such a wonderful review. We are glad that we were able to accommodate an early check in for you. I am pleased to know that you found the staff to be â€œfabulousâ€! Thank you for the feedback on Sammy from Blue Star Transportation. We want our guests to have the best service in our hotel and with the companies that we recommend. Hopefully on your next trip to Disneyland, Springhill Suites will be at the top of your list! Thank you so much for staying with us.  Warm regards,  Lynsey Marrinan Front Office Supervisor

Summary: After traveling around America for one month our last stop was Anaheim. We stayed in many nice places but Springhill Suites were by far the best, they were big we had two queen size beds with plenty of room around them for our luggage. The bathroom was huge, there was a walk in robe, a desk and a sitting area. The resort has a pool, spa, gym and a laundry which is handy especially when you have kids. The breakfast was good and set us up for the day. If you are going to Disneyland, for a few dollars you can catch the shuttle there and back for the short trip. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the resort was extremely clean. I highly recommend this resort if you are visiting Anaheim.
Manager Response: Hello Trip Advisor Member! Iâ€™d like to personally thank you for taking time out of your day to write us a review! We are so pleased to hear that you had such a great experience during your stay. Itâ€™s great to know that we were â€œby far the bestâ€ for you and your family. We pride ourselves in providing a home away from home experience for each of our guests, so I am glad that you found the staff to be friendly and the hotel extremely clean.  We do hope that we can have the pleasure of accommodating you on your next trip to Anaheim! Thank you so much for staying with us.   Warm regards,  Lynsey Marrinan Front Office Supervisor

Summary: I have been to Disneyland many times, and usually stay in a hotel on the main strip across from the entrance to the parks. Those hotels feature long walks, indescribable smells (in a bad way), and screaming kids. This hotel is on the "back" side of the parks, and is probably an equal distance to walk through the Disney parking garage to get on the trams. The plus side is the trams let you off in Downtown Disney by Starbucks, which we usually visit before going to the parks, so it ends up being less walking for us.   We asked for a quiet room, and received one on the top floor at the end of the hallway, away from the elevators and soda machine. It was wonderfully quiet, I didn't even need earplugs, until someone with a baby moved into the room next door and the baby cried all.
Manager Response: Hello pongojones!  Thank you for finding the time to write a review. You are correct; we are just about equal walking distance to the Disney Mickey and Friends parking structure from our neighboring hotels, which provides a fast and easy transportation to the front gates of Disneyland.  We are also just as happy that your stay was a quiet one.  It is unfortunate to hear that you were unable to fully utilize the breakfast each of the mornings. Iâ€™ll recommend that we add more Vegan friendly items! Thank you so much for staying with Springhill Suites Anaheim Maingate. Warm regards,  Lynsey Marrinan Front Office Supervisor

Summary: This SpringHill lives up to the others I have stayed at, same big clean rooms great breakfast and great staff. This one is easy to get in and out off, not too far from Disney.  Once you figure out the area shuttle bus is was easy to get back and forth from the park. Will use it again on our next visit to Disney.
Manager Response: Hello ivster,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. Thatâ€™s great you enjoyed the full hot breakfast and big clean rooms! Thank you for your feedback on the ART Shuttle service. We recommend their service to a lot of guests, so itâ€™s wonderful to hear you had a pleasant experience with them. Thank you for staying with us and we hope to see you back soon! Warm regards,  Lynsey Marrinan Front Office Supervisor

Summary: The suites are good sized, would be perfect for families travelling who need a little room to spread out.  I enjoyed having a mini-fridge and desk area to work in since I was there for work.  The free internet is horrendous, plan on buying the upgraded package if you need to connect.
Manager Response: Hello Dlayne S,  Thank you for writing a review about your stay! I am glad you found the room to be a good size and big enough to spread out. All of our rooms are equipped with a mini-fridge and desk area, so that is great you were able to enjoy utilizing both of those during your stay. I am sorry to hear that you had trouble with the complimentary WiFi access. The premium WiFi does have a faster connection, which may be a better option when working from the room. Thank you for choosing to stay with us and we hope to see you the next time you are in Anaheim, whether itâ€™s for business or pleasure! Warm regards,  Lynsey Marrinan Front Office Supervisor

Summary: We stayed here for 8 days and were very pleased!  The rooms were a great size, the breakfast was good, close to Downtown Disney and the tram to Disneyland, watched the fireworks from  our room and the staff was great! I have stayed at a few Springhill hotels and always enjoy them!
Manager Response: Hello Mirjam V,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review about our hotel! We are pleased to know you had a great stay! Iâ€™m glad you enjoyed the full hot breakfast and firework view room. Thank you for your loyalty to Springhill Suites and the â€œgreat staffâ€ here hopes to see you on your next trip to Disneyland! Warm regards,  Lynsey Marrinan Front Office Supervisor

Summary: Good experience - good amenities, well located, nice new fresh rooms, good staff/service, is convenient to Disneyland and all of what Anaheim offers. Excellent housekeeping services, nice fixtures and clean environs, Only downsides are WiFi performs average compared to others and is costly (they offer free lobby service, yet charge for so called premium service in each room). The free buffet breakfast is just OK.
Manager Response: Hello KarlSice,  Thank you for reviewing our hotel! I am so glad to hear you had a good experience and enjoy the amenities, location, rooms, and staff! Our housekeeping staff works very hard to keep our rooms clean and fresh for our guests, so itâ€™s great to know that you found their service to be excellent. I am sorry that you experienced trouble with the WiFi during your stay. There is free internet access in the lobby as well as in the rooms, but for a faster connection there is a premium service fee that will connect six devices. We appreciate you choosing to stay with us and we hope to see you soon! Warm regards,  Lynsey Marrinan Front Office Supervisor

Summary Heading: Nice but not really close to the main gate
Summary: The name of the hotel is misleading! It is not by the main gate of Disneyland.  They depend on the Rideart transit bus which is run by the city of Anaheim.  The bus is unreliable during busy times of course it was always busy when we needed the service.  I had to walk almost a mile from Disneyland each time to get back to the hotel at night.  I waited 40 minutes for the bus on New Year's Eve and it finally came but it was too small to take even half the lineup so instead of waiting another unknown amount of time we made it to the parking lot tram near downtown Disney and it took us about half way back and we walked the rest of the way on the two nights of our stay. We walked a lot during our two days and nights at Disneyland. My iPhone tracked us at 18 miles for the two days!
Manager Response: Hello Isobel,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review about your stay. I am glad you found our rooms to be nice and clean. Our housekeeping staff works diligently to keep the rooms looking nice for all of our guests. I am sorry that you found the name to be misleading. There are two main gates of Disneyland and we are located closest to the main gates through Downtown Disney, which is a little under a mile from our hotel. We recommend hopping on the tram at the Mickey and Friends parking structure to make the trip over to Disneyland quicker. I am also sorry to hear that you experienced extended wait times with the ART Shuttle. During the holidays or other peak seasons the shuttles are very busy. We truly appreciate your feedback on their service and I will extend this to their management team. Thank you for choosing to stay with us and we hope to see you again for your next Disney trip! Warm regards,  Lynsey Marrinan  Front Office Supervisor

Summary: I came here to this Hotel to visit a friend and go to Disneyland over Christmas.   I have to say this was the nicest hotel I have been too.  The staff was friendly, warm and very helpful.  They made my friends visit seem like being treated like family.   I plan on coming back over and over again.  Hands down I was extremely pleased with my visit.
Manager Response: Hello Michelle P,  Thank you for writing a review about your stay. I hope you had a great Christmas! I am happy to hear that you found the staff to be friendly and helpful during your stay. We are always available to answer any questions and offer suggestions to our guests so that you feel as if this is your home away from home. Thank you for staying with us and we are excited to know that we will see you over and over again!  Warm regards,  Lynsey Marrinan  Front Office Supervisor

Summary: The Springhill Suites in Anaheim is a good location.  It is nearby DL and away from the crowds.  It is within walking distance through Disneyland Downtown from Walnut Street (backside), and not recommended if you have little ones to bring along.  There is a shuttle every 20 minutes to the park and is priced reasonably, $5 all day use or $3 one way.  The rooms are spacious like a mini suite and furnished with a sofa and work desk, refrigerator, microwave, large closet, safe and a good size bath room.  The room is very clean.  At 9:30pm, if happen to get a room that faces Disneyland, you can see the fireworks in the comfort.  I recommend this place if you like a nice and quite place to stay.
Manager Response: Hello 888StanCasinoPlayer,  Thank you for reviewing our hotel! I am glad you found our location to be a good fit for you during your stay. We are within walking distance to the main entrances in Downtown Disney, but the ART shuttle is a great way to get back and forth if you wanted to avoid the walk. We want our guests to feel comfortable in the rooms, so they do come equipped with a microwave, mini-fridge, desk, and couch with a pull-out sofa bed. Thatâ€™s great that you were able to see the fireworks from your room! Thank you for choosing to stay with us and for your recommendation. We look forward to seeing you again soon!  Warm regards,  Lynsey Marrinan  Front Office Supervisor

Summary: We had 3 adults and 2 children (ages 8 and 11) in a Suite - perfect size and accomodations.  Large bathroom with ample sink area for allowing one to shower while the other applied lotions and cosmetics. Large walk-in closet with shelves for dressing and storage.  Flat screen TV, WiFi, and great hot breakfast.  Lovely and professional staff catering to Disney tourists. Overall excellent experience!
Manager Response: Hello Alexis K,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review. I am very happy to hear that you found the accommodations of our hotel and the room size to be perfect for you and your family. Our staff strives to provide excellent service to our guests, so I am pleased to know that you had an excellent experience. Thank you for staying with us and we hope to see you back on your next trip to Anaheim! Warm regards,  Lynsey Marrinan Front Office Supervisor

Summary: Stayed here twice for Disneyland.  Nice big clean rooms and friendly staff.  Tyler from the front desk went out of his way for us.  Nice HOT daily breakfast options.  I recommend that you take the shuttle to Disney.  $5/adults.  $2/kids. (Round trip door to door).  Otherwise it's a ten to fifteen min walk to the Mickey garage then wait for their tram.  We did that the first time which was fine. However, coming back late night walking back to Springhill we were already tired and it was pretty eerie walking back in the dark
Manager Response: Hello Dave T,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review about our hotel. Thatâ€™s great to hear you have stayed with us twice and enjoyed the big, clean rooms and friendly staff! We appreciate you recognizing Tyler for going â€œout of his wayâ€ for your family. We aim to deliver excellent service, so I am happy to hear he provided that for you. I agree that the ART shuttle is an inexpensive option to get back and forth to the park. Although the walk is only about 10-15 minutes to the Mickey and Friends tram, I could see how it would be tiresome to walk back after a long day of walking at Disney! Thank you for your loyalty and we hope to see you back soon.  Warm regards,  Lynsey Marrinan Front Office Supervisor

Summary Heading: Spacious Room close to Disney Land
Summary: Stayed for a couple of days in this excellent hotel.  The staff were very helpful especially Linsday.  My son and I also visited South Coast Plaza which was 25 minutes away by Uber.  The room eas very clean, spacious and modern
Manager Response: Hello Goochieboy,  Thank you reviewing our hotel. We were happy to have you for those couple of days! Thank you for the compliment! We pride ourselves in providing excellent service, so I am glad we were able to answer your questions and offer suggestions for you. Thatâ€™s great to hear that you enjoyed the spacious and modern design of our rooms. Thank you for choosing to stay with us and we hope to see you back next time! Warm regards,  Lynsey Marrinan Front Office Supervisor

Summary: It took our family about 15-20 minutes to walk to the trams that take you to Disneyland.  The hotel does offer a shuttle service for an additional fee if you don't want to walk.  The free breakfast was good.  The staff was very friendly.  The hotel was very clean.  The room was spacious.   The fitness area was adequate.  I would definitely stay here if you plan to go to Disneyland.
Manager Response: Hello woodyb70,  Thank you for your informative review of our hotel! We are within walking distance from Disneyland, but the ART Shuttle that picks up right in front of the hotel is a great option as well. I am glad you enjoyed the full hot breakfast and friendly staff! We appreciate you choosing to stay with us and we hope to see you again soon! Warm regards,  Lynsey Marrinan  Front Office Supervisor

Summary: The room was much better than expected. It was very clean and modern looking. We had a microwave and a small refrigerator which was convenient for the food we had brought in from outside the hotel.  The bathroom was clean which is of utmost importance to my wife. However, having a two young kids and two adults, the long narrow bathroom was a little inconvenient. There weren't a lot of counter space or options for placing your clothes. If you are worried about your kids seeing you naked, the shower is transparent glass and you would have to own the bathroom until you're dressed. This wasn't a big issue for us. However, the biggest annoyance we had was the fact the bathroom door is translucent and allowed light into the room while being used. Even just turning on the shower light
Manager Response: Hello Flong123,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. I am happy to hear that you found the mini-refrigerator and microwave convenient during your stay. Our housekeeping staff works very hard to make sure the rooms are spotless for all of our guests, so I am glad that your wife approved. I am sorry to hear that the bathroom design created challenges for you. We are in the process of coming up with new ideas to prevent the light from shining through the door. We appreciate your feedback on the ART Shuttle service as well. We only want what is best for our guests, so I will pass along the information to their management team. Thatâ€™s great you were able to enjoy the Disneyland firework show from one of our firework view rooms! Thank you for staying with us and we hope to see you back the next time you are in Anaheim.  Warm regards,  Lynsey Marrinan Front Office Supervisor

Summary: SpringHill Suites Anaheim Maingate is a clean, comfortable place in close proximity to Disneyland.  Our room was stocked with a microwave, mini-refrigerator, eating utensils, and coffee maker.  there was a seating area with a sectional and occasional tables, as well as, a small desk area.  There was a glass divider that separated this area from the bed area.  There was a safe in the room, an ironing board and hair dryer.  The bed was a little harder than I like, but that is simply a preference issue.  The lobby has a small shopping area near the front desk that has items you can grab and heat in your microwave, such as soup and popcorn.    The most notable thing about this hotel is the staff.  We were greeted with a smile and acknowledged verbally eac time we encountered them.
Manager Response: Hello restls,  Thank you for reviewing our hotel! You described our rooms perfectly. All of the rooms are equipped with microwaves, mini-refrigerators, and coffee makers. In addition, there is a sofa that can pull out into a bed and a desk area. As you mentioned, our market is located right by the front desk and stocked with a variety of items for you to enjoy. I am happy to hear you found the front desk staff to be the â€œmost notableâ€. We strive to provide the best service to our guests, so Iâ€™m pleased to know that we accomplished that for you. Thank you for staying with us and for your recommendation! We look forward to seeing you again.  Warm regards,  Lynsey Marrinan Front Office Supervisor

Summary: Excellent hotel with very helpful staff. The breakfast was always well stocked and tended to. The staff who made and kept the breakfast stocked were exceptional, friendly, and very hard working. Our room was very clean and well kept.  Proximity to the Disneyland Tram made getting to the park a breeze and very quick (not to mention free).
Manager Response: Hello Jason M,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review! I am happy that you found the staff to be very helpful to you during your visit. The breakfast crew works diligently to keep the variety of breakfast items available for the full hot breakfast and to keep our guests happy! I am glad to hear that you found the walk to Disneyland to be very quick. That is just one of many suggestions that we offer to get to the park, but of course, you canâ€™t beat free! Thank you for staying with us and we hope to see you the next time your travels bring you to Anaheim.  Warm regards,  Lynsey Marrinan Front Office Supervisor

Summary Heading: Amazing location for walking to Disneyland
Summary: This new hotel is a 5-10 minute walk to the Disney parking structure tram that takes you into Disneyland.  No other services around, though.  Free breakfast and WiFi.  Parking is $14/night.   New beds are comfy, large, nice bathroom.  The heater/ac unit is unfortunately located parallel and very close to the bed.  When it runs, it is loud and ac is very cold blowing across the bed.  We had to get up several times to turn it off and back on when the room got too warm.  Only complaint.  Very well priced for the area.  Nice folks at the front desk - very helpful.  Safe area.  Be sure and ask for rooms away from Ball Road, or you will hear the traffic.  There is another Springhill nearby that is also new and nice with more conveniences nearby.
Manager Response: Hello 69rjo,  Thank you for reviewing our hotel! We are conveniently located near the Mickey and Friends parking structure, which is only a short walk from our hotel. This is a great option to take advantage of to avoid Disneyâ€™s parking fee of $18.00 per day. Iâ€™m glad to hear you found the beds to be comfortable and large. I am sorry that you had challenges with your air conditioning in the room. I will bring this to the attention of the Engineering manager, so you and future guests can sleep comfortably. I am happy you found the front desk to be helpful to you and the hotel to be well priced. Thank you for staying with us and we hope to see you back soon! Warm regards,  Lynsey Marrinan Front Office Supervisor

Summary: We stayed 5 nights over Thanksgiving Weekend.  It's over all a good stay.    Pro:  Close to Disney, it's about 10-15 min walk to Disney Tram.  Free breakfast is good, but mostly the same items every morning.  Room has a sofa bed that would accommodate a large family, though sharing the only bathroom is hard.    Con:  Water pressure is low for shower. The shower head in our room was spraying water to the side rather in middle.  Hotel did offer to switch room, but it was just too much to pack and unpack for 5 ppl.   Mini fridge in room did not have a freezing compartment. Like some other posts suggested, the layout of the bathroom is terrible.  It is very spacious.  However, sink, toilet and shower are behind one door making sharing very difficult.  I like to drink hot water
Manager Response: Hello Ying P, Thank you for staying with us on your recent visit Disneyland, Iâ€™m happy to hear that you found our location to be convenient for your family to get back and forth to the parks with ease. Iâ€™m glad that you were able to enjoy our complimentary hot breakfast in the morning and that our suites provided plenty of space for and your family during your visit. Iâ€™m sorry to hear that we experienced some water pressure issues while you were staying with, Iâ€™m having my maintenance team look into that to ensure that it was an isolated issue and wonâ€™t inconvenience you on your next stay with us. Next time you come to stay, you can always run water through the in room coffee maker without a coffee packet to provide you easy access to hot water for drinking! Thank you again for choosing our hotel, please feel free to contact me should I be able to assist you in any way in the future. Sincerely, Darrell Buettner General Manager

Summary: This hotel is good for a nice little stay, within walking distance to Disneyland tram, walking distance to Disneyland & Downtown Disney. Parking is $14 a day which is cheaper than disney 'so parking left our car n walled to the free tram. It's  probably a 15 minute walk. The rooms are "cozy" but fits a family of four decently we didn't really stay in the room more than to sleep. Perfect for what we needed.
Manager Response: Hello Lisa H,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review! I am glad to hear our cozy rooms were a perfect fit for you and your family. Our location is close enough for a quick walk to Disney, which helps avoid having to drive or pay for their parking fee. We appreciate you choosing to stay with us and we look forward to seeing you again.  Warm regards,  Lynsey Marrinan  Front Office Supervisor

Summary: Checked in on 11-21-2015. W used Marriott points to book two rooms for this Holiday Week. Downsize was rooms not connected but on third floor with windows facing parking lot in rear that can easy view nightly Disney fireworks too.  Lobby is well lit with lots of seating for watching one of the TVs for news or sports. Coffee bar and breakfast set up each morning. CA must like weak coffee as I cannot find Strong coffee other than at a Starbucks.  14-15 minute walk down Walnut to Disney Way to Downtown Disney or get the ART shuttle pass from Desk. Arrainge a rental car from Select Auto rentals, they picked us up at lobby, took us to a best western where they office and we drove down to Legoland in Carlsbad, CA on Sunday. Place is full this week as its one of worst weeks to visit
Manager Response: Hello TallTex_Austin,  Thank you for writing a review about our hotel! Thatâ€™s great that you were able to get a room with a firework view. Iâ€™ll have to try some coffee from Texas and recommend it to management, because I love strong coffee too! Iâ€™m glad to hear that you were happy with the Select Rental Car service. We recommend them frequently and love to hear our guestâ€™s feedback. Thank you for staying with us and we hope to see you again soon (maybe when Disney doesnâ€™t have their holiday rush!).  Warm regards,  Lynsey Marrinan Front Office Supervisor

Summary: We stayed here on the weekend of November 20, 2015.  This hotel is pretty and clean.  The staff is very friendly.    My complaint is with the design of the room we stayed in (it had 2 queens and a pull-out).  We were 3 women participating in an event at Disneyland.  What was annoying to us, was the design of the bathroom.  The bathroom faces the beds and has a sliding glass door (which light, but not images, can permeate).  If someone had to use the restroom at night, the light would shine right through the door onto the beds.  The entire bathroom is all together, so if one of us wanted to use the sink and mirror to apply make-up, style hair, etc., no one else could use the shower or toilet in privacy.   Last year we stayed at the Fairfield Marriot and that design was great with
Manager Response: Hello Ellen P, Thank you for staying with us on your recent visit to Anaheim and for taking the opportunity to share about your experience with us here on TripAdvisor. Iâ€™m glad that you found our hotel to be clean and my staff to be friendly during your visit. I am sorry to hear that the layout and design of the bathroom created some challenges for your party when getting ready in the morning. We are currently testing a couple of different solutions for the bathroom doors to help prevent the light from coming through at night to determine what the best fix will be and we hope to have the solution in place in the first part of next year. I hope that our friendly Team and clean environment will convince you to come back and stay with us again next time youâ€™re in town, weâ€™d love to have you back again as our guest. Thank you again for staying with us and for the feedback. Sincerely, Darrell Buettner General Manager

Summary Heading: New Springhill Suites hotel within walking distance to Disneyland
Summary: The Springhill Suites by Marriott opened last year. A short two block walk gets you to the Disneyland Parking structure where you can take the free shuttle to the Disneyland entrance. There is also a shuttle service from the hotel to the main entrance that is available for a small cost ($2 for seniors with unlimited access for the full day). The rooms in the hotel are very nice and modern. They are larger than the typical hotel room. Although there was only two in our party the room would be large enough for a family with a couple of kids.There is a separated off area with a desk, couch and table as well as an alcove that contains a fridge and microwave. The bathroom is nice size. The hotel has four stories - there is an exercise room and pool. The hotel provides a free
Manager Response: Hello 062843,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. I couldnâ€™t have described the hotel better myself! We are a short walk from the Mickey and Friends parking structure, but the ART shuttle is an inexpensive alternative for guests who prefer not to walk. Our hotel opened last year with a modern design and spacious rooms. The rooms do include a desk, couch, mini-fridge, and microwave and I am delighted to know that you found everything clean and well-maintained. Thank you for recognizing Mayra for her service. She always strives to give our guests the best experience possible and we are grateful to have her on our team! We greatly appreciate your recommendation and we look forward to having you on your future visits.   Warm Regards,  Lynsey Marrinan  Front Office Supervisor

Summary: Staff was amazing - answered all questions, very friendly, wonderful atmosphere.  Room was great, had a fridge, stove, and microwave - lots of towels.  Complimentary hot and cold breakfast was very good and filling, lots of choices and varied day to day.  Had computer/printer access for check-ins as well as free wifi and free local calls.  Also had laundry facilities.  Incredible location - close to Disney tram - we walked (3 adults with a 6 & 8 year old)  Outdoor pool and hot tub were the perfect way to start or end the day.
Manager Response: Hello Leann O,  Thank you for reviewing our hotel! Itâ€™s great to hear that you had a pleasant encounter with the staff. Our team is always available to give suggestions or answer any questions you may have during your stay. It is our mission to provide our guests with excellent service, so I am glad that you had a great experience. Our rooms offer a variety of amenities, such as, the mini-fridge, microwave, and plenty of towels to accommodate your family. We look forward to seeing you again at our â€œincredible locationâ€ on your next vacation.   Warm regards,  Lynsey Marrinan  Front Office Supervisor

Summary: A nice modern hotel. Set in a peaceful and quiet road. Very good breakfast. Nice modern rooms and very spacious. Very clean. Friendly staff. Good fitness room. Had a microwave in the room that came handy when you buy some stuff from the small bar near the reception. Very good wifi connection.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: nice, big, clean room and bathroom
Summary: overall this is a good hotel for the price and location.  It was clean, not worn out and did not have the overpowering smell of cleaning solvent used in cheap hotels. The complimentary breakfast had cooked eggs along with oatmeal and the usual stuff.  To get to Disneyland, you take a short 10 minute walk thru the parking structure and then get on the parking garage shuttle to Downtown Disney - the shuttles run all the time, will very little standing and waiting.  My only complaint was the AC unit clunked noisily on and off all night - interrupting  our sleep.  You could open the window about 3 inches but this was not enough fresh air to cool the room, so you needed the AC, even in November.
Manager Response: Hello Goletian, We appreciate you taking the time to review our hotel! Thank you for noticing the cleanliness of the hotel, the housekeeping staff works very hard to maintain the appearance and nice smell. I am glad you had a chance to enjoy the complimentary full hot breakfast before your walk to Disneyland. The shortcut to the Mickey and Friends parking structure is the best way to go! I am sorry to hear about the AC being noisy during your stay. I will bring this up to the engineering manager to get this resolved right away. Thank you for choosing to stay with us and we hope to see you on your next trip in to Anaheim.  Warm regards,  Lynsey Marrinan Front Office Supervisor

Summary Heading: Very Nice Springhill Suites-All bases covered!!
Summary: Overall this is a typical Spring Hill Suites! What makes it stand out is the location in regards to Disneyland and the view from some rooms of the fireworks is really awesome.   Breakfast fare is fine. Most of the scrambled eggs at Spring Hill suites always seem different to me. A lot of locations serve them in plastic lined containers, I don't remember if this place does.   The rooms are clean and neat. I used the mobile check in app, but my room wasn't ready upon arrival and I waited in the lobby for 45 mins.   I walked to Disneyland twice and it is a bit far, but the exercise was fine.    No problems recommending this location or problem! The room layout is no different then any other.
Manager Response: Hello TravelingMan5989,  Thank you for reviewing our hotel! It is great to hear you enjoyed the room with a firework view. Our complimentary full hot breakfast has eggs available every morning along with bacon, sausage, and fresh waffles. I apologize for the wait on your room; typically if we have a full house the night before, then our guaranteed check-in time is 3:00 PM, even for mobile check-ins. The perks of being so close to Disneyland are not only the fireworks, but being within walking distance too! We appreciate your recommendation and we hope to see you again soon!   Warm Regards, Lynsey Marrinan Front Office Supervisor

Summary Heading: Completly LOVE this place for the kids
Summary: we live in LA so we take trips to Disney fairly often. Each time we have gone, I always try to get a room at this hotel. You can literally walk to Disney (which means no long lines, traffic or expensive parking) + the rooms are large enough for the kids to play and not be fighting for their own space. We have three kids (twins + a 5 yrs old) and they enjoy the breakfast and the fact that we can bring our puppy with us to the hotel. Love, Love, Love.
Manager Response: Hello Danielle R,  Thank you for taking the time to leave a review! We appreciate that you choose to stay with Springhill Suites when your travels bring you to Anaheim. It sounds like you may have stayed at our Springhill Suites Convention Center since we do not allow pets, but they do. We do have large rooms and a complimentary full hot breakfast, and weâ€™re also just a short walk to Disney. We hope that you choose to stay with us on your next trip and if you see this that youâ€™ll take the opportunity to review that hotel since it sounds like you really enjoyed your stay there.   Warm Regards,  Lynsey Marrinan  Front Office Supervisor

Summary Heading: good value, further from DL than desired
Summary: Stayed here with family in late August 2015. Acceptable service, polite staff. Very clean and new. Hotel located directly behind Mickey and Friends parking structure. You can walk through the structure and catch tram to park if you have a mobile group. However if you walk back in the dark there is part that is not lit. We chose to pay for the ART transit that picks up in front of hotel.   AC worked well. Hotel has modern decor, so you feel like you're in a boutique hotel. Breakfast (included) varied day to day which was nice. Always contained protein options as well as waffle bar and oatmeal. Pool was clean and not crowded.   Rooms are very large. Equipped with separate seeting area and TV.  Area also contained mini fridge and microwave. The double bed, room area had a walk in
Manager Response: none

Summary: It's a good decent family hotel. Staff was very friendly. They helped with any questions that you had. Breakfast buffet is included everyday. There is a small selection of warm foods and a waffle bar. Short shuttle to the park for a fee of roughly 5.00 per day for adults. The hotel is newer and not overly crowded.
Manager Response: Hello LosCabosWedding, Thank you for staying with us on your recent visit to Anaheim and for sharing some feedback with us here on TripAdvisor. Iâ€™m glad to hear that you found my Team to be friendly and that the hotel met the needs of your family trip. Our complimentary hot breakfast each morning is a great way to start your day off before you head over to a fun filled day in the parks, and the ART shuttle does certainly make it easy to get back and forth between the hotel and Disneyland! I hope that you enjoyed your time in Anaheim and that youâ€™ll be coming back to stay with us again next time you are in the area! Thank you again for choosing our hotel.  Sincerely, Darrell Buettner General Manager

Summary: I stayed here in October 2015. The room was very clean and modern.  There was lots of space which was really nice.  The breakfast was great. Lots of choices. Staff was super friendly and helpful. Would stay here again!
Manager Response: Hello kdejager30,  Thank you for reviewing our hotel. I am pleased to know you were happy with the clean, modern and spacious room! We try to keep a variety of foods at the complimentary breakfast, so I am glad you were able to enjoy that. The friendly staff here is looking forward to seeing you again on your future stay! We appreciate you staying with us.   Warm regards,  Lynsey Marrinan Front Office Supervisor

Summary: My family was greeted by the most wonderful young lady who was the supervisor. She made us feel welcomed and cared for. The staff is excellent, the hotel is clean and close to Disneyland.  WE WILL RECOMMEND THIS SPRINGHILL SUITES TO OUR FRIENDS AND FAMILY.
Manager Response: Hello Sharon_barela1,  Thank your taking the time and reviewing our hotel! I am grateful that I was the one to welcome your family to our hotel! We want everyone to feel as if our hotel is their home away from home, so it is a considerable compliment that I made you feel welcomed and cared for. We appreciate the recommendation to your friends and family! Feel free to contact me directly for future reservations. We look forward to seeing you again. Warm regards,  Lynsey Marrinan Front Office Supervisor

Summary Heading: Clean / New / Great FREE daily breakfast!
Summary: My husband, our 5 year old twins, my mom, and mother in law had a great stay at SpringHill Suites from Sept 28-Oct 4th. We were able to check in at Noon. The hotel is only a few years old I believe. The property and lobby, and rooms were all nice and clean and modern.  The beds were SUPER COMFY, nice and soft, just the way I like it, and pillows were great too. We shared a room with two queen beds - and a pull out sofa. It was enough room for all of us, and did not seem too squishy. Large walk in closet with a dresser and room to hang clothing, and another big dresser for clothing. The bathroom was large, with a big frosted glass sliding door. The pool and hot tub were great! I especially thought the daily complimentary breakfasts were great! lots to choose from. make your own
Manager Response: Hello noseball,  Thank you for all the wonderful compliments about your stay! Thatâ€™s great to hear we could get you and your family into the room early! You were close, but our hotel is under two years old. Iâ€™m thrilled you found the modern lobby, comfy beds, large closet, and large bathroom accommodating for you and your family. We strive to make your stay better by offering a variety of items at the breakfast buffet, so it is wonderful you were able to enjoy that. I am sorry that you had such a long walk to the park. After walking all day at Disneyland, I can see how a thirty minute walk back would be tough. We hope you do give us another shot, this way we can share with you our shortcut to the free tram ride to Disneyland. This walk is under ten minutes and much easier than walking to the main entrance. On the other hand, the ART shuttle is great alternative since it picks up and drops off in front of our hotel. Iâ€™m glad you had such a great stay with us and we hope to see all of you again soon!  Warm regards,  Lynsey Marrinan

Summary Heading: Be Prepared for Lot's of Kids and Families
Summary: A very busy hotel to say the least.....clean but the number of families with small children running the halls was overwhelming at times, and especially during the free breakfast hours.  We elected to eat out at the local coffee shop and had a much better meal in a much quieter environment. Overall, a good place to stay for a convention or for the Disney adventure.
Manager Response: Hello babsandmark9121, Thank you for sharing about your stay! I am pleased to hear you found our hotel to be clean and a great place to stay for conventions or trips to Disneyland. Being that we are so close to Disney, there are a lot of families with small children that stay with us and their excitement radiates throughout the hotel. I am sorry you were unable to try the complimentary breakfast buffet, but Anaheim is a great city with some nice local places to check out. Thank you for choosing to stay with us and we hope to see you back for your next trip!   Warm regards,  Lynsey Marrinan	 Front Office Supervisor

Summary: If you are looking for a hotel, that is walking distance to Disney (with a shuttle ride) this is perfect.  The continental breakfast was a great way to start the day before going to the Park.  It had cereal, sausage, bacon, scrabbled eggs, toast, bagel, pastries, muffins, oatmeal, waffles, fruit, yogurt, milk, juice, coffee and hot chocolate.   The rooms were clean, and the pool was nice and fun for kids to play in.   I wouldn't recommend walking to the gates of Disneyland, but you can walk 10 minutes and get onto the shuttle from the parking structure, which will take you right to the entrance by downtown Disney.   There is a fridge and microwave in the rooms.   We had the hotel call us a cab, which I would not recommend getting the front desk to do.  There was 3 of us, and we
Manager Response: Hello LemonCalgary,   We appreciate you taking the time to review our hotel. I am happy to hear the wide variety of items at our full hot breakfast buffet started your morning off the right way! Thatâ€™s great that you and your children were able to enjoy the pool after your trip to Disney! I completely agree with you, after walking all day at Disney the shortcut to the parking structure and tram is the one of the best ways to go. The ART shuttle is another great option. The shuttle picks up in front of our hotel and drops you off near the entrance of Disneyland. I apologize that you found the rate of the taxi fare too high, I certainly wouldnâ€™t want to pay double. We try to use a luxury car service for our guests that has the same rates as a regular taxi, so a van is not their typical mode of transportation. We always want to do what is best for you, so the feedback is appreciated and we will contact the company about this. Thank you for staying with us and we hope to see you back soon! Lynsey Marrinan Front Office Supervisor

Summary: Staff was super friendly and very helpful.  Rooms were nice and clean.  Breakfast was good and they kept it stocked, so even if you got there close to when they were shutting it down, there was still plenty left to choose from.
Manager Response: Hello Kathy K,  Thank you for reviewing our hotel. Iâ€™m glad the super friendly staff, clean room, and well stocked breakfast made your stay more enjoyable. We hope to see you again soon the next time you are in Anaheim. Thank you for staying with us! Warm Regards,  Lynsey Marrinan Front Office Supervisor

Summary: On October 11 I called down to the Hotel and Lindsay answered the phone, I explained to her that I was looking to surprise my friend with a romantic evening.  I told her I was looking for some rose pedals and champagne. Lindsay had mentioned she would have to check with her management and call me back with authorization and a price.  Lindsay called me back the very next day and told me it was all set. The entire stay was amazing, and my now girlfriend was in tears this past Saturday evening all because Lindsay delivered on her promise.  Thank You so much Lindsay, it is because of Customers Service Experts like you that I will always choose a Marriott and especially a SpringHill when I need a Hotel.   Thanks again,  Brad Card Portland, OR
Manager Response: Bradley C.  Thank you for taking the time to leave a review about our hotel.  I was very glad to hear that Lynsey really made a special moment for your girlfriend. At the hotel we get to spend many anniversaries and birthdays with our guests. We love to do what we can to make those memories extra special.  We are really grateful to be a part of the magic. We hope you will come visit us again and should you need anything in the future please let us know. Sincerely, Jason Bell Front Office Manger

Summary: Staff was excellent especially Mayra Food was good  Room clean Alittle farther but worth the extra minutes to have clean room and newer place with breakfast We used ART worked good  At night the walk was good to unwind
Manager Response: Hello Eileen B,  	Thank you for taking the time to write a review about your stay with us! Recognizing Mayra for her excellent service is a wonderful compliment to her, as well as our entire team.  I am delighted to hear you enjoyed your new, clean room and the complimentary breakfast. I do agree that the ART shuttle is a great way to get around, but we are close enough for a stroll back to the hotel, which is a nice idea for unwinding! We are grateful for you choosing to stay with us. Please do not hesitate to contact us for your future reservations.  Warm regards,  Lynsey Marrinan

Summary Heading: Nice place with a couple minor problems
Summary: Wish they provided their own shuttle to Disney rather than the ART bus - services too many local hotels on too small of buses.  Also, didn't risk the morning buffet - too many kids coughing on the food.
Manager Response: Hello 199nancy,  	We appreciate you reviewing our hotel. We aim to make your stay as pleasant as possible, so we will take your suggestion of providing our own shuttle service into consideration. Even though the ART shuttle picks up every twenty minutes, the buses tend to fill up quickly during peak hours. Iâ€™m sorry to hear you were unable to try the complimentary breakfast buffet. Our breakfast team works hard to maintain a clean and enjoyable breakfast experience, so we do hope you try it out next time. Thank you so much for staying with us and we hope to be your first choice the next time you are in Anaheim.  Warm regards,  Lynsey Marrinan

Summary: We stayed here in September 2015 and loved it.  From the friendly front desk clerks to the large room and great breakfast we couldn't have asked for more.  It is walking distance to Disneyland although the ART stops right in front of the hotel as well.  The pool was also nice to cool off after a long day at the park.  Would highly recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: Hello geocam2015, 	Thank you so much for taking the time to review our hotel.  I am happy to hear you enjoyed the large room, great breakfast and friendly front desk clerks! I know those days at Disneyland can be long, so it is great that you were able to relax in the pool for a while. We appreciate you staying with us and recommending us. We hope to see you back soon for your next Disneyland vacation! Warm regards,  Lynsey Marrinan

Summary: Fireworks view based upon request at check in. Our room had a wonderful view. Loved everything the hotel had to offer. The entire staff is amazing. Breakfast was great. We booked with Get Away Today. Great pricing
Manager Response: Hello Christy84403,  Thank you for taking the time out of your busy schedule to review our hotel. We're pleased that you enjoyed our amazing staff, delicious breakfast and wonderful views on the Disneyland Fireworks. I know my staff and I would love to have you come back again soon. Until then, we wish you safe travels wherever you journey takes you.  Sincerely, Jason Bell Front Office Manager

Summary: I've stayed at SpringHill Suites twice and have enjoyed both times. I've stayed there for the Disney half marathon and the hotel is extremely close to Downtown Disney and the parks. The hotel offers good parking options and a free breakfast. The rooms have always been clean and very spacious. The staff is always friendly and very helpful (I forgot my toothbrush last time and they had an extra one and toothpaste for me:). Highly recommend the hotel to anyone.
Manager Response: Marty T, Thank you for taking the time to share your experience while staying with us here at the Springhill Suites Anaheim Maingate! We are glad that you have enjoyed the friendliness of our staff and that you are pleased with the cleanliness of our rooms. It seems that there's always something going on around Disney and we are thrilled you made us a part of your experience. We hope to see you real soon, perhaps for the next Disney half marathon.  Sincerely,  Jason Bell Front Office Manager

Summary: I highly recommend staying here.  The staff are excellent. The rooms are great.  The free continental breakfast is good.  Hotel has free WIFI.   It's about a 15 walk to Disneyland, but you can take the ART shuttle if you don't feel like walking.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with the Trip Advisor Community! We're so happy that you enjoyed your time with us and got to experience a few of the many amenities we have available to our guests, we hope to see you again the next time your travels bring you to Anaheim.  Sincerely,  Jason Bell Front Office Manager

Summary: This is a nice hotel. Very clean, well maintained. Would recommend staying here. Especially if you are visiting Disneyland. Its super close and convenient. Not too far after hard play all day. The free breakfast is pretty good also.
Manager Response: Cody S  Thank you for taking the time to post a review of our hotel.  Our staff strives every day to meet and exceed all our guestsâ€™ expectations.  Iâ€™m so delighted to hear that you and your guests needs and expectations were fulfilled during your recent stay with us! If you and your guests find yourself traveling to the Anaheim area again, our doors will always be open. From all of our staff, thanks again for choosing to stay with us here at the Springhill Suites Anaheim Maingate and hopefully we will see you in the near future! Best regards, Jason Bell  Front Office Manager

Summary: We decided at the last minute to drive straight through to Anaheim from Tucson, AZ and the hotel we had booked for our 3-day Disneyland trip was full that night. We then booked a flash deal with a secondary vendor and ended up with SpringHill Suites Maingate in Anaheim.   I called ahead to let the hotel staff know that we would be arriving several hours after check in. When we finally arrived at the hotel, we were greeted by friendly front desk staff. Parking was easy to find and we made our way to our room. The beds were comfortable, shower was hot, and there was nothing else we needed for our less than 12 hour stay. We were slightly disappointed to hear that the breakfast didn't start as early as we needed for our very early morning, but I would definitely recommend the hotel
Manager Response: Meghan M No matter what brings you to Anaheim, even if it is for a brief 12 hours. We are honored that you chose to stay with us.  I know parking at many hotels can be a nightmare if you come in late. Iâ€™m glad parking at our hotel was easy and convenient.  Add in comfortable beds, a great staff and the peace of mind that comes with staying at a Marriott you can be assured of a great stay.  I hope your travels will bring you back our way again soon and please contact us if there is anything else we can assist you with.  Sincerely, Jason Bell Front office Manager

Summary: Every time we come to Disneyland we stay at Springhill Suites they have a great fireworks view, free good breakfast and it's very close to the park. Always Very clean and the staff is friendly and helpful never had a bad experience here. We love it her.
Manager Response: Hello Nick A Thank you for taking the time to share your recent experience in Anaheim. We are so happy that you have chosen us as your Disneyland vacation hotel time after time.  We strive to make vacationing simple by providing complimentary breakfast with a verity of options, great staff and comfortable beds. You really canâ€™t go wrong staying at the Springhill Suites Anaheim Maingate. We hope you made some great new memories and look forward to seeing you many more times in the future.  Sincerely, Jason Bell Front office Manager

Summary: Such an amazing room.. Most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. New clean and amazing..We stayed week while going to Disneyland. A+ Was close enough to walk to Disneyland, but by end of the week we sprung for the shuttle service.
Manager Response: Shane C Thank you for taking the time to share your great experience with us. We know how important it is to come back after a long day at Disney to a comfortable bed and a fresh clean room. I was glad that we didnâ€™t disappoint and got your A+ score.  We hope you enjoyed your vacation and invite you and your family to come and stay with us again, whenever your travels bring you back to Anaheim. Sincerely,  Jason Bell Front Office Manager

Summary Heading: the worst experience I had ever have with a hotel
Summary: We stay at SpringHill Suites Anaheim Maingate for a week, and left my  iPhone in room and when I returned home and called them back, the front desk let me call GM, left msg, no one call me back!! One week, and same breakfast ever single day, no change.  And also I lost my own towel in the room....And the Wifi is sooo slow!
Manager Response: Hello H, Thank you for staying with us on your recent visit to Anaheim and for sharing your feedback with us here on TripAdvisor. I did receive your voicemail from last weekend regarding the lost iPhone from your stay with us. I did check with our Executive Housekeeper and unfortunately our housekeeping team did not find it when cleaning your room after you left, additionally we did double check around the sofa bed as you suggested but it was not there. I left a voice message on the contact number I was provided apologizing that we were unable to find your lost phone, Iâ€™m sorry that you did not receive that message. Again, I am terribly sorry that we were unable to retrieve your lost iPhone. I do understand how frustrating it can be to misplace something and feel like no one is responding to you. Guests frequently forget or misplace their personal items and we always try to do our best to locate and return them for you whenever possible. If you would like to discuss this matter further or if I could be any assistance to you in the future, please feel free to contact me directly. Thank you again for staying with us, I do hope weâ€™ll have the opportunity to have you as a guest again in the future. Sincerely, Darrell Buettner General Manager (714)215-4000

Summary: For being a relatively new hotel, I could not believe the noise of the air conditioner. When we were here for two nights, it was a record-breaking heat day in Anaheim. Therefore, the AC was running constantly. It literally roared when it was on and to top it off, it blew right on the person sleeping on that side of the bed. I'm sure the turnover here is quite high, but the hotel is showing signs of being worn down. The breakfast is truly awful. I'm giving this hotel two stars only for the very nice staff here. The two gentlemen at the front desk on our check in could not be nicer and they even helped us when we needed to scan a letter. Check out other properties if you value sleep.
Manager Response: Hello laplume9254, Thank you for taking the opportunity to share some feedback on your recent stay at my hotel. Iâ€™m very glad to hear that team at the front desk took good care of you when checking in and were able to assist you with scanning your letter. I am sorry that the air conditioner created a nuisance for you and prevented you from getting a good nightâ€™s sleep. I understand how important it is not only to have a comfortable room temperature, but also a good nightâ€™s rest when traveling. I have shared your comments with my maintenance team to see if we can help mitigate the sound of the air conditioners in our guest rooms particularly during periods of extreme heat when they will be working continuously.  Again, I thank you for choosing our hotel and for providing us this valuable feedback.
