Summary: We ended up changing hotels midway through our vacation. Our trip was extended at the last minute and our current hotel was booked up. We were reluctant to change hotels but now we are so glad we did. We were so pleasantly surprised at the cleanliness and service at SpringHill Suites. The breakfast was great, the room was large with a nice big closet. The color scheme was bright and modern. My kids were so impressed to stay somewhere that felt clean, nice, and light. We will definitely be returning.
Manager Response: Good evening Amy H,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel, we were glad to have you stay with us! One of my favorite things about the Springhill Suites brand is the vibrant and modern color scheme that helps to relax while on vacation. We hope to see you again next time and give us a call and we will try our best to place you in the same room as this stay!  Sincerely,  Javier Urrutia Front Desk Supervisor

Summary Heading: Great Location for a Family Vacation to Disneyland!!
Summary: I try to find Marriott Hotels so I could earn points with my membership and this one caught my attention ( thanks to one of the reviews I read prior to booking ) It is new and the Queen suites were spacious for a family of 4 or 5 ,has 2 queen size beds,has a separate pull out sofa and coffee table with with microwave and refrigerator Breakfast was included which helped a big family of mine ( booked 3 rooms for the New Year's Eve celebration in Disneyland ) save some money on meals ...and the best was the proximity of the hotel to the Mickey and Friends tram ride to the front of Dusneyland resort ( just make a right from the hotel and right at the stoplight. That leads you to the employee parking lot , go up 2nd floor that has a walkway to the tram rides)!!!
Manager Response: Ms. Madelyn L, thank you for your wonderful comments about our hotel. It is loyal guest like you that make Marriott one of the best in the industry. Our believe our members are the greatest bar none. I hope you had a great new yearâ€™s celebration and I wish you the best in 2015. Hope to see you again soon.   Sincerely   Jason Bell  Front Office Manager

Summary: What a fantastic place to stay!  The front desk staff is so friendly, and they all seem to have a great memory!  They participated in a Xmas surprise we had planned, and always made the kids feel special!  The breakfast was fantastic everyday!  Grab breakfast before getting on the bus to the park...definitely worth it!   The ART (disneyland transfer) stops right in front of the hotel...right outside the door!  Grab your ART tickets at the front desk before getting on the bus...saves time and money!  This hotel is in a great location for this transfer because, once they pick you up, they stop at one more place then head to DL...on the way back, they stop at one place, then this Springhill!  So you are never on the bus for more than a few minutes! They have a small market place
Manager Response: Hello 2thtek Thank you for taking the time to tell us about your recent stay. I was so glad to hear that you had an amazing time and thank you for letting us be a part of your Xmas surprise. Iâ€™m sorry we do not have a restaurant on property. However Downtown Disney is only a short 10 -15 min walk away for restaurants and entertainment.  Downtown Disney also offers 3 hour complimentary parking. Also, if you eat at any of Disney many restaurants they will validate for an addition 2 hours.  I wish you the best in 2015 and we looking forward to seeing you and your family again soon.   Sincerely,  Jason Bell Front Office Manager

Summary Heading: A shiny veneer conceals some serious design flaws
Summary: I believe this hotel opened fairly recently (within the past year), so all of the rooms and facilities are new and show little signs of wear. The lobby is nice with spacious seating for the daily breakfast. This place quickly goes downhill, however, once you spend a night in any of the rooms. My family (myself, wife, son aged 5, and daughter almost 3) was initially given a room with no bathtub, which does not mesh well with keeping young children clean. The problem was promptly corrected by a new room assignment, but if this one was representative it is clear that many corners were cut in the construction and design of this hotel.   First, the desk and seating area is separated from the sleeping area by a short wall with three glass panes that move, and when walking around the
Manager Response: Hello Norman B,  Thank you for staying with us your recent trip to Disneyland with your family, Iâ€™m glad to hear that you found our staff here to be friendly and responsive to your needs. As you mentioned in your review, not all of our suites are furnished with bathtubs, but if you let us know in advance that you would like one weâ€™ll happily do our best to accommodate your request. Likewise if youâ€™re sensitive to surrounding noise weâ€™d be happy to assign you a quiet room for your stay with us. We understand that this is a subjective topic and we always strive to make each guest as comfortable as possible. Requesting rooms without connecting doors, or corner end rooms will always help limit exposure to hearing your neighbors for those of us who like a little extra peace and quiet. Once again, thank you for staying with I hope you enjoyed your time in Anaheim.  Sincerely, Darrell Buettner General Manager

Summary Heading: Awesome hotel really good hotel A++++++
Summary: We stayed here for our disneyland trip to Anaheim and wow our room was awesome super clean super nice and everything.the wifi and the hotel was really cool it had really great coverage i actually thought i was using mine from home super fast. breakfast was awesome,and it was like 2 blocks away from disneyland theme park overall an awesome hotel really recommended!!!!!!!!!
Manager Response: Good evening Arturo A,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. I want to thank you for all the nice comments which Iâ€™ll definitely pass on to our housekeeping staff who does a wonderful job ensuring cleanliness. Our close proximity to the parks at a reasonable price makes us an ideal hotel to stay at. We hope to see you again the next time youâ€™re in the area!  Sincerely, Javier Urrutia Front Desk Supervisor

Summary Heading: Excellent for stay if you are visiting Disneyland
Summary: With a visit to Disneyland and the Adventure Park taking more than one day to complete (usually 3 days if you really want to experience both parks fully), staying at a nearby hotel is the way to go, even for locals. Springhill Suites offers a comfortable stay and a short (10 minute) walk to the theme parks' tram station. You would save the $17 parking free at Disneyland if you walk there. Parking at the hotel was adequate and free (a nice touch).  The rooms are reasonably spacious and clean and comes with free Wifi. The front desk staff were kind to give my family adjoining rooms. A special treat was the view to the nightly fireworks display from Disneyland (rooms 308/309 i think).  I would have given 5 stars if the breakfast was any better. The eggs were overcooked, bacon hard
Manager Response: Good evening Reddotter,  Thank you for your recent stay with us and for your feedback! In my personal experience a 3 day pass is ideal since each park can be adequately explored in a day and a half each. Iâ€™m glad we are able to accommodate your request and hope to see you again for your next Disneyland trip!  Sincerely, Javier Urrutia Front Desk Supervisor

Summary: Stayed in a 2 queen bedroom during our Disneyland trip. This hotel was one of the nicer ones I've stayed in, rooms clean, staff friendly. We took the ART to the parks and paid $5 each for a one-day ART ticket. No complaints and would stay here again for sure.
Manager Response: Leanna P Thank you for your recent stay with us. We try each and every day to meet and exceed all of our guest expectation. Iâ€™m glad we were able to make your stay a truly enjoyable one and we hope to see you again soon.  Until then Jason Bell Front Office Manager

Summary: This is a very nice hotel and the walk to Disneyland is not bad but would be harder for an older person.  They do have the ART stop so you can take the bus for a small charge.  The hotel is very clean and the people at the front desk are wonderful.  I would highly recommend this hotel to my clients.
Manager Response: Good evening Anabella19,  Thank you for your recent stay and for taking the time to review our hotel. I understand that for our older guests a walk is a bit more difficult however, the Art shuttle does offer discounted shuttle passes for senior citizens for only $2 for a 1 day pass. We look forward to seeing you again, or anyone you recommend!  Sincerely, Javier Urrutia Front Desk Supervisor

Summary Heading: Excellent - One of the best! Ask for room 408.
Summary: I have stayed in many hotels across the USA and in other countries and this is one of the best I have stayed in. It is conveniently located to Disneyland and is a short 5 minute ride to the main gate. The hotel is newer and offers a bright and inviting environment. The staff was very personable and everyone (staff) we interacted with was engaging and helpful. The public area was clean, open and refreshing. I enjoyed the 'fire pit' outside of the entrance- it was comfortable and relaxing. Our room was very comfortable and clean, and we really enjoyed the 'suite' area - sofa, refrigerator, desk. The complimentary breakfast was great. There is a charge for parking. We had a top floor that allowed us to see the Disneyland fireworks from the window in our room. There is no restaurant
Manager Response: Good evening RMDL1,  We greatly appreciate such praise since we strive to be the best and favorite of all guests! While most are here for Disneyland, we do understand people want a break and we do have several tour partners that pick up at the hotel and drop you back off. For those who want a bit of Hollywood, there's tours that take you to the Hollywood boulevard as well as plenty of other stops such as theme parks in San Diego! Next time you're in the area give us a call and we can help you book other options to truly explore Southern California.  Sincerely, Javier Urrutia Front Desk Supervisor

Summary Heading: Great Family Hotel with easy access to Disneyland
Summary: We really enjoyed our stay at the Springhill Suites Maingate. Our family of five has outgrown a regular hotel room and the space in the suites here was great for us. I really liked the closet space and the layout for our week-long stay. The breakfast options were great. The staff was very friendly and helpful, we had an issue with our room the first night that they were quick to resolve. They went above our expectations and we really appreciated it! We walked to Disneyland every day, from the hotel to the tram only took about 5 minutes. We will be staying here again.
Manager Response: Good evening UtahTraveler78!  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel we greatly appreciate your kind comments! Springhill Suites as a brand has great rooms that are 25% larger than the standard studio suite size, making it an ideal room for bigger families. We look forward to seeing you again in the near future.  Sincerely, Javier Urrutia Front Desk Supervisor

Summary Heading: Value for money with great service
Summary: This was our first time to disneyland, and after searching through all the hotels in Anaheim, we settled for Springhill Suites and I would recommend this hotel for great stay to anyone who is travelling to disneyland. Disneyland downtown shopping is just 10min walk, you have super shuttle take you from LAX to the hotel at just $17 per person, and once you are staying at the hotel, they have Blue star taxi service who are great value for money, and good service if you need to go shopping at Block of Orange. To get to Disneyland you have to buy a $5 pass that last you whole day regardless of number of trips. Overall its the best hotel with great value for money and staff were great. Will go back again next year, looking forward to it. GTZ, Australia.
Manager Response: Good evening Gozec!  It was a pleasure having you here and thank you for taking the time to review our hotel! While LAX is a fair distance away, supershuttle is a great rideshare service that can get you to us for as low as 17 a person. A 1 day pass is only $5 per adult but if you're going to use the ART shuttle on consecutive days we also have the 3 day pass for only $12 or the 5 day pass for only $20. We look forward to seeing you again next time and making your stay just as wonderful as this time!  Sincerely, Javier Urrutia Front Desk Supervisor

Summary: Great value with a hot breakfast with lots of choices included in the stay. Modern, clean rooms include a mini fridge and microwave, plus a separate sitting area. Very convenient for those with a baby/toddler in a crib. We could watch the nightly fireworks from our window! All that, plus it's convenient for Disneyland guests on the ART Shuttle route. This place is fantastic!
Manager Response: Cyndi D  Thank you for taking the time to write about your stay. We know you have many things buying for your time. It sounds like you had a wonderful time at Disneyland and made good use of our amenities and views.  Seeing the fireworks from your room and when itâ€™s all over, turning around to go to bed. It is the best feeling. It is also good for young ones who may not make it till closing time at Disney.  I hope you will come and see us again soon. If you need anything thing until then please donâ€™t hesitate to ask.   Jason Bell Front Office Manager

Summary: This hotel is newer which is nice. Not quite up to the Marriott standards, which we have come to expect over the years. The best reason we could come up with for that is that it is the clients it caters to.(lots of small children and irresponsible parents) the breakfast staff isn't the kindest or very helpful. breakfast is pretty much always packed with people unless you are there at about 5 minutes after they open it in the morning. we never encountered any housekeeping staff. but all of the front desk staff is amazing. you will want to buy an A.R.T pass to get around town. it will make life much easier. The neighborhood its in is a bit questionable, mostly at night. One evening while waiting for the bus we were approached by a man asking for money. which was a little
Manager Response: Grlnxdor  It was a pleasure to have you and your family stay with us.  I hope it was an enjoyable Disney  vacation. As you mentioned the ART shuttle is a life saver after you have walked untold miles around the Disney Resort.  I was also glad to hear that our front desk staff took good care of you. They have a wealth of knowledge about the local area and all things Disney. However, I would like to apologize that you felt some parts of your stay were not up to Marriott Standards. I hope you will give us another chance to give you the service that you deserve.   Until next time Happy Holidays.  Jason Bell Front Office Manager

Summary: Reasons for Choice of Hotel: This was our first trip to Disneyland & so after much research, I decided to go with this hotel as it seemed to be the cleanest, newest, brightest, with a large room (for a couple & teenage child the 2 queen beds were great), hi speed wi-fi (to continue working on our business), with tea/coffee making facilities.  It was located in a quiet area away from the busy Santa Ana Fwy & there was a shuttle bus to & from Disneyland.  Also on Trip Advisor reviews, the GM Darrell Buettner always responded in a way which showed that he cared & was prepared to put the time into customer service (unfortunately I did not have the opportunity to meet him).  Arrival & Reception Check-In: We arrived from LAX at about 9am prepared to store our luggage until check-in
Manager Response: Hello timbertoby  I really enjoyed reading your review about your recent stay with us. I appreciate the feedback and I was glad to hear that you had such a great time on your Vacation to Disneyland.  My staff and I work hard to make sure that you  and your family can relax and have a stress free vacation. Our hotel has many great amenities and features and it seems you made good use of them. I hope you well come back and see us again soon and thank you for recommending our hotel.  Sincerely  Jason Bell Front Office Manager

Summary: We stayed here for 10 nights and we really pleased with the hotel.  It was so nice and clean and the rooms were quite big and plenty of room.  The housekeeping staff were nice and friendly and the front desk staff were so helpful.  The free breakfast was very simple but just what you needed.  I couldn't hear anyone next door and there wasn't any noise. Free Wifi was a bonus.  I would recommend this hotel to anyone.
Manager Response: Joshtherock  I am so glad you chose to stay with us on your trip away from home.  My staff and I really enjoyed having you here and it was great getting to know you and your family. I hope you will come back to see us again soon and thank you so much for telling your friends and family about our hotel. 	  Sincerely,  Jason Bell  Front Desk Manager

Summary Heading: Comfortable Stay, however ask if the pool heat is on
Summary: We stayed three nights. We loved the space that the rooms offered. Beds were extremely comfortable and the bathrooms were modern and clean. Also the towels in the bathroom were very soft!  The rooms don't have the typical hotel musty smell. It felt very clean and comfortable.  Breakfast was excellent!  Our only concern was the we wanted to enjoy the pool but found out that the heat had been shut off.  Not sure why this was the case but it was so cold that we could not enjoy it at all. By the time they turned the heat on it took a full day to get warm and by then we had to leave. Also the hot tub was very small and when turned on there was a lot of foam.  Sorry Springhill, but I have to say that with the price of rooms, I hope that you put some more effort/maintenance into
Manager Response: Good evening Travel-amt!  I want to thank you for your recent stay and for providing us honest feedback. We strive to ensure cleanliness and comfort for each of our guests. Weâ€™re sorry there was an issue with the pool during your stay but we thank you for letting us know so we could address the issue. Unfortunately, maintenance issues do happen from time to time but we will work to ensure our guests can fully use our amenities during their stay. Next time youâ€™re in the area donâ€™t hesitate to call us and we will make the next visit is perfect.   Sincerely, Javier Urrutia Front Desk Supervisor

Summary: Loved this hotel. It is very modern. The beds super cozy, it was clean and comfortable. The walls were a little thin, you could hear people out in the hallway and in the room next door, but they might have been exceptionally loud!  The breakfast was good, the customer service excellent. Great location for Disney, long block to the trams, better to walk than wait for the shuttle or you can drive around the block and park in the parking structure.
Manager Response: Good afternoon Suzeego!  Thank you for your recent stay with us and for taking the time to review us. Itâ€™s a short 10 minute walk to the tram and like you said, you can always drive to the parking lot. We recommend the walk instead of driving yourself since youâ€™ll still be taking the tram to the park itself even when you drive. However, weâ€™re glad you have plenty of options on getting to the park. Hopefully weâ€™ll see you again!  Sincerely Javier Urrutia Front Desk Supervisor

Summary: Good suite hotel located a very short shuttle bus ride from the main gates to Disneyland and California Adventure .We stayed 7 nights ,very comfortable room with two queen beds. Hotel had a pool and hot tub. In the morning the lobby area is a breakfast room, with complimentary hot breakfast. Very good value would stay here again if in the Disneyland area.
Manager Response: Good afternoon Brian S!  I want to thank you for taking the time to review us and Iâ€™m glad you enjoyed your week with us. I think we offer just the right amenities for a Disney trip and hopefully weâ€™ll see you again next time youâ€™re in the area!  Sincerely Javier Urrutia Front Desk Supervisor

Summary Heading: Super friendly staff and fantastic rooms
Summary: We arrived at the hotel way earlier than check in (after sitting in horrible traffic because a Disney 1/2 marathon ---took us 45 minutes to go 1 mile! We stopped in to see if we could just park there for now and check in later. The front desk staff was soooo friendly and found out there was a room available and allowed us to check in early! It allowed me to feel at ease knowing all our luggage and personal belongings were locked in a room and not in my truck while we were at Disneyland. The room was spacious, bright and welcoming. Large bathroom. We  loved the room and actually wish we had more time to spend in it! The beds were great and extremely comfortable! Break fast in the morning was good was well. Lots and lots to pick from. So much better than just Danishes that you
Manager Response: Asmith05 thank you for taking the time to let us know about your stay. We try to accommodate early check-in request and I am glad a room was available for you so you didnâ€™t have to worry about your things. We want you to start your vacation and be at ease especially after battling the traffic to get here.  I hope your had some time to visit the pool while you were here but it sounds like you were go go go on this trip. I hope you had a lot of fun and I am looking forward to seeing you on your next trip to Disneyland.  Front Office Manager Jason Bell

Summary Heading: Nice small hotel close to Disneyland but check your bill
Summary: This is a newer property located behind the parking garage for Disneyland. We had a nice stay but experienced charges not being properly billed and 3 calls did not correct the problem. They have friendly but inexperienced desk clerks. The rooms were large with modern and simple decor. The bathroom is large and has nice bath products. There is a fridge, microwave, safe and coffee service. The breakfast was good usual free hotel food. They have a nice eating area. It is a mile walk to Disney main gate. You can walk to the parking garage and take the tram to Downtown Disney for free. This is a good alternative to the Disney resorts but check your bill before you leave.
Manager Response: Hello davsuze,  Thank you for staying with us on your recent visit to Disneyland and for sharing your experience here on TripAdvisor. Iâ€™m glad that you found our rooms to be spacious and that you appreciated the Paul Mitchell bath amenities that we provide, and thank you for providing that fantastic tip on connecting to the free tram by the parking structure! I apologize for any inaccuracy in your final bill and that it has not yet been resolved, please contact me directly and I will personally look into getting this resolved for you. I look forward to hearing from you so that we can make this right for you, weâ€™d love to have you back again as one of our guests.  Sincerely, Darrell Buettner General Manager (714)215-4000

Summary: We stayed here with our family for 2 nights. This property is neatly tucked away off the main road. The train is very close however we didn't hear it. The rooms are spacious and kept very clean. The staff was super friendly and was always eager to help. The parking lot was safe and well lit. We will stay here again soon. There are also many local restaurants within walking distance. Highly recommend!!!!
Manager Response: Hello pj_1216, Thank you for taking the time to post this great review our hotel here on TripAdvisor. While many aspects of your experience seem to fit our hotel such as the clean, spacious rooms and friendly staff, Iâ€™m not sure that this review is meant for my hotel. While good local dining is just a short 10 minute walk from our hotel at Downtown Disney, we are not located near any train tracks. I hope that if you see this you get the opportunity to review the hotel which you stayed at, it sounds like they did a great job taking care of you! If you are ever in the Anaheim area please keep us in mind, weâ€™d love to have you come stay here with us! Sincerely, Darrell Buettner General Manager

Summary: I stayed at the Springhill Suites for 3 nights over Veterans Day weekend. The property is less than one year old. We had a suite that slept 6 and it had more than enough room. The property also has a gym, swimming pool and provides free breakfast and free Wi fi. It is a 10 minute walk to Disneyland. The beds were excellent and the room was very clean. The price was very good especially with all the amenities provided. I will be staying here again and highly recommend it.
Manager Response: David S. I was excited to hear that you had a wonderful stay with us on your recent stay. My staff and I do our best to provide great value for our guests. Which include the things you mentioned: Enough room for all, complimentary breakfast and an attentive and helpfull staff.  I hope we will be seeing you again soon. Until then, if there is anything we can assist you with please donâ€™t hesitate to ask.  Front Office Manager Jason Bell

Summary Heading: Plenty of space and nice amenities
Summary: The hotel was clean and modern. 2 queen beds and 1 sofa bed - can easily accommodate 5 people.   Good size closet and bathroom. Convenient parking around the building. Stay on the first floor if you have a large group and lost of bags to carry.    The mini-fridge and microwave was a nice convenience. The complimentary breakfast was adequate - gets the job done.  Even though "Maingate" is in the name of the hotel, it's a long walk to Disneyland.
Manager Response: Hello jjjps First off thank you for posting your comments on trip advisor. We love hearing feedback from our guests. I am glad you found your room comfortable and relaxing with some of the conveniences of home like the microwave and fridge. I do apologize that you felt it was a long walk to Disneyland. It is a 20 min walk from our hotel but I would recommend the 10 minute walk to the Mickey and Friends Tram. This is a complimentary tram that will take you to the park entrance. We also have the ART shuttle available that pick guests up from our hotel and brings you to the transportation center at Disneyland. The cost for an all-day pass is $5 for an adult and $2 for a child (3-9). Multi day tickets are also available in 3 and 5 day increments.  I hope you enjoyed your trip and we look forward to seeing you on your next vacation to Disneyland.  Front Office Manager Jason Bell

Summary Heading: family friendly, great location for viewing Fireworks on patio with Firepit
Summary: we just returned from our stay in Disneyland for 7 nights at Springhill suites. The hotel has very helpful front desk staff and friendly breakfast staff. We watched the fireworks in our pyjamas from the front patio beside the warm fire pit. Breakfast is included and had a great waffle station where our kids made their own waffles nearly every morning. The pool and hot tub were used nearly every day as well by our kids and there were always towels available. Parking was easy and included in our hotel stay - nice savings there. The hotel is in an  great location for Disneyland, Orange County Shopping outlets, and the freeway ( but not too close that you hear it)..We had a problem with our air conditioner in our room so the hotel manager upgraded us to another room and had the
Manager Response: Good evening JoannJ04,  Thank you for your recent stay with us and for your honest feedback. Weâ€™re glad you enjoyed your week long vacation. Thereâ€™s something about being by a warm fire place watching the great fireworks show Disney puts on each night that you just canâ€™t beat. Weâ€™re sorry you initially had an issue with your AC, but gladly our manager was able to quickly resolve it. We hope to see you again in the future!   Javier Urrutia Front Desk Supervisor

Summary: We've stayed at mariott hotel before which included breakfast and paid for parking.  This place appealed to us because it offered 2 queen beds and a sofa bed for 5 people.  I knew it was a studio set up with a desk separation between the beds and the sofa bed, but the pictures didn't show where the bathroom was located.  It has a pocket door situated right in front of the 2 beds with a frosted glass door, so when someone was in there in the middle of the night it was so bright that woke everyone up.  The pocket door was quite loud when sliding.  The bathroom was long and narrow.  The showers water sprayed so high and wide that it was hard to rinse off.  The free breakfast was very disappointing.  We went down to eat about 8:30 and they were out of eggs and bacon and they didn't
Manager Response: Good evening Maui702,  Thank you for your recent stay and for providing us with feedback. Iâ€™m sorry that we did not meet your standards and from the sound of it we certainly did not meet our own. I will be sure to review these issues with our breakfast staff to ensure prompt replenishing of items. If an item does require replenishing feel free to remind not only the breakfast staff but the front desk staff as well so we may get on it immediately. We hope you do give us another opportunity to meet your expectations next time youâ€™re in the area.   Javier Urrutia Front Desk Supervisor

Summary: The staff were terrific.  The location is conveniently located to go to Disneyland.  It is a 5 minute walk to the tram that takes you right to Disneyland.  The room was nice but for only being open a short time, it was obvious that the workmanship and quality of furnishings was not there.  You could see where the glue that held the mirror to the wall eroded the chrome.  The air conditioner broke daily but the staff were quick to respond.  These are really not deal breakers as the beds were extremely comfortable and the continental breakfast offered a nice variety.  The pool was clean and warm.
Manager Response: Good evening 519elaneb,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. Weâ€™re sorry you experienced a faulty air conditioner in your room; we greatly value the feedback so we can quickly address and correct this issue. However, we are glad you enjoyed your stay and hope you give us another chance to make your stay perfect next time youâ€™re in the area.   Sincerely, Javier Urrutia Front Desk Supervisor

Summary: At this price point the SpringHill Suites was awesome. We arrived on a Monday (1st Sept)  very friendly check in, quickly got to our room. Good seating area, coffee station, refridgerator large tv with loads of channels. Perfect Marriott bed, and the bathroom was well designed with great walk in shower. The location for Disney was second to none. The pool area was good, on the day I used it, was empty, spotlessly clean and towels provided.   The free breakfast was good with plenty of seating, regularly replinished when needed. We visited both Disney parks but first time at California Adventure which for me was a winner. This Springhill Suites would be perfect for solo travellers, couples and families. The hotel only opened this year so everything is 1st class. Also had two
Manager Response: Good evening DisWaltSnw,  Thank you for taking the time to review us and weâ€™re glad you enjoyed your recent stay! One of my favorite things here at the hotel is the modern lobby that allows us to accommodate plenty of people during breakfast as well as having plenty of televisions around with a wide channel array. Our business center is in its own private area and is available 24 hours a day with complimentary printing. We definitely hope to see you next time youâ€™re in the area!  Sincerely, Javier Urrutia Front Desk Supervisor

Summary: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay! The staff was friendly and very helpful. Jason, the manager, was there every day we stayed, always greeting us with a smile and a friendly "Hello!" I loved how breakfast wasn't always the same. Sometimes it was sausage, or bacon, or something else as well as eggs and other normal continental breakfast foods. The breakfast staff was very speedy when it came to restocking and cleaning any messes that were made. Wifi was free both in the lobby and in your room! Since we had a car, we didn't worry about the shuttle, but it was really great to know it was there just in case. The beds were extremely comfortable and roomy! I will definitely be back!
Manager Response: Good evening rcbdancer17,  Thank you for your recent stay with us and for taking the time to review our hotel.  Iâ€™m glad Jason was able to brighten up each morning for you and make it a great start to the day! We understand that our guests are often here for a week and having the exact same thing each morning will get a bit bland and for this we do have an alternating choice of protein. We look forward to seeing you again in the future!  Sincerely Javier Urrutia Front Desk Supervisor

Summary: Visited 10-13 and 14th, specifically to visit Disneyland. Great hotel for families. Had 1 BR suite, sleeps 6 ($200/nite with AAA). We had 5. All slept comfortably. Small kitchenette with good size fridge. Not real easy walk to anything, but we had car. Parking is hassle free. Easy drive to everything. 5 min to Disney parking. Breakfast is good, but closes at 9:30. We missed it one morning sleeping in. Got bagels at Starbucks 2 miles away. Very clean hotel. Very new. Smelled new. Didn't use pool or exercise room. Can get tix for parks at desk. Can't go wrong with this hotel, especially if you have your own car. Now....Disneyland is a completely different story, Lol.
Manager Response: Good evening Siesta05!  Thank you for your recent stay with us. Our one bedroom suite is the most popular room we have; it consists of 2 queen beds as well as 2 sofa beds. Apart from the fridge, it also has a stovetop, microwave, and dishwasher, making it perfect for a weeklong stay at Disney. The best way to save time is to buy your tickets here at the front desk as well as the Art passes in case you donâ€™t want to park at Disney. While Disney can be a bit of handful, I recommend coming in September for short lines.  Sincerely,  Javier Urrutia Front Desk Supervisor

Summary: We stayed at this hotel for a week from the 30/9 and it  exceeded our expectations. Our room was modern and clean. Breakfast was excellent. The staff were all friendly and helpful and i would especially like to mention the gentleman that works in the breakfast room (sorry I cannot remember his name)  The location is good. The ART bus arrives every 15 minutes but if you want to walk, it is only 15 minutes to walk to the Mickey & Friends free Tram that takes you to the Disneyland entrance.
Manager Response: Good evening bigmAuckland!  Thank you for your taking the time to review our hotel. Iâ€™ll be sure to let the gentleman, Oscar that he was exceptional!  Youâ€™re 100% correct, we have both an easy walk to a complimentary shuttle to Disney as well as the Art shuttle, for a nominal fee, that will pick you up at the hotel for a quick ride to Disney. We hope to see you again next time youâ€™re in the area!  Sincerely, Javier Urrutia Front Desk Supervisor

Summary: From the front desk staff to the staff keeping the morning buffet stocked the service was really good. The hotel itself is quite new and the room was always well kept. We stayed for a week and the Springhills and was impressed with the location and staff. The shuttle to Disney took only 10-15mins and was never packed.  Even our car rental was a cinch as it was delivered and dropped off at the hotel. Will be back! Thx.
Manager Response: Good evening Nisha O!  Thank you for your taking the time to review our hotel. We will officially be 8 months on 10/28 but youâ€™d be amazed at how often people still ask us if itâ€™s still brand new! From rental cars to tour services anytime you need help simply ask the front desk and we can assist you to make your stay perfect. Next time youâ€™re ever in the area please donâ€™t hesitate to call and we can make your stay a breeze once again.  Sincerely, Javier Urrutia Front Desk Supervisor

Summary: After arriving later in the day for our family vacation it became apparent right away that we had picked the right hotel for our stay. A total of 12 of us checked in and it was seamless, the desk staff were efficient and accommodating and with a request for synthetic pillows due to an allergy,  housekeeping delivered the pillows almost the same time we arrived at the room.   The rooms were clean and well thought out. For our family of 4 we chose the 2 queen beds and used the pullout sofa which was a much better option than a rollout cot. I personally liked the finishes in the room and the microwave/kitchen area was nice to have.  Some of the other reviews stated that the breakfast area was unclean and not well stocked but I can say from my point of view I never had a problem.
Manager Response: Good evening TravellingMedic1608!  Thank you for your recent stay with us, weâ€™re glad you enjoyed it! Of course we understand that not everyone can have feather in their room, so we will gladly switch out the pillows upon request. Itâ€™s great that each room does have the dry bar with the microwave, coffee maker, and refrigerator. Oscar will be thrilled to hear your nice comments about him as he is one of our best here. While it doesnâ€™t happen to often the Art bus does get a bit full during Disneyâ€™s high occupancy days but we do our best to let Art know when thereâ€™s a crowd so they can immediately send another bus. We hope to see you again next time youâ€™re in the area!   Sincerely, Javier Urrutia Front Desk Supervisor

Summary: Has 3 rooms and stayed four nights with my family. Front Desk Team and hosuekeeping were excellent throughout our stay. Breakfast was very busy but very well stocked. Kitchen staff were excellent. Stayed on the 2nd floor. Was able to see the fireworks at night after a long day at Disney/CA Adventure. Would stay again for sure. Thank you for making our Family vacation fantastic.
Manager Response: Good evening Christopher C,  Weâ€™re glad the entire family enjoyed your recent stay with us and had a great time watching the fireworks! Itâ€™s a phenomenal view at 9:25 pm either from your room or our fire pit area. It was a pleasure to have your family here and we hope to see you again next time youâ€™re visiting!  Sincerely  Javier Urrutia Front Desk Supervisor

Summary: My wife, daughter, grand daughter and I stayed here for 4 days at start of October for our disney visit.   The staff are all outgoing and a pleasure to deal with, a credit to them and the hotel management.  Hotel was full of families visiting Disney.  Breakfast was excellent, the hotel is new and amenities are comfortable.    For us we would have preferred a room with 2 bedrooms as we found it difficult for the four of us in one room with two queen beds.  Pool, small gym and spa were used and enjoyed by all.   The ART transport bus picks up from the hotel driveway and is 5 dollars for day trip.
Manager Response: Good afternoon Crowley59,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. Iâ€™ll be sure to pass along to the staff that they did a great job! Iâ€™m sorry we didnâ€™t have our larger one bedroom suite available during your stay. However, if youâ€™re ever in the area again donâ€™t hesitate to call us to book the larger suite thatâ€™s nearly double the size of our studio suites.   Sincerely, Javier Urrutia Front Desk Supervisor

Summary: Over the years we have stayed at several hotels in the Disney area including the Disneyland Hotel & I have to say I was very impressed with this Hotel.  This is a new hotel (Spring 2014) that is within walking distance to downtown Disney (15 minutes). At check in we were greeted with genuinely friendly service. The decor is fresh/modern and rooms are spacious.  The only complaint is that the pullout sofa bed was not comfortable but having said that have never met one that was. There is a hot breakfast served with lots of variety and also plenty of seating.  The staff looking after the breakfast crowd was very friendly and were quick to replace depleted items. We walked the 1st couple of days to and from the park but after long days and miles on the sneakers we opted to purchase
Manager Response: Good afternoon Mount-Rob,  Thank you for your recent stay with us! Weâ€™re glad you enjoyed our complimentary hot breakfast buffet; it can be a huge savings for a large family instead of having to pay for breakfast elsewhere. After a long day at Disney even another 10 minute walk can seem downright difficult so itâ€™s great that the Art Shuttle can bring you back to the hotel, with the last shuttle always being half an hour after the park closes. Weâ€™re glad you enjoyed Blue Star, as we often use them for taxi service due to them constantly serving our guests with a great service. Anytime youâ€™re in the area, please donâ€™t hesitate to give us a call!  Sincerely, Javier Urrutia Front Desk Supervisor

Summary: We checked out yesterday, and our stay was amazing. The staff was so friendly, and our room was spacious and comfortable. We only had the breakfast once, but it was great. The lobby, and breakfast area was so modern and inviting. I loved the feeling that you could hang out there, if you wanted. There was a firepit outside with comfortable seating. The ART shuttle ran every 20 minutes, we had a nice view of the fireworks at night. The hotel was fabulous, and we had not a single issue there. We have stayed at the Disney properties and enjoyed this hotel just as much.
Manager Response: Good evening Christy84403,  Weâ€™re very glad you enjoyed your stay with us! With numerous televisions spread throughout our lobby as well as our 24hr convenience Market we love having people hang out with us in comfort. At 9:25 pm for about 15 minutes our fire pit does offer an excellent view of the Disneyland Fireworks and has a great ambience. We hope to see you again in the future!  Sincerely, Javier Urrutia Front Desk Supervisor

Summary: I don't usually give hotels a 5 rating but this one gets one because of the nice accommodations and the very nice staff.  Each week I stay in several hotels and usually the staff is nice but this one doesn't know me as I haven't stayed here but once before and second, they treat all guests with a smile.    The room is typical Springhill Suites but it new and looks and feels nice.  When I checked in the front desk clerk saw me looking at the Cardinal Dodger final score.  He asked if I was a Dodger fan and I explained, no I am a Cardinal Fan.  He was obviously not happy that the Cardinals had again knocked the Dodgers out of the playoffs but was very kind, smiled and he gave me time to talk about both teams.  Very friendly.  Later I came to go out and he asked me if I needed
Manager Response: Good evening Steve K,  We want to thank you for your recent stay and for taking the time to review us. We strive to make each guestâ€™s stay worry-free, regardless of how small the gesture it may be it can mean the difference between a good stay and a great stay. While we may have differing team favorites, weâ€™d love to have you again next time youâ€™re in the area!  Sincerely,  Javier Urrutia Front Desk Supervisor

Summary Heading: Good stay. Top floor small room
Summary: Nice hotel. A few pep peeves. Slow hardly work Internet is what you get free. Why hotels use this as a source to make money is just weird. Get $5 per night in the rate and give people quality. I booked through hotels.com and for the top corner small room. This to is frustrating I pay the same price but get third party left over room. Hearing impaired room. Again this is a nice hotel just feel they could do a few things better, their close but cut a few corners. Staff is nice.
Manager Response: Thank you Kip P for you feedback.  We strive to meet and exceed all our guest needs. I apologize that we did not meet your all your expectations. I was glad you enjoyed our staff and found us a nice hotel. We try to always improve and your feedback does not go unheard. In an effort to give greater value we only want to charge our guests for what they need. If we charged $5 more in the room rate for internet, then everyone would have to pay regardless if they used the internet or not. Having a tiered system allows us to charge only the guests that need the higher speed. We do offer a high speed internet connection complimentary for our guests. This is good if you need to check emails or general browsing. However if you would like to stream video, we do offer the upgraded internet for a nominal fee.   You also mentioned that you were placed on the 4 floor in the corner. This is actually one of the most requested spots in the hotel.  We get requests for the top floor every day.  I do apologize for the hearing impaired room. Do to ADA requirements these rooms are required. These rooms have a door bell that activates a flashing light on the inside of the room. This added feature is the only thing that sets these rooms apart from our standard rooms.   I hope you will stay with us again. Should you need any assistance in making your next reservation or request for location, please contact me at 714-215-4000. Front Office Manager Jason Bell

Summary: My son and I just spent 4 days/3 nights at the new SpringHill Suites. We make an annual trip from northern CA to San Diego to move him back to school in San Diego. That is our excuse for a stopover at Disney!  Typically we stay at one of the hotels on Harbor across from the park. I noticed this new SpringHill and decided to check it out. The hotel is new. I found it to be very clean and comfortable. The front desk folks were very friendly and helpful. The breakfast we OK - your typical "free" breakfast buffet - eggs/bacon or sausage/ waffles, toast, muffins, bananas, juice, coffee, etc.  The room was large and comfortable. The ART bus stops right out front. It was convenient and easy.  But, we did walk several times and it took about 10-15 minutes from the front door to Downtown
Manager Response: HI kcsunshine60  It was great to hear about how your stay was. I love that you make a Disney stop every year before sending your son off to school.  It is a perfect ending to a summer break and sounds like you had a great time. Iâ€™m so glad you let us be a part of your trip. We are on a quieter side of the Disney Resort witch is great for people that need to get a little work done.  We also have a great location with only a 10-15 minute walk to Downtown Disney and just beyond that the entrances to Disneyland and California Adventures. I have to say we are the best of both worlds. We wish your son the best in his classes and I hope we will be seeing you for many more years to come.   Jason Bell Front office Manager

Summary: Pros: new, location, comfortable bed, refrigerator.  Cons:  wasn't the cleanest for being a new property, could hear guests above us, 14 parking, ran out of half of the breakfast items, room is on the small side.
Manager Response: Hello StotheC,  Thank you for staying with us on your recent trip to Anaheim and for sharing some feedback with us here on TripAdvisor. Iâ€™m glad to hear that our location suited you and that you enjoyed our comfortable beds and the convenience of the mini refrigerators in our rooms. Iâ€™m sorry that you were disturbed by the people above you during your stay, please remember that members of my staff are always on duty and happy to intervene if another guest is disturbing your rest.  I will share your comments with our housekeeping team about our cleanliness. We take great pride in keeping our hotel immaculate at all times for our guests, I am sorry to hear that was not your experience. Please feel free to contact me directly should you wish to discuss these matters further, Iâ€™d love to hear more about your experience and have you back as a guest in the future.  Sincerely, Darrell Buettner General Manager (714)215-4000

Summary: Hotel is new and well maintained,  perfect location for families in CA to visit Disneyland.  I was there on business and found it comfortable and for the most part quiet.  It is a little pricey because of its location within a mile of the theme park.  Staff was all friendly, breakfast was very good with plenty of options.  They do have a Disney shuttle every 20 minutes (I believe the cost is $5.00 per person for all day).
Manager Response: Richard S.  Thank you for taking the time to write about your stay with us. It was a pleasure to have you and your company with us.  Iâ€™m glad you found our property to be comfortable and quite. In regards to ART you are correct. We do have the art shuttle that will take guests to the Disneyland parks. Art also runs to other destinations like Knottâ€™s Berry Farm and local restaurants. The Cost is $5 for adult and $3 for children 3-9. If you will be staying with us for longer ART does offer 3 and 5 day passes. I do hope you come back and visit us again soon.  Front Office Manager Jason Bell

Summary Heading: Great new hotel with close access to the parks
Summary: Stayed here for 3 nights and enjoyed the room and close access to Disney.  Hotel is new so rooms were all in great condition. Deal included breakfast which was just OK (could take or leave it - eggs were not great but toast and small pastries were also available)
Manager Response: Hi Lilian W,  Thank you for staying with us on your resent trip to Anaheim.  Iâ€™m glad that you loved our location. We are in a great spot with easy access to Downtown Disney and the main gates to the parks. I do apologize that you were not satisfied with our eggs. We pride ourselves on having the highest standards. I hope you will come back and see us again soon.   Front Office Manager Jason Bell

Summary: We stayed for 5 nights and had a fabulous stay. The rooms are modern, well cleaned and serviced daily and have all the features one would need. The breakfasts are plentiful with a range of continental to cooked options. The staff are really friendly, helpful and went that extra mile to accommodate any request. It was my birthday so the staff pitched in with decorations and all signed a card, a really thoughtful touch - thank you!!! The ART bus stops at the hotel which makes getting to Disneyland really easy. We had originally planned to spend less nights than we did at this hotel but were so comfortable we gladly stayed on. Thanks for a great stay.
Manager Response: Hello PanoKnS  Thank you for taking the time to share with us your experience.  Iâ€™m glad that you were able to stay with us while you celebrated a birthday and a trip to Disneyland. We pride ourselves on making every occasion something to really celebrate. I hope you will come back and celebrate with us again soon.   Front Office Manager Jason Bell

Summary: We stayed here while visiting Disneyland in September. The hotel is only 6 months old and the rooms are clean, comfortable and very roomy. The staff were wonderful and very helpful. Tyler even made us a coffee on our departure day while we waited for our airport shuttle. It is about a 20 min walk to Disneyland but the ART shuttle bus no. 11 ($5 a day) picks up and drops off at the hotel door. This was very convenient and ran about every 20 mins. Breakfast was the usual hotel fare, waffles, pastries, toast, cereal, juice, scrambled eggs, sausage and was plentiful. The pool and hot tub were great after a long day walking Disneyland. The front patio area gives a good view of the nightly fireworks display and is a pleasant outdoor area to sit. The lifts do make a loud chiming noise
Manager Response: Hello SuePete1053,  Thank you for staying with us on trip to Disneyland here in September. Iâ€™m glad that you felt comfortable in our spacious suites and that you were able to make use of the pool and hot tub after a long day at the Parks! We certainly enjoyed having you as our guests and hope youâ€™ll come back and stay with us again next time youâ€™re in the area. Iâ€™ll make sure Tyler has a fresh pot of hot coffee waiting for you!  Sincerely, Darrell Buettner General Manager

Summary: We stayed for 3 nights and had a wonderful experience.  Rooms are nice and clean.  We stayed on the back side of the hotel which was very quiet.  We had to ask for more washcloths as were only given 2 in our room.  The breakfast is an added bonus with scrambled eggs, bacon, waffles, yogurt, fruit, muffins, etc.  It was a 1 mile walk to Downtown Disney to enter the parks.  The walk was about 20 minutes and on a residential street and we felt very safe walking back to hotel late in the evening.  The minus is the parking fee that is charged per night.  By the time you add the city taxes onto the parking fee it is around $ 18 per night.  Staff is very friendly and helpful.   Overall, we would stay here again.
Manager Response: Hello lcmm03,  Thank you for choosing our hotel for your recent visit to Disneyland, itâ€™s nice to hear that you had such a wonderful experience. Iâ€™m glad that you were able to enjoy our complimentary breakfast in the mornings before heading off to the Park and that you enjoyed the walk through Downtown Disney. For those who choose not to walk, we also partner with ART shuttle to provide transportation to and from Disneyland at a very nominal fee. Great tip about requesting a room on the back of the building for those who may be sensitive to noise. Ball Road isnâ€™t a terribly busy street and our insulation and double paned windows buffer out most of the noise, but if you like to sleep with a window open the back of the building will certainly be quieter. Thank you again for staying with us, we do hope you come back next time youâ€™re in Anaheim.  Sincerely, Darrell Buettner General Manager

Summary: I stayed at this hotel M-Th for most of the past 3-4 weeks while attending to some business in Anaheim. This is a newer hotel with a fresh decor and comfortable rooms. The staff has been tremendously friendly and courteous as well as accommodating my requests for specific rooms when possible. Theyâ€™ve also seen to it that Iâ€™m receiving my Marriott reward points which is something I forgot to do.   I also want to compliment the management team and business approach that encourages the friendly atmosphere and professional staff. I would hope that the company promotes from within and provides a clear career path for those who excel. In particular Iâ€™d like to acknowledge, Mayra, Tyler, and Ramen who have managed the front desk while Iâ€™ve been a guest.   I would definitely recommend
Manager Response: Hello Chris W!   It was great seeing you each night for the past few weeks! Iâ€™m sure Mayra, Tyler and Ranen greatly appreciate the compliment. We do our best to meet the needs of each guest every day and we strive to have an atmosphere that makes you feel at home. If youâ€™re ever in the area again, whether it be business or pleasure, donâ€™t hesitate to call.  Sincerely, Javier Urrutia  Front Desk Supervisor

Summary: We stayed for a week and had an amazing experience! Great staff and breakfast for our family of six.  if we are in the area again we will definitely be staying. the shuttle to Disneyland was very convenient and always on time for us kids loved it
Manager Response: Good evening Elle4travel!   Weâ€™re glad you enjoyed weeklong stay! It was a pleasure to have you and your family with us and donâ€™t hesitate to call us next time youâ€™re planning a visit!  Sincerely, Javier Urrutia  Front Desk Supervisor

Summary: Hotel is new, so not many scars and wear usually found on older hotels. Our Air Conditioner did not work, so they management moved us to another room. Buffet breakfast served, and plenty of parking available. Not far from Disneyland, but not close enough to walk.
Manager Response: Good evening Harrison9161!   Thank you for your recent stay with us and for taking the time to post a review. Itâ€™s great staying at a newer property without the wear and tear you see on other hotels, we hope to maintain the pristine condition for years to come! Weâ€™re glad we were able to fix your issue quickly. Keep in mind for next time itâ€™s only a 10 minute walk to the Mickey and Friends Parking Structure where a complimentary tram will take you the rest of the way, or of course the Art shuttle will eliminate the need to walk anywhere as it picks you up right outside our door. We hope to see you again next time youâ€™re in the area.   Sincerely, Javier Urrutia  Front Desk Supervisor

Summary: Hotel is new and the rooms are spacious and clean. Service is good. Breakfast is a nice touch. The ART shuttle is spotty at best but that is not a hotel issue but a problem the City of Anaheim has all over. Slightly too far to walk with children or after a long day of touring the parks. Price is a little high as you can find a ton of hotels in the area that are less expensive, but it is a nice place to stay.
Manager Response: Hi Auntie_LaLa81 I hope you enjoyed your adventures at the parks. It sounds like you and your family made use of all the time you had. We do apologize for the ART shuttle.  At times it can get crowded or be running late. As an Alternative, I enjoy the 10 min walk to the Mickey and Friends Parking Structure and take the tram from there to the park. If you do have little ones that are exhausted from a fun day, I would suggest taking a cab back to the hotel. At most it is $10 and they have vehicles of all sizes that can accommodate small and large families.  I hope you will come back and stay with us again soon. Should you need any help finding low rates in the area for your next trip, please feel free to give me a call.  Jason Bell  Front Office Manager

Summary: Great newer hotel.  Extremely friendly and helpful staff.  Rooms are top of the line for this chain.  Very modern layouts.   On ART route so for five dollars you get shuttle rides to Disneyland and back all day per person.  We will stay here again and recommend to family and friends.
Manager Response: Hello MikeKerrey Thank you for taking the time to write about your stay. I am glad that you found our staff extremely helpful and friendly.  They have great insight to help you make the most of your vacation at Disney and other attractions in the area. When your back in our area again please come stay with us again.  Jason Bell Front Office Manager

Summary: The room was huge! The services was spectacular, we had plenty of towels and washcloths, most hotels think that 3 towels and washclothes are enough for four people! Nicest hotel we stayed at on the whole road trip . Very nice free breakfast.
Manager Response: Good evening Jennifer P!   Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel and we hope you enjoyed our studio suites that are 25% larger than the average. We strive to make each guestâ€™s stay as problem-free as possible and we ourselves travel often and know that sometimes those few supplies in the rooms simply donâ€™t cut it when traveling with the whole family! We hope that weâ€™re a stop on your next road trip!  Javier Urrutia Front Desk Supervisor

Summary Heading: Don't think it fits the average rating of 4.5 stars
Summary: From the loud air conditioner that needed to banged every few minutes to quiet it, to the breakfast buffet that closes at 9:30 on weekdays,  to the pool that has very little personality I'd say this is 3.5 star hotel rather than 4.5. Don't see how they call this main gate since it's a 20 min walk to the main gate. There are hotels that are much closer to the main gate for similar price plus there is no shops or amenities within walking distance if this hotel.  Clean,  friendly people make this a 3.5 star to me,  the hotel itself and price are just ok do it doesn't deserve a 4+ in my opinion.
Manager Response: Hello Asykes2,  I want to thank you for your recent stay and for taking the time to review our hotel. Iâ€™m sorry the AC unit in your room had issues. We strive to make sure each guest has a comfortable stay and to that mark  we will be sure to have our Maintenance Department check and adjust our units more often to prevent this from happening. While a straight walk to Disneyland will take 20 minutes there are other walking options available. From personal experience I think the best is a 12-15 minute walk to the monorail next to Rainforest CafÃ© in Downtown Disney, which also has numerous great restaurants and shops. However, we do also have the Art shuttle or Disneyâ€™s Parking Tram to make transportation quick and efficient. We appreciate your honest feedback and hope youâ€™ll come back anytime youâ€™re in the area.  Sincerely, Javier Urrutia  Front Desk Supervisor

Summary: We took our 6 year old birthday granddaughter for a 3-day Disney surprise trip and could not have been more pleased with the accommodations, friendly staff, and amenities  of this fine new hotel.  The  location is perfect and we appreciated the access to a shuttle, the lovely pool, the delicious breakfast buffet, the cleanliness of the entire facility, and most of all the wonderful staff.  Little touches like the outdoor patio complete with fire pit (a fun place to watch the Disneyland fireworks), laundry facilities, little market, and sitting area complete with TV made hotel life most pleasant..  We had the largest studio room I have ever seen that was most comfortable for four adults, two children and a baby.  We let the front desk know about the birthday girl and they even
Manager Response: Good evening Carolyn P!   Weâ€™re very glad your granddaughter enjoyed her birthday trip, and we thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. Our staff takes great care in making sure each guest has a wonderful stay, but we strive to make our birthday guests feel the magic begins before they even get to the Parks. We hope you come back again the next time youâ€™re in town, and form behalf of the staff we want to once again say Happy 6th Birthday!  Javier Urrutia Front Desk Supervisor

Summary: This hotel is really new, comfy bed and clean sheets, big room, nice bathroom  A bit of let down on breakfast buffet, we had to use disposable plates, cups and utensils considering this is Marriott Hotel.  Poor choices with breakfast  Staff are courteous and come right away if you need them to do something.  A bit far from disney park if you have 6-7-10 yr old kids + seniors
Manager Response: Hello MsRoyalecambridge!  Itâ€™s always great to experience a newer and modern hotel. Marriott has some of the comfiest beds in the industry and here, we have some of the best! I am glad you had a great experience with our staff as we strive to make each guestâ€™s stay excellent. While we are a fair distance from the Disney Main-Gate, a quick 10 minute walk will get you to the Mickey and Friends Parking Structure Tram or for a nominal fee the Art shuttle will pick you up at the hotel about every 20 minutes for a great value. We hope to see you again next time youâ€™re in the area!  Sincerely, Javier Urrutia  Front Desk Supervisor

Summary Heading: Great new location near DL - Easy walk
Summary: My wife and I came down for the Disneyland Half Marathon, and were able to get a room at this new hotel.  I have been to many Marriott locations around the US.  This was my first time at a DL Marriott site, and it will be the main place for any future stay.  Very clean.  Pool is just the right size.  Great access to the Park.  It is an easy walk.  Head back to the pool from 2-5 to get relief from the heat, and max lines at DL.  Very good breakfast daily.  Clean, well maintained.  Thanks for the great stay!
Manager Response: Hello GJB9999 I know everyone has a busy schedule. Thank you for taking time out of yours to write a wonderful review.  We are grateful for your loyalty to the Marriott brand and pride ourselves on being the perfect home away from home.   I hope we will see you many times in the future.   Jason Bell  Front Office Manger

Summary: This is a great brand new hotel, the staff was friendly and helpful, breakfast was good. Ask for a Disneyland fireworks view and you will have amazing show every night at 9:30. The gym and pool looked very nice and clean.
Manager Response: Hello Nick A,   Itâ€™s definitely nice to enjoy and experience a brand new hotel with an incredibly friendly housekeeping staff. While Disney does have a spectacular fireworks show at 9:25, keep in mind that it is now only on weekends and days that they are open until at least 10pm. For those nights that there is no show, itâ€™s always a great idea to soak in our spa, open till 10pm or simply be cozy by our fire pit each night to unwind.  Javier Urrutia Front Desk Supervisor

Summary: Beautiful property with modern finishes and spacious rooms.  The staff was friendly and helpful providing directions and options for getting to Disneyland.  We opted to walk the 8+ blocks to the Disney shuttle lot.  Worked great for us.  Breakfast room is large and there is lots of extra seating in the lobby area.  Breakfast was good and staff kept it well stocked.   We would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Good Evening Lisa M!   It was a pleasure having you stay with us and thank you for your review. Out of all my hotel stays I truly love the modern design of the Springhill Suites brand. Thereâ€™s tons of ways to get around the city, from the Art shuttle take has numerous stops to a quick taxi ride, thereâ€™s really nothing you canâ€™t experience. We hope to see you again soon!  Sincerely, Javier Urrutia Front Desk Supervisor

Summary Heading: Classic Springhill Suites with No Surprises
Summary: I often stay at SH Suites around the country for work and this one did not offer any unwelcome surprises.  The room was very clean, and the hotel is either new or was just updated.  Every member of the staff was pleasant, but not overly friendly.  It was a .70 mile walk to the Downtown Disney and made walking over for the Half-Marathon Weekend very easy.    The only area that could be improved is the breakfast service.  The area is small and the selection gets picked over quickly.  Also the waffle maker line gets long and they never had any non-stick spray out to use.  Charging $12 a day to park although a rip-off, is still cheaper than most hotels in the area.  I will say, make sure you have a car if you choose the hotel as I saw people waiting 30+ minutes for the shuttle to
Manager Response: Hello Ryan K  Thank you for taking the time to write about your stay with us. We loved having you here and hearing the clanking of all the great metals that I saw everyone have after the marathon. I have to say, I was a little bit jealous.  Iâ€™m glad you found our location convenient to the parks and other Disney Events.  I find the easy walk to the Disney resort enjoyable and at times quicker than the ART shuttle, the shuttle did get  stuck in traffic at times, due to the Special events Disney was sponsoring. I hope you had a great time and I look forward to seeing you next time youâ€™re in Anaheim, until then, happy travels.  Jason Bell Front Office Manager

Summary Heading: A mixed experience....not terrible; but not fantastic, either! ;-/
Summary: I'd give it a 2.5 star if I could, but since I can only choose a "whole" star, this became a "2" star review instead of "3"; and here's why....  This hotel was "Highly recommended" by the travel agency we used, and since we needed 1 room big enough for 3 children (ages 4.5, 11 & 13) and 3 adults, our usual lodging choice wasn't available to us this year. We took a chance on this new hotel, and had a mixed experience in doing so. The housekeeping staff did create an incredibly cute arrangement of our youngest one's toys and stuffed animals 1 day, and we found that adorable!   We were glad this hotel was still close to both theme parks and easy ART Route #11 access; we were disappointed that our desire to stay until closing each night in the parks meant we missed out on pool
Manager Response: Hello Shekinah S, Thank you for staying with us on your recent trip to Anaheim and for sharing your experience with us here on TripAdvisor. Iâ€™m glad to hear that you enjoyed the playful arrangement created by our housekeeping staff for your children and that we were able to accommodate getting your party checked in early. Iâ€™m sorry that we were unable to accommodate your request for a late checkout also on your final day. Our check in time is 3:00pm and checkout is at 12:00pm. Whenever possible we will always try to give you the extra time you need on a late checkout but at times we are unable to offer checkouts as late as you requested in order to have our rooms ready for the guests arriving that day, as they were for you. I would like to also state that our hotel is absolutely 100% smoke free as it pertains to the hotel itself. Unfortunately we do not govern what people do outside of our hotel and the city of Anaheim does permit smoking in public so long as it is not done so within 20 feet of the entrance of a public building. We place disposal receptacles on the sidewalks, near entrances not to promote anything other than a litter free environment. I am sorry that your stay at our hotel did not live up to your expectations, but I do hope that youâ€™ll come back again next and give us another shot. Please let me know if there is anything I can do to assist you in the future. Sincerely, Darrell Buettner General Manager

Summary Heading: Wonderful Hotel with a great Staff....
Summary: We stayed here in the beginning of August for 4 days.  We arrived very early (around 11 AM) and never thought that we would have been able to check into our rooms.  To our surprise, both rooms were ready for us.    We were up on the 4th floor and were pleasantly surprised at the size of the room. Our rooms were very clean, comfortable, and spacious.  After we unpacked, we headed back down to the front desk for some information on the shuttle service as well as location of some restaurants and bars. The entire staff who works at the front desk were amazing, super kind, welcoming and always had a smile on their faces.  In great detail, we were informed of the ART Shuttle service. $12.00 for 3 days of unlimited shuttle service.  We were route #11 and the shuttle would arrive
Manager Response: Hello SueB3136 Thank you for taking the time to write about your stay on trip advisor. I may be a little bit biased but I agree whole heartedly. I have the best hotel staff, bar none. They are always willing to help in any way they can, whether it is restaurant recommendations, taxis or just local information.   Since we live in the area and have Disneyland right in our back yard.  We have a wealth of knowledge and insider tips to make your vacation all it can be. I will also pass on your glowing review to our housekeepers. I know they work hard to make sure when you get back from a long day, everything is perfect. If youâ€™re ever in our area again please come back and stay with us. It was a joy having you here.  Front Office Manager Jason Bell

Summary: We spent five days in the hotel and it was amazing. The front desk was very helpful and the rooms were really nice. The beds were really comfortable and the sofa bed wasn't do bad either. The complimentary breakfast in the morning was fine. Overall, nothing to complain about, would definitely book this place again if I come down to LA again
Manager Response: Hello David T,  Thank you for staying with us on your recent trip to Anaheim and for the excellent review of our hotel. The tag line leaves a lot to live to up to, but I believe my staff is up to the challenge! Weâ€™ll continue to have friendly, helpful Team Members at the Front Desk and nice, comfortable beds in our rooms and we'll always do our best to ensure that all our other guests have the same wonderful experience that you had. I do hope youâ€™ll come back and stay with us again next time your down in the LA area again, weâ€™d love to have you back as a guest.  Sincerely, Darrell Buettner General Manager

Summary Heading: Friendly Staff. Clean Hotel. Great Stay.
Summary: Wow, we had an incredible experience here.  My husband and I spent 4 nights here in June 2014 for our anniversary + trip to Disneyland. Right when we walked in the door we felt welcome. The front desk staff was willing to let us check into our room really early (before 10am) but admitted they had something "special" planned for us and he was not sure it would be ready yet. We politely agreed to come back later, and when we came back, we found cute towel animals placed throughout the room and an anniversary card signed by the staff waiting for us on the bed. It was such a simple and kind gesture, but that absolutely set the tone for our stay there.  We found that our air conditioning wasn't working properly. All it took was a quick call to the front desk, and within minutes a
Manager Response: Hello Rachel K,  Thank you for staying with us on your recent trip to Disneyland, we are honored that you chose our hotel to celebrate your anniversary at! Whether it be an anniversary, or a birthday, or the annual family trip to Disneyland, weâ€™re always grateful that you have selected us to be a part of the occasion and will try our best to make it a memorable event. I hope that youâ€™ll come back and see us again next year for another great experience and some more Disney Magic! Sincerely, Darrell Buettner General Manager

Summary: Our family of five had a great stay at this hotel.  The staff were friendly, helpful and courteous. When checking in we asked for a room with a view of the Disney fireworks and our request was accommodated without any problem.  Our room was quiet and the beds were very comfortable.  Although busy at breakfast time, there was always enough food and the food tasted fine.  The walk to the Disney gates was approximately 20 minutes from the Hotel, but we always felt safe and comfortable during these walks.   We would definitely stay at the Springhill Suites again!
Manager Response: Hello JandM573,  Thank you for reviewing our hotel here on TripAdvisor and for staying with us your recent family trip to Anaheim. Our spacious suites provide ideal accommodations for families such as yours and our complimentary breakfast each morning can certainly provide additional value for large families. Iâ€™m glad to hear that we were able to accommodate your request for a room with a view of the fireworks, we also have a nice patio thatâ€™s ideal for watching the show in the evenings. Thank you again for staying with us, I do hope that youâ€™ll come back and stay with us again.  Sincerely, Darrell Buettner General Manager

Summary: My family and I stayed at this hotel for a week in August (2014). Very nice hotel with very helpful employees. The only draw back I would say is the parking fee they charge, high and unreasonable. Otherwise the hotel was nice, clean and comfortable. I actually was on-line trying to find the pillows because we all liked them so much. You would need a car to stay here unless all you wanted to do was Disney.  All in all great hotel. Highly recommend.
Manager Response: Hello StephM,  Thank you for taking the time to review us after your recent stay, we greatly appreciate it! Our front desk is always glad to help in any way we can. While we do have a $14 daily parking fee, as does the majority of the area, I recommend leaving the car on property and using the Art Shuttle for a nominal fee or a short 10 minute walk to the parking structureâ€™s complimentary tram to avoid Disneylandâ€™s more expensive parking fee. On shopmarriott.com, you can easily find all the great bedding items for sale to bring the comfort of our hotel into your own home! We hope you consider us again the next time youâ€™re in the area.  Sincerely,  Javier Urrutia Front Desk Supervisor

Summary: This place has wonderful service, is clean and new, and relatively quiet for how many Disney tourists including children there are. The only issue I have is that the A/C cycled on and off continuously and when it came on it was a noisy rattle. Also there aren't blackout curtains if you like to sleep in. I provided these comments to the front desk at checkout. Breakfast is nothing to write home about. I would stay here again just because of the friendly staff, clean and comfy bed, newness, and location.
Manager Response: Good evening d-riddy!  Thank you for your recent stay and we greatly appreciate your comments. We know that after a long day at Disney, the best thing is to get a quiet sleep and our rooms are very soundproof. We hope you give us a call whenever youâ€™re in the area again and return to enjoy Marriottâ€™s incredibly comfortable beds!  Sincerely,  Javier Urrutia Front Desk Supervisor

Summary: This is a very nice hotel.  We were greeted with nice staff at the front desk.  The lobby and breakfast areas were well-appointed.  The beds were very comfortable and the room was very clean. Bathroom had a nice modern layout. The location is also great for going to Disneyland. I wish the breakfast hour can be extend to spread out the crowd.  We will definitely return to this hotel again.
Manager Response: Hello JenKesler,  I want to thank you for your recent stay and review of our property! One of my favorite things about our hotel is the overall modern design, it really makes you feel energetic and welcoming. The best times for breakfast Iâ€™d say would be to come on down before people are getting ready to leave for Disney or after the park has been opened. We hope to see you again the next time you are in the area!  Sincerely,  Javier Urrutia Front Desk Supervisor

Summary Heading: Fantastic Stay Spring hill Suites , Anaheim
Summary: Beautiful hotel, and great service. The Hotel is new, and nicely adorned interiors, both in the rooms and in the lobby. 15 minutes walk from Disneyland, and the ART shuttle bus to Disneyland, pulls into their parking lot, literally every 20 minutes. Very convienent. The staff always greets you with smile and ask how is your day. They never get tired about hearing about peoples trips to Disneyland ( which I'm sure they have heard a hundred times )The  included morning breakfast was among the best we have encountered in any hotel. The morning food staff work tirelessly topping up coffee, waffle syrup, or anything else that appears to run low. One of the terrific things we experienced was a front desk person named "Tyler ". We needed a rental car to go sight seeing. I called every
Manager Response: Hello 813Ben007,  Thank you for choosing to stay with us on your recent trip to Anaheim and for taking the time to share about your experience with everyone here on TripAdvisor. Youâ€™re right we do hear about everyoneâ€™s Disneyland Adventures a couple hundred times a day, and it never gets old!! We love to hear about it and we love to hear back from guests like you. Thank you for taking time to recognize Tyler for assisting you during your stay here, I know he takes great pride in his customer service as we all do here. Iâ€™m glad to hear that he was able to help you make the most of your time in Anaheim and alleviate some of the stress of traveling for you. Please do come back and stay with us again next time youâ€™re in the area, weâ€™d love to have you as guests again.  Sincerely, Darrell Buettner General Manager

Summary Heading: Best hotel close to Disneyland parks
