Summary: Brand new hotel and that is surprising. I have been waiting for a new hotel this close to Disneyland for years.  Bed was very comfortable with plenty of pillows. Room includes a mini fridge and microwave. Free basic breakfast is included and starts at 7:00 am. Wish it started a little earlier since Disneyland opens at 8:00 am in the summer. The breakfast included eggs and make your own waffles. Didn't see any sausage or bacon which was disappointing. They did have biscuits and gravy however.  Standard two queen room has a large bathroom with a dedicated shower and no tub, which I like, but if you need a bathtub you should check to see if they offer a room with one.  Front desk was staffed with very friendly people and I had no issues at check in.  Rooms are only a few months old
Manager Response: Hello interspectrum,  Thank you for waiting so long for us to open and give you the new hotel near Disneyland that youâ€™ve been hoping for! It is nice to hear that Housekeeping is doing a good job keeping the rooms clean and in good shape and that the Front Desk made for a welcoming check in experience for you. Iâ€™m glad to hear that you were able to take advantage of the complimentary breakfast in the morning and the WiFi throughout the hotel (for the additional daily charge you will receive up to 4.5mbps if you choose to upgrade to that service). We do hope youâ€™ll come back and stay with us again on your next trip, weâ€™ll still be new and modern and hoping to see you again soon!  Sincerely, Darrell Buettner General Manager

Summary: We had hoped to get 2 queens but ended up with  a king and the foldout couch. The king bed is a nice sleep but the two adults who drew the short straw for the foldout were not near as comfortable. The foldout is not a queen nor very comfortable. We asked the manager to change the room assignment but were not contacted again. We had called a week before to have a note added to the prepaid reservation to make sure we were given 2 queens and were assured it would not be a problem. Hence, not the best service. The breakfast is good but do try to get to it before 8 am. The place is really busy after 8. No need to take the shuttle to Disney since it is a short stroll to the Mickey & Friends tram. The room had a mini fridge and a microwave, adequate but not a kitchen. The workout room
Manager Response: Hello Northwest Sensei,  Thank you for staying with us on your recent visit to Anaheim and for taking the time to review our hotel here on TripAdvisor. Glad to hear that you enjoyed our breakfast in the morning and you got the chance to refresh in the pool during your afternoon break from the parks. Iâ€™m sorry that we were unable to honor your request to be moved into a room with 2 queen beds, weâ€™ll always do our best to accommodate such requests but sometimes we are unable to fulfill those due to room type availability.  We do appreciate you choosing our hotel and would love to have you come back and stay with us again next time youâ€™re visiting the area. Please let me know if there is anything that my staff or I may do to assist you in the future.  Sincerely, Darrell Buettner General Manager

Summary: Our family stayed at this hotel for 3 nights while visiting in the area and loved this hotel.  The room was a good size for a family of 6.  Two queen beds and a pullout bed fit us all nicely. The room was modern and clean and the beds were comfortable.  The bathroom was also nice, except I did not care for the glass shower as it did not allow for privacy if more than one person wanted to use the bathroom.  Also, the door to the bathroom was a frosted glass which allowed the light to shine through and was a little annoying if someone was using the bathroom while we were trying to sleep  because the beds were right in front of the door.  Had to use a room key to keep power on in room which was something I had never seen before.  The staff was friendly and very helpful.  The
Manager Response: HavinLotsOfFun Thank you for taking the time to write such a wonder review. I love learning about your trip and was excited to hear that you had a great time staying with us. I know from experience that having a hotel close to everything can be a huge plus. Also if you have a good sized family like yours, enjoying a good complimentary breakfast at the hotel can be a lifesaver.  It also looks like you were able to find my favorite spot out by the fire place. It is so nice in the evenings after it has cooled down a bit from the summer heat. Nothing better than good conversation by the fire and if you happen to be there at the right time you have a perfect view of the Disney Fireworks. Iâ€™m glad your vacation was an enjoyable one and hope when you visit Anaheim again you will come and stay with us. Until next time, Jason Bell Front Office Manager

Summary: This hotel is a lovely brand new hotel with great amenities.  Love the free breakfast buffet.  Not just any buffet, they offer fresh eggs, meats, make your own waffles (kids enjoyed that) fresh fruit etc.  The rooms are great.  I especially loved the bathrooms.  Well laid out and spacious. The front desk staff always greeted you when you were arriving or leaving the property.  And when you end your evening,  you can see the Disneyland fireworks from the hotel.
Manager Response: Hello Karen O.  Thank you for taking the time to tell us about your stay here at the Springhill Suites. Iâ€™m glad your family liked the waffles, eggs and the other options available at breakfast.  I think that it is the most important meal of the day, especially when youâ€™re getting ready for a long day at Disneyland. Iâ€™m also excited that you got to see the fireworks from the hotel. They sound and feel so much bigger than even seeing them at the parks sometimes. I believe there is no better beginning to a Disneyland trip than seeing Disneyâ€™s firework from the hotel.  I hope when you visit Anaheim again youâ€™ll come back and stay with us.  I know my staff would love to serve you again.   Jason B. Front Office Manager

Summary: A friend recommended this hotel to me, as it had just opened a few months ago.  Beautiful lobby, nice parking lot, room was clean, huge glass shower, king bed was comfortable, and I had a large screen TV with a lot of channel selections.  My room faced the outdoor pool and hot tub.    Breakfast was a good selection, eggs, bacon/sausage, make your own waffles, cereal, fruit, juices.  One piece of advice I have is to get there before 7:30am, which I did!  Disneyland opens at 8am, so you'll get a huge rush of people around 7:30.  You are so close to the park that you can hear the nightly Disneyland fireworks!
Manager Response: Hello readytograbasuitcase,  Thank you for staying with us on your recent visit to Anaheim and for reviewing our hotel here on TripAdvisor! Recommendations to stay with us from our previous guests are one of the highest compliments we can receive, Iâ€™m glad that your friend directed you to us and that your experience was equally as good. Itâ€™s nice to hear that you enjoyed the comfort of our beds and the selection at breakfast in the morning (even if it does get a bit a crowded). So grab a suitcase, grab a friend and come back to stay with us again soon! Weâ€™d love to have as a guest again!! Thank you. Sincerely, Darrell Buettner General Manager

Summary: The room was very clean and spacious ;) Staff were very friendly and helpful! We had to leave a box and a suitcase for a friend to pick up since our schedules didn't meet. Front Desk staff were very helpful and accommodating. We also asked for a late check out since we were wiped out from Disneyland and Universal Studios 2 days in a row and they said it was ok - considering it was a busy time (4th of July week) and hotels are fully booked (not sure if they allowed because it was booked thru elite traveller) but really excellent service! Breakfast was included and we stayed 2 nights...they changed a bit of the menu. Bathroom has plenty of stock.
Manager Response: Hello Mayr3inhim, thank you for taking the time to review our hotel! We always strive to be as helpful as possible and we do our best to be understanding that after days of back to back theme parks, our guests need a break. To that end we do often have a late checkout based upon availability and we can always store luggage if the need arise to visit Disney one last day before you head back home. We hope to hear from you again when youâ€™re next in the area and we hope you enjoyed the great show Disneyland puts on for the Fourth of July weekend.  Sincerely,  Javier Urrutia Front Desk Supervisor

Summary: I booked our family vacation very late. We usually stay at the Grand Californian Disney property when staying in Anaheim but it was booked solid. I rented two rooms for my family 1) Single King with a sofa Pull Out (2) Double Queen Room with a sofa pull out and walk in closet. Each of the rooms had a small un-stocked fridge and microwave. I have two teenagers; one girl and one boy in addition to a 10 year old young girl. We slept Mom and the girls in the double Queen Room and my son and I stayed in the Single King with sofa pullout.   The hotel is located fairly close to Disney. It is walkable but it would probably take you close to 30 minutes to do so. We ended up using the ART bus (http://www.rideart.org/) which comes to the hotel every 20 minutes. The buses are clean and only
Manager Response: Hello TrueNorthRob,  Thank you for staying with us on your recent visit to Disneyland, weâ€™re glad we had the opportunity to have you and your family as our guests! Thank you also for posting such an amazingly thorough review of my hotel, I appreciate the time you took to do so and I know my future guests appreciate your tips and for sharing your experience. Itâ€™s nice to hear that you enjoyed the contemporary design of our lobby and the hotel amenities such as the complimentary breakfast and our fitness room. Iâ€™m particularly happy to hear that you enjoyed the staff service and that housekeeping is doing a good job keeping the hotel clean and looking new! I hope that you donâ€™t wait too long before booking your family vacation for next year, weâ€™d love to have you come back and stay with us again. If I can be of any assistance in the future please donâ€™t hesitate to contact me directly. Thank you again for staying with us!  Sincerely,  Darrell Buettner General Manager (714) 215-4000

Summary: We stayed here for 3 nights 2 weeks ago. We didn't get to explore the grounds too much but they looked nice. We asked for a room that had a view of the fireworks and after initially getting a room right above the hotel entrance (which was nice) we were moved to a view room. The room was great and spacious. The breakfast was pretty good although when busy the location/flow of the waffle bar is ill-suited. Our stay overall was great.
Manager Response: Good evening Sean M, thank you for taking the time to review us after your stay. Due to our location a wing of our rooms does have a spectacular view each night of Disneyâ€™s fireworks show. While these rooms are limited, we also do have rooms with a beautiful view of our pool and spa area that is perfect for parents who need to keep an eye on their kids. We hope next time you come visit you get a chance to truly enjoy our grounds!  Sincerely, Javier Urrutia Front Desk Supervisor

Summary: Stayed in this Marriott property for three days while my teenagers went to VidCon at the Anaheim Convention Center.  Perfect location for everything in Anaheim such as the Convention Center, Disney, Angels baseball, lots of restaurants, and easy access to major roadways.  Front desk staff was very friendly and helpful.  Workout room was adequate, pool was good.  Breakfast buffet was acceptable; worst thing I can say is that their eggs were bad (obviously powdered).  Otherwise, an excellent Marriott, and I stay in Marriotts all over the country.
Manager Response: Hello xylograph, thank you for your recent stay with us and we hope your teenagers enjoyed the Vidcon convention as much as I did! As you say, we are near the 5 Interstate to get you where you need to go as well as being in a convenient location for whatever may bring you to the Anaheim area. We do hope to see you again next time youâ€™re in the area.  Sincerely, Javier Urrutia Front Desk Supervisor

Summary: I brought about 30 students here for an overnight conference and it was great. Hotel staff was amazing. Rooms are spacious and very clean. Breakfast was really good too. They have an outdoors patio with fire pits. We didn't swim in the pool but it looked nice from our hotel view. If you want something a little sweet, they have complimentary lollipops. It's close to Disneyland and not too far from the Angels stadium buts it's still a little drive.
Manager Response: Hello Don S. Thank you for visiting us in Anaheim and posting your kind words about your stay. We surely enjoyed having your group here. I agree that the fire pit and an endless supply of sugar is a great way to spend a vacation.   I hope we see you again soon. Jason

Summary Heading: Nice Place to Stay for Disneyland
Summary: My husband and I went to Anaheim to see a baseball game and visit Disneyland. We were very impressed with the extremely helpful staff, especially Tyler and Ranin. They helped us get a taxi to the ballpark and tickets to Disneyland for the next couple of days. I never saw Tyler without a big smile on his face and he even remembered our names when we saw him the next day!The hotel is new, very clean and an easy walk  to and from the park.The only criticism I have about the room is that our air conditioner was a bit noisy for this light sleeper.   This hotel is on the Arts bus route which can come in handy after a long day of fun at Disneyland. A tip for guests going to Disney... although there are lots of tables, get down to the free breakfast as soon as possible if you are trying
Manager Response: Hello Susan S, I want to thank you for staying with us and hope the team you were rooting for won! Itâ€™s a short ride to the Angel stadium during Baseball season and you need a break from Disney. There are numerous ways to get there, from driving yourself, to a taxi, and to the Art Shuttle as well. Iâ€™ll be sure to pass along your wonderful comments to our staff as Iâ€™m sure Ranen and Tyler will be glad to know they made your stay even better. We hope to see you again next time youâ€™re here rooting on your team or simply visiting Disney.  Sincerely,  Javier Urrutia	 Front Desk Supervisor

Summary Heading: Great service, super convenient to DisneyLand
Summary: We were fortunate stay within the first three weeks the hotel was open.  As expected with a new hotel, the facilities were in great shape.  The staff was very helpful and always willing to answer questions.  As far as location, this place is awesome.  A short 10-15 minute walk to the Disney trams and your are quickly transported to the Disney parks and Downtown Disney.  I would highly recommend for families.  The room was plenty big for our family of five.    I will definitely return to this hotel if we return to the west coast to visit Mickey and friends.
Manager Response: Hello, Jeff W I want to thank you for staying with us and taking the time to write a review. Being a new property we do strive to keep the hotel in top shape for years to come and we appreciate you noticing our effort. I agree that the location is quite ideal due to the short walk to Downtown and we definitely look forward to your next visit.   Sincerely,  Javier Urrutia	 Front Desk Supervisor

Summary: Our basketball team just stayed here in June and everything was great. The rooms and hotel was clean. The service was great everyone was very nice and all 12 Families were treated well. The boys enjoyed the breakfast and the location is perfect for those going to Disneyland. Carrie Alen helped us with our group booking and she was great to work with. We will definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Hello 025Ray, thank you for your review and choosing us for your teamâ€™s stay. Let me be the first to say the entire team was a pleasure to have; we strive to provide excellent service to all of our guests. I agree that our Sales Manager Carrie is great to work with whenever you have a group visiting the area as she makes the stay a breeze. Whenever you are back in the area, whether itâ€™s with the team or simply on your own for vacation, please donâ€™t hesitate to give us a call, weâ€™d love to have you back.   Sincerely,  Javier Urrutia Front Desk Supervisor

Summary: We had 2 rooms that were connecting.  Worked out very well for my family. However, you had to prop open the very heavy doors with the coffee table or put a towel under the doors to keep them open. Otherwise they would slam shut.  There was plenty of room to move around. I will agree with past reviewers that the bathroom light is obscene in the dead of the night! Great look to have a frosted door during the day, but with kids getting p to use the bathroom in the middle of the night just irritated anyone in bed. Anna in the breakfast area went above and beyond to restock any and all food, clean off tables, and just give a friendly smile to you every morning.  We ended up buying ART shuttle passes both days we went to the parks. We walked it the first night we were there to eat at
Manager Response: Hello Sherrel3,  Thank you for staying at our hotel on your recent trip to Disneyland and for posting your review here on TripAdvisor. I agree that after spending 12 hours at the park that a walk just about anywhere would put me over the edge, and that the ART shuttle provides a valuable service dropping off and picking up right here at the hotel. Weâ€™re glad you enjoyed the extra space to move around while you were here, and Iâ€™ll be sure to tell Ana to keep serving up plenty of smiles with breakfast every day! Thank you again for staying with us, we hope youâ€™ll be back next time youâ€™re in the area.  Sincerely, Darrell Buettner General Manager

Summary: Choosing a suitable venue for a visit to Disneyland for a group of 50 plus people can be a daunting task with every hotel/motel within a bulls roar of the gate touting their finer points which can confuse if you are a rank amateur.  However, having been a few times to Anaheim and having stayed at three different locations, this year we 'hit the jackpot' when we chose SpringHill Suites by Marriott on West Ball street.  Talk about location, location, location!!    What a great place it turned out to be!  Our group was made up of developmentally challenged people but nothing fazed the great friendly staff who kindly & patiently answered/helped/assisted/cleaned up after all that took place during our seven day stay!  That's just the start of it!  Then there were the rooms.  Wow!!
Manager Response: Hello Lenkingston,  Thank you for posting your review here and for choosing our hotel for your groupâ€™s recent trip to Anaheim! We understand that it must be a daunting task to organize a trip for that many people all the way from Australia, so weâ€™re happy that we could alleviate some of the care and worry for you. The entire team here loved having your group with us for that week and getting a chance to get to know you all, we hope youâ€™ll choose us again for your next trip (maybe next time youâ€™ll get a chance to enjoy the pool or maybe even the gym!). Hope you have a safe and pleasant journey home and that weâ€™ll see you all again soon!  Cheers, Darrell Buettner General Manager

Summary: For a variety of reasons we prefer the SpringHIll Suites brand of all the Marriott properties.  We like the layout of the standard rooms, the included breakfast is usually a little better than average, the place is kept clean and they offer most of the amenities that you want as a minimum; internet, pool, jacuzzi, workout room, etc.  This one was no different.  We spent one night here for a day-long visit to Disneyland.  The property still looks fairly new.  Check in was quick and easy.  In fact, the gentleman who checked us in recalled that he had left me on hold for a period of time and waived the parking fees. The property is not too far from Disneyland, but you should either drive (and pay for parking) or take the shuttle ($5/person, per day).  Our room came with two queen
Manager Response: Hello Landlubber_9354,  Thank you for staying with us on your recent visit to Anaheim and for your loyalty to the SpringHill Suites brand! We appreciate you recommending our hotel to everyone here on TripAdvisor, your description of our hotel is very accurate and consistent with our hotel and with the brand. Itâ€™s clear that you are very familiar with what to expect from a SpringHill Suites, so Iâ€™m glad to hear that we able to meet your expectations and reinforce your high opinion of our hotels.  Iâ€™m glad that we were able to offer you some options at check in to find the room that was best suited to your needs and that my staff did the right thing to take care of you after being placed on hold. Please let us know next time youâ€™re coming to the area, weâ€™d love to have you come stay with us again.  Sincerely, Darrell Buettner General Manager

Summary: Just checked out after staying 5 nights at the new Springhill Suites Anaheim Maingate. We had two connecting rooms for two adults and four children. We were meeting family here who also had two rooms, and our family members' comments about the hotel echoed ours. This hotel is trying very hard to keep guests happy, and it shows.   The hotel's design is modern and fresh, with more upscale accents than I would expect in this price range (such as mosaic tile inlays in the lobby floors). The housekeeping staff is commendable, keeping both rooms and common areas extremely clean (we constantly saw people mopping the lobby, elevators, etc).  A big bouquet of lollipops available for kids at the front desk daily was a nice touch. The beds were extremely comfortable--appreciated the
Manager Response: Hello ScottsdaleIrish,  Thank you for sharing your review with us here on TripAdvisor and for choosing our hotel for your familyâ€™s recent vacation to Disneyland. Iâ€™m glad to hear that you enjoyed your time with us and that the little extras like our Chupa Chup lollipops at check in and Paul Mitchell bath amenities provided unexpected surprises for you. I know that Ranen, like the rest of my staff, takes great pride in providing exceptional guest service and in conducting himself in a professional manner that would befit any manager. From making sure that issues are resolved and followed up on, to keeping the hotel constantly clean, my team of future leaders and managers is here to serve. We look forward to having you and your family back as guests next time youâ€™re in the area!  Sincerely, Darrell Buettner General Manager

Summary: Staying in a new hotel is great.  Very pleased with the size of the room, we were 2 adults and 3 children.  Staff and housekeeping were helpful and did a good job.  Beds were comfortable. Breakfast was good but if very crowded you need to get there early. DEFINITLY TAKE THE SHUTTLE.  Do not attempt to park. Go to California Adventureland first kids loved it.
Manager Response: Barbara S Thank you for staying with us and posting your experience.  Iâ€™m glad that our hotel met your needs. It is our goal to ensure a great stay including having enough room to move around.  I agree that a good size hotel room can make all the difference, especially with three kids. I hope your travels will bring you back again soon.  Jason Bell Front Office Manger

Summary Heading: Good Family Hotel for Disneyland Visits
Summary: Our family of 5 spent a week at this hotel in early May, 2014 while we visited Disneyland.  Pros: Housekeeping was meticulous and efficient (we requested a pack n' play, extra sheets, extra shampoo and things were delivered promptly). The rooms were very clean. Pool area is nice, clean and well-stocked with towels. The hotel is new so we appreciated the fresh appearance. Front desk staff was helpful and courteous. Rooms are a good size, the bathrooms are spacious and the room-divider and pull-out couch made our stay comfy for 2 adults and 3 children.  Our room had a mini fridge, microwave, and a small food storage area set off by the entrance to the room. Beds were very comfortable.   Areas to Improve On: There are only 2 drawers for clothes (but there is a large closet for
Manager Response: The Penner Family Thank you for taking the time to write a review of our hotel. I am glad that our Springhill family was able to take care of your family. You mentioned our housekeepers in your post. I agree our housekeepers are top notch and do a great job.  Iâ€™m glad that they made your stay enjoyable, including those that work the breakfast. I feel it is a race to the finish line some mornings, because everyone wants to get an early start in the parks. Thank you for being patient with us at those times. I hope the rest of your vacation was amazing, please come back and see us again soon.  Jason Bell Front Office Manager

Summary: The Hotel was very comfortable. The breakfast was good, but you need to arrive early. I arrived at 0630 one morning and enjoyed a nice selection of breakfast items. The next day I arrived around 0730 and the place was a disaster area; no coffee and not much to choose from. This is consistent with my other stays in the Disneyland area hotels. The Hotel is not far from the employee entrance and relatively close to the parking structure, it is about a 25 minute walk to the entrance to Disneyland or California Adventure, but there is the bus service that runs in the area. I would stay there again.
Manager Response: Jack M. Thank you for taking the time to write a review of our hotel. Iâ€™m glad you liked our location and found our rooms very comfortable. I know after a long day at the parks itâ€™s nice to be so close to a bed. In regards to the breakfast we do at times get a rush of guests coming to breakfast before they head out to the park. I apologize that this may have been the case for you. We strive to give our guests a great experience. If you are ever in the area again I hope you will stay with us.

Summary: I went down to see my great niece graduate from Chapman University & stayed at this hotel May 23-25, 2014.  This hotel was just built & close to people we knew so I thought it was "perfect".  WRONG.  The day of graduation, I went to take a shower, no hot water.  Called the front desk, spoke to Tyler & he told me that he was getting several complaints & they were working on the problem, he asked that I wait 15 minutes, I waited 20 minutes.  No hot water.  I had to call the front desk three times & finally got to speak to the manager, Jason Bell.  Mr. Bell told me that they weren't sure when we'd get hot water.  Remember, new hotel.  The tap water was discolored so Mr. Bell kindly brought us bottled water to make coffee.  Two hours later I decided I had to shower, we had a
Manager Response: Hello tknjk01,  Thank you for staying with us this weekend and for taking my phone call today to discuss the issues we had with our hot water over the holiday weekend. You are absolutely correct in that I would list the ability to take a hot shower in the category of minimum expectations I would have coming to a hotel and we were unable to provide that for you. As I explained during our conversation this morning, one of the mechanical components of our plumbing system failed over the weekend and made it impossible to deliver hot water from our boilers to all of our guest rooms, impacting a number of our guests. Due to the long holiday weekend, we were unable to obtain the proper parts we needed to resolve the issue until Tuesday morning despite our best efforts throughout the weekend. I understand how incredibly frustrating this must have been to you and all of our other guests that were affected by the situation. I hope that since we have now gotten the problem resolved and we have had a chance to speak about it, that you will consider giving us another chance next time youâ€™re in the area. Thank you again for staying with us, weâ€™d love to have you back again.  Sincerely, Darrell Buettner General Manager

Summary Heading: Wonderful Place to Stay for a Disneyland Family Trip!
Summary: I checked into this hotel on Friday and stayed until Tuesday morning, over Memorial Weekend. I expected the park, and ultimately the hotel, to be packed... It WAS Memorial weekend after all! When I checked in, it was confirmed. They told me that the hotel was full to capacity. I love the Marriott brand, but I know that different hotels handle that kind of capacity differently and was interested to see how the Springhill would do. They exceeded my expectations for any hotel, let alone one full to capacity with a handful of large school (teenagers!) groups! My room was always cleaned very, very well and it was obvious that the housekeeping staff took their time, cleaned it right and even went above and beyond! The little soaps and lotions were replaced every night and when they
Manager Response: Hello MyLoveofBeauty,  Thank you for staying with us over the weekend and for posting this incredible review of our hotel! I love hearing that my staff is able to pick up on cues like recognizing extra people in the room and anticipate the need for extra soaps and lotions without having to be asked, and that everyone was friendly throughout your stay. Iâ€™m happy to hear that you enjoyed our breakfast in the morning and that our spacious new suites provided everything you needed during your trip. I hope that weâ€™ll be seeing you again on your next trip to Disneyland this year, weâ€™ll be anxiously awaiting your return!  Thank you, Darrell Buettner General Manager

Summary Heading: Can not handle fully booked hotel.
Summary: This is a beautiful brand new hotel.  There are many nice things about this hotel.  We enjoyed 5 out of the 6 days we spent here.  It is to bad that the last day was awful.  On our last night at the hotel we noticed that the hotel was going to be filled to capacity.  3 tour buses showed up caring teenagers.  The next morning we went down for breakfast and it was a mess.  There was very little food left and what was there was everywhere.  It honestly looked like an explosion on the counters, tables and floors.  After waiting for sometime to see if more food would be brought out or if things would be cleaned up a little, nothing happened.  I went to the front desk to ask if they could help.  He said he would check it out.  While standing and waiting with several other families, he
Manager Response: Dear Andrea C,  Thank you for staying with us on your recent weeklong visit to Anaheim. While Iâ€™m happy to hear that you enjoyed the majority of your stay with us, Iâ€™m sorry that your experience at breakfast on the final day left you with such a negative lasting impression of our hotel. Whenever we have groups of this size at the hotel we always try to schedule them to come through the buffet line in smaller groups than all at once to avoid this type of scenario. I apologize that the execution of the scheduling failed in this instance and created such a negative experience for you and our other guests, and that I was unavailable to discuss it with you that morning. Please feel free to contact me directly if you wish to discuss this matter further, or if I can be of further assistance to you. Weâ€™d love the opportunity ti have you come back and stay with us again in the future.  Sincerely, Darrell Buettner General Manager darrellb@dknhotels.com

Summary Heading: Great stay minus a few issues
Summary: We had an pleasant stay at the Springhill Suites. The room was clean and modern. Only issue was the AC rattled all night long each time it turned on. It made for a disruptive sleep! We mentioned it to management on our check out the next day but they were swarmed with cheerleader parents so didn't have time to address.   The breakfast was great in the morning but was very busy! Staff were friendly!   We would love to stay again however I have noticed that the price has gone up substantially these past few months!
Manager Response: Hi Jill M, Thank you for staying with us back in March and for posting your review here on TripAdvisor. Iâ€™m glad to hear that you enjoyed our breakfast in the morning and that you found the staff to friendly while you were here. Prices do tend to fluctuate based off of demand, so be sure to snatch up those deals when you find them! Please let us know when you plan on coming back to the area, weâ€™d love to have you come stay with us again.  Sincerely, Darrell Buettner General Manager

Summary: From the moment we walked in, we were treated like royalty. Our family of 5 was welcomed by warm and friendly front desk personnel even in the late hours of the evening. The lobby was immaculate with great design and functionality. There are 3 touch screen flat screens (large, my guess is at least 37") where you can search local events and activities, check into flights, see the upcoming weather forecast, and more. The lobby had several tv's going with different channels of interest on. Off of the lobby was the lounge with numerous tables and the counter tops for the FREE breakfast in the mornings (which was delicious as well!). Off of the lounge was also an amazing gated patio with seating, a fire feature and super cool LED pillars that gave a great ambiance. Located on the
Manager Response: Hello mndylee,  Thank you for the amazing review of our hotel and for staying with us on your recent trip to Anaheim!! Glad to hear that the hotel had everything you were looking for from our comfortable beds and complimentary breakfast, to some of the surprising touches like our interactive Digital Art Display in the lobby and raised shower heads for your husband in the bathroom. Itâ€™s particularly nice to hear that smiles and high fives from my staff were plentiful throughout your stay with us!! Whether youâ€™re coming for Disneyland, or just to visit the area again, please keep us in mind. Weâ€™d love to have you come stay with us again!!  Thank you, Darrell Buettner General Manager

Summary: I really enjoyed my stay at springhill suites. The room (1br suite) was huge! It felt like 900 sq feet or more! Plenty of room for my daughter and niece to run around in! The one br suite has one large walk in closet in the bedroom, and a large closet in the living area. Lots of places to sit! Two large couches, several chairs, two desks, etc. The kithen area was nice too! A stove top was handy to cook grilled cheese sandwiches for the kids and other quick meals. There are pans and cooking utensils and a few tupperwear bowls that came in handy, but only about 4 disposable eating sets (paper plates, plastic cups, and plastic utensils) so you might want to pack extra. Also the full size fridge and freezer was awesome! Loaded that thing full with water and we were good for
Manager Response: Hello suzuko98,  Thank you for staying with us recently and for sharing your photos with everyone here on TripAdvisor! Looks like the family was really able to stretch out and relax in one of our 1 bedroom suites, glad to hear you were able to make use full size refrigerator for drinks and snacks and the cook top for grilled cheese!!  Sorry to hear that your luggage didnâ€™t make the trip with you, but Iâ€™m glad we were able to get pointed to local Walmart to get the clothes and supplies you needed to get you by. Please let us know next time youâ€™ll be back in the area again, weâ€™d all be huge fans of having you come stay with us again.  Thank you, Darrell Buettner General Manager

Summary: We traveled to Disneyland May 7th-10th and decided to stay here at SpringHill. We have no regrets whatsoever. The staff was amazing. There was a young guy I believe by the name Taylor (sorry I'm not positive) that was so friendly and polite. The front office manager was always there at night to greet us and he was just as friendly. The room was great, we had a standard room and it had a small dividing wall that was just great. The hotel was always clean!   I've read some reviews that the breakfast area is crowded, this can be true. If you go during the peak hour of 8:30 or so before everyone goes to Disney, just allow some extra time to account for it--it is a complimentary breakfast after-all. I found the breakfast to be great and it met our needs.  I really enjoyed our stayed!
Manager Response: Hello Nicole G,  Thank you for staying with us recently and for posting your review here on TripAdvisor! Itâ€™s nice to hear that our Team in the evening is doing a good job welcoming our guests and being friendly throughout you stay with us. Iâ€™ll definitely tell Tyler at the Front Desk, and Jason my Front Office Manager to keep up the good work!! Youâ€™re absolutely right that breakfast can get crowded during our peak periods, so we do get everything setup early for those who wish to beat the rush (6:30a-9:30a Mon-Fri, 7:00a-10:00a Sat & Sun). Please let me know if thereâ€™s ever anything we can do for you in the future, weâ€™d love to have you come stay with us again!  Sincerely, Darrell Buettner General Manager

Summary: We stayed there last week for our Disney trip. The staff is very efficient . The rooms are nice and comfortable. They have a walk in closet where you can store everything. The bathroom as a stand up shower. We stayed on the fourth floor 416 this room was great for watching the fireworks from Disney had a front row seats. The breakfast was fresh and had many great choices. It is a convenient walk to Disney . We had six people in our room and it didn't seem crowded. Great place to stay.
Manager Response: Hello Tony R Thank you for sharing with us your experience at our hotel. We take great pride in helping our guest have a wonderful stay.  It means a lot to know our guests have a great time.  Iâ€™m also glad to hear you were able to enjoy our wonderful view of the fireworks; itâ€™s a nice way to end a night. I hope your vacations bring you back soon.  Sincerely, Jason Bell Front Office Manager

Summary: We stayed here in the last week of April. This is a brand new hotel, very nice considering the majority of hotels around Disneyland are pretty old and run down. The lobby, pool, gym, and rooms were all very nice and well maintained. The front desk staff were always very friendly and nice to talk to. The room was nice and large and had everything we could have wanted. A small fridge, microwave, desk, couch, etc. They even stocked it with a couple paper plates and plastic cutlery each day (great for making lunches to take to Disneyland). My only complaint about the room (which other reviews noted) was the sliding frosted glass door for the bathroom lets a lot of light into the sleeping area if someone goes in there to use it at night. Perhaps a light on a dimmer or some kind of
Manager Response: Hello Zachulaa,  Thank you for writing about your stay at our property. We take great pride in helping our guest have the best vacation possible. Iâ€™m glad you found our suite spacious and comfortable with everything that you needed for a wonderful stay.   To help with planning transportation to the parks, we are located close to two transportation options for Disney other than the ART shuttle.  The first is the Tram at the Mickey and Friends Parking Structure which will drop you off near the front entrance of the parks. The Second is the Monorail at Downtown Disney that will take you to Tomorrowland inside Disneyland (You must have your tickets for Disney to ride the monorail). Both these walks from our hotel are about 10-15mins. The Art Shuttle is a great option but as you mentioned they do not run on a good set schedule. So occasionally it does take them longer than their posted 20 minutes and buses do fill up at certain time of the day usually around when Disneyland closes for the day.  I am glad that you spent your vacation with us and invite you to come back again soon. If there is anything that I can assist with please let me know.  Sincerely Jason Bell Front Office Manager

Summary: We stayed here for the first part of our honeymoon (Disneyland pre-cruise) I was genuinely blown away by the exceptional staff and amenities available. Immediately upon arrival we had our keys ready and were provided with all information about how to best get around the area. The lobby and lounge was very clean, comfortable and modern too! As we were traveling with a large group of friends, this was perfect for all of us to gather while still having privacy in the suites. We mainly stayed poolside in the evenings and never had issues with overcrowding. The suite itself was lovely and well designed. Loved the kingsize bed, so comfy! The bathroom was perfect for two people getting ready and the mirror had built in lights which was most helpful. The best part was the personal note
Manager Response: Hi Ljpinke, I wanted to thank you for taking the time out of your busy schedule to write such an excellent review of our hotel. We are excited that our guests love our hotel as much as we do. Also itâ€™s not every day we get to celebrate a honeymoon. I hope your day was filled with love from family and friends. We were glad we got to be part of the celebrations. I wish you many happy years to come and please come visit us again soon.   Sincerely, Jason Bell Front Office Manager

Summary: I stumbled across this brand new hotel the night before travelling online. I had never heard of it before but happy to hear it was a Marriott property. It was a wonderful surprise to find a great rate so close to the check-in date. Just before arriving, I called to note late arrival and Dina asked if she could arrange a taxi once I arrived in Anaheim (what a nice gesture of customer service!). Upon check-in at 11pm, Jose was waiting at the front desk to greet me. The hotel was quiet, but as I looked around I enjoyed the trendy and modern dÃ©cor, the clean newness of the hotel and a smiling face. The room (a suite) was very nice. Every piece of space was utilized well from the refrigerator, to the living space, the desk area to the bed and bathroom. Everything was thought out. The
Manager Response: Hello SeriousSDTraveler,  Thank you for the seriously amazing review of our hotel!! It always so great to hear from our guests that weâ€™re taking care of them from check in to checkout. I appreciate you taking the time to recognize my staff, from Dinah & Jose at check in, to Oscar and Tyler in the morning I know we all strive to make lasting, memorable experiences for our guests (and yes, even I get to join in the fun from time to time). Weâ€™ll certainly be doing everything we can to keep the hotel looking pristine and ready for you on your next Sweet Weekend Get-Away! Hope to see you again soon!!  Sincerely, Darrell Buettner General Manager

Summary: Really like the Springhill room layout. We stayed I'm one in deadwood SD last fall, great as well. Good sleep, good free breakfast, good shower. What else do you need?   Really close to Disneyland as well.   Booked thru tripadvisor.com which was quick, easy and gave a good rate. I actually booked the room on my phone while in line for Space Mountain!
Manager Response: Hello HouZooDad,  Thank you for reviewing our hotel and for staying with us on your recent trip to Disneyland. Iâ€™m really glad you like our room designs and that you were able to get a good nightâ€™s rest after your day at the Park and a nice breakfast in the morning. What else could you need, you inquired? I may be a bit biased, but I think we have a pretty amazing staff here to serve you as well!! Please let me know next time youâ€™re headed to our area, Iâ€™d love to have you come and be our guest again. Thank you!  Sincerely, Darrell Buettner General Manager

Summary Heading: Not Bad But Not For Me
Summary: We were looking forward to this hotel because it is brand new; in hotel terms that's anything in the first few days - after a few months, it's just new...ish.  Normally we stay a bit closer to the parks; the larger Marriott near the Convention Center.  This time we opted for the Spring Hill because it's new and could accommodate five people.    LOCATION: The location isn't bad - walking an additional 1 1/2 - 2 miles isn't that bad to start the day - it's a long haul at the end of a long day of walking.  I say 1 1/2 to 2 miles because from the hotel to the parks entrance plaza...it's longer than what Google maps has for the Disneyland Resort.  If you pay $5 for the ART Shuttle, it's hit or miss - sometimes good, sometimes bad - it depends on the driver and the people (some who
Manager Response: Hello NotAPickyTraveler,  Thank you for the very thorough review of our hotel and for taking the time to recognize Tyler for his service. He certainly is one of our young, shining stars and we hope he is with us for a very long time to take care of our future guests like he did for you. Just as you mentioned our normal check in time is 3:00pm, but weâ€™re always happy to accommodate an earlier check in provided we have a room that is ready. Iâ€™m glad to hear that we were able to get you in so early and off to enjoy the Park! Iâ€™m sorry to hear that bathroom cleanliness wasnâ€™t up to your standards, or ours. Iâ€™ll definitely be reviewing these issues with housekeeping so that these details donâ€™t go overlooked in the future. Marriott does offer a wide range of hotels here in the Anaheim area and we all offer slightly different services and amenities to meet our guestsâ€™ needs. We certainly hope youâ€™ll consider us again in the future and be our guest again.  Sincerely, Darrell Buettner General Manager

Summary: SpringHill Suites is one of our favorite chains and we have stayed in many. We stayed here in April to go to Disneyland.  Let's get the 'name' out of the way first.  The hotel is about a mile from the entrance to Disneyland â€“ not what I would expect with a name like â€œMaingateâ€.  There are many hotels on Harbor Blvd. that could call themselves â€œMaingateâ€ since they are right across the street from Disneyland. I did not expect to walk to Disney, I doubt that many did.   We had taken Amtrak from San Diego and took a taxi ($15) to the hotel.  There is a wonderful shuttle system, Anaheim Resort Transportation (ART), that runs about 20 routes to the various hotels, etc. This hotel is on Route #11 and the shuttle comes by every 20 minutes. ART also serves the Amtrak station and runs an
Manager Response: Hello TinMan96, Thank you for your review of our hotel and for your loyalty to SpringHill Suites! Itâ€™s good to hear that you enjoyed our complimentary breakfast and internet, and that you got a chance to relax and watch a little of our HD programming on TV while you were here (analog programming is also a pet peeve of mine when I travel). Thank you also for the great feedback on our hotel! Although not all of our rooms have the grab bars, we do have rooms that are equipped as such, just let us know in advance if you require them and weâ€™ll arrange one of those rooms for you. Weâ€™re also working on getting our first delivery of Disney tickets within the next few weeks and we do have an online system to purchase tickets here at the hotel to beat the line at the gates! I hope that you enjoyed your California vacation and your time here in Anaheim, and that youâ€™ll come back and stay with us again next time.  Sincerely, Darrell Buettner General Manager

Summary Heading: You cant go wrong with a brand new hotel !! Opened feb,2014..
Summary: Stayed 11th -13 th April  We loved this newly built resort.Our room was huge with king size bed,large couch,kitchenette ,writing desk,large bathroom,which overlooks the pool.loved the colour decor scheme throughout the whole resort & room ,a true modern feel.The room fits up to 4 person,very comfortably.  Staff were nice & helpful with any request.nothing was too much for them.Well done guys.  Theres a lovely pool& spa with disability chair for the pool & spa, to get these person in the pool.heaps of deck chairs,shaded pergola.towels are provided at pool area.    Wifi worked great around the whole resort...it's free too..  The ART shuttle will pick you up from the resort to the parks for a $5.00 person pass unlimited routes around the Anaheim a day pass.Great value.We also use
Manager Response: Hello Elisa S,  Wow! Thank you for such a thoughtful, thorough review of our hotel!! Iâ€™m so glad to hear that you enjoyed all of the different aspects of our hotel from the room dÃ©cor, to our Market, and especially the service of our staff. I really canâ€™t think of anything more I could add to your review, except to say â€œThank Youâ€ and weâ€™d love to have you come back here and stay again & againâ€¦  Sincerely, Darrell Buettner General Manager

Summary: We stayed here just one week after they opened.  the place was fresh, clean, and the staff was eager to please.  We were asking for information, extra pillows, another room, and they never acted like we were a burden.  This was actually one of the best hotel breakfast I have ever had.  The eggs were cooked beautifully (unlike the rubbery ones at the Disney character breakfast), lots of pastries, juice, sausage.  The line for the waffle maker was a little long, but that's always the case at hotel breakfasts.  I just skip the waffles.  Another plus, the hotel is only a 10 minute walk from Mickey and Friends tram and you can see the fireworks from the patio!!  The beds and pillows were great.  Because it is so new, there were a couple of new-hotel glitches.  Our first night, the
Manager Response: Hello taxi4umom,  Thank you for staying with us last month and for posting your review, itâ€™s great to hear feedback from one of our first guests! Itâ€™s good to hear that my staff was eager and willing to answer your questions and respond to your requests - that is after all why we are here! The fireworks from the patio in the evening are always nice and we also have some rooms with amazing views as well (be sure to mention that when booking and weâ€™ll do our very best to get you one). Sorry about the early morning â€œwake up callâ€ you experienced. Unfortunately that does happen every once in a while, when an alarm triggers we do our best to take immediate action to investigate and determine the cause. Guest safety is always our number concern and we want to make sure that there is no actual emergency before we silence any alarms, or take appropriate action to get everyone to safety if there is. Please let us know next time youâ€™re headed back to area, weâ€™d love to have you stay with us again!  Sincerely, Darrell Buettner General Manager

Summary: We just returned home from a wonderful vacation to Disneyland.  We stayed here for 6 nights.  The hotel was clean, convenient and overall pretty nice.  Just a couple of comments...my kids went to go swimming in the outdoor pool, which was pretty small, and lasted about 30 minutes.  The water was freezing!  This was a real disappointment, since they had really been looking forward to swimming after a day of travel.  The weather was unseasonably warm, and still, the water in the pool was freezing.  Everyone that I watched come get in, commented on how cold it was.  Needless to say, we didn't return to the pool the whole rest of the trip.  Breakfast was another disappointment.  The food was mediocre, but there was only one waffle maker and one toaster.  Really?  Of course,
Manager Response: Hi Lori P,  Thank you for staying with us on your recent trip and for posting your review of our hotel. Iâ€™m happy to hear that you found the hotel to be clean and convenient for your vacation to Disneyland. Iâ€™m sorry to hear that pool was so cold while you were here, Iâ€™ll be sure to have my maintenance team take a look at our heater to make sure the pool is staying heated to a comfortable 84 degrees as it should be. You are absolutely correct that the breakfast does get busy right before everyone heads off to the park, and the waffles are always a hit! We received our second waffle iron back to help expedite the process, but donâ€™t forget we also have a wide selection of other items including scrambled eggs with either bacon, sausage or biscuits and gravy. As well as yogurt and fresh whole fruit if you wanted something light for the day!  I hope youâ€™ll come back and stay with us again for your next Disney vacation!!  Sincerely, Darrell Buettner General Manager

Summary Heading: Beautiful, new hotel with great hospitality!
Summary: We spent a day at Disney with the kids last week and selected this brand new hotel.  It is a GREAT spot for families not wanting to pay a premium for the Disney Resort hotels.  Disney is in walking distance, and there is a local shuttle if you don't wish to walk.  The hotel was clean, the service was very friendly and the rooms were lovely.  There is a pull out couch in each room, and a walk in closet with a safe, which is greatly appreciated.  You have a microwave and small fridge in each room, which is very convenient.  The bathroom is spacious and the rooms have energy efficient lighting.  The only thing the staff needs to smooth out is breakfast service.  I think the crowds are a little larger than they are ready to handle, but they were very kind and tried their best.  It's
Manager Response: Hello Travelbug4446,  Thank you for posting and for bringing the family to stay at our hotel recently. Iâ€™m glad that you found the convenience items in our rooms such as the microwave, mini-fridge & pullout sofa bed well suited to your needs. Weâ€™ll keep working on ironing out the kinks while continuing to provide the friendly, happy service that you experienced while you were here (itâ€™s easy to do with great guests like you!!) Thank you again for staying with us, weâ€™d love to have you back next time youâ€™re in the area.  Sincerely, Darrell Buettner General Manager

Summary: Rooms are spacious, fresh and clean!  With 2 kids and 2 adults we all could spread out a bit.  Pool area was relaxing and fresh towels were stocked often.  And although it was a busy week the breakfast staff did a fantastic job keeping everything stocked and were very friendly.    Easy to get to Disney with shuttles.  But not a lot to walk to around the hotel.  Which was fine after walking all day at Disney our feet were toast!  One side note on the room designs.  The bathroom has a sliding pocket door that is frosted glass.  Nice sleek design however if someone gets up to use the bathroom in the middle of the night and turns on the light it illuminates the room.    Would be nice if there were night lights or a  dimmer.
Manager Response: Hello seaberry_9,  Thank you for the great review of our hotel! Iâ€™m glad that enjoyed and your family enjoyed your stay at the hotel and that you were able to relax by our pool. I hope you also took advantage of the Jacuzzi in the evening to soak your aching feet after a long day at Disneyland. I hope you had a great time visiting the Parks and that youâ€™ll come back and stay with us again next time youâ€™re in town!  Sincerely, Darrell Buettner General Manager

Summary Heading: Convenient to Disney and Brand New Hotel
Summary: Apparently, this just opened 2/28, so everything is new. The room was spacious and well appointed. We had 2 adults and 2 kids and everyone got a good night of sleep. The proximity to Disney is great and there is a shuttle that runs every 20 minutes. The breakfast offerings were good and the staff was very helpful and friendly. I've stayed at more expensive hotels, but this was a great spot for the money.
Manager Response: Hello 1ChiTownTraveler,  Thank you for posting your review and sharing your experience at our hotel with everyone here on TripAdvisor! Yes, weâ€™re still brand new here and weâ€™ve been getting some wonderful feedback from our guests like yourself. Iâ€™m very glad that you and family enjoyed your stay with us and were able to take advantage of our complimentary breakfast in the morning. I hope you had a great time visiting the Disney Parks and that youâ€™ll come back and stay with us again next time youâ€™re in Anaheim!!  Sincerely, Darrell Buettner General Manager

Summary: Arrived not knowing that the hotel had only been open 3 weeks, you couldn't even tell. The property was very clean and well kept Everything was fantastic from check in to check out.  I really enjoyed the staff, they were all very friendly and professional. The gentleman who checked us in was very good at customer service and seemed to really know his job. Ana and Oscar were great at breakfast and managed to keep everything stocked even though the breakfast was packed with people!  I also met the Director of Sales and she was present at the front desk and in the lobby multiple times always greeting guests, something you don't always see at a property.  Darrell the manager was always helping guests whether it was with luggage or just helping them check in.  Of the 4 properties I
Manager Response: Hello Nighthawc,  Wow! Thank you for the amazing review and for sharing a few of your photos with us!! Iâ€™m glad that you enjoyed your trip and that we got to be one of the 4 hotels you chose during your vacation. Iâ€™ll definitely be sharing your comments with Ana and Oscar and congratulating them on doing such a good job taking care of our guests! I hope that you enjoyed the rest of your trip as well, and that youâ€™ll come back and stay with us again next time youâ€™re in the area.  Sincerely,  Darrell Buettner General Manager

Summary Heading: Brand new ... good location ... but working out the kinks
Summary: We selected this hotel as it had been opened only 10 days when we arrived ... new, fresh, clean, etc.  While the accommodations are basically what you would expect for this type of lodging, I was highly disappointed in the overall Marriott service and the greeting upon arrival.  THE MARRIOTT WEB SITE HAD THE WRONG ADDRESS FOR THIS HOTEL!  So upon arriving in Anaheim late, we drove around for 30+ minutes trying to find the hotel.  When I called the front desk number, the on-duty clerk kinda chuckled and said something like, "well, we're not where you are ..."  No kidding you rocket scientist.  I called back as I couldn't find the location he provided, and once again, he was indifferent and found my situation to be funny to him.  Then when I arrived, the guy was amused by my
Manager Response: Hello Gafan,  Thank you for sharing your experience with us from your recent stay at our hotel. Iâ€™m truly sorry that you were misdirected by the incorrect address on our website, I can understand how frustrating and confusing that must have been in a city youâ€™re not familiar with (particularly after coming all the way from Atlanta!). We have already taken the proper steps to get the address corrected so that it now displays our true address, and I will certainly take this opportunity to share your comments with my entire staff so that we become more sensitive and accommodating to our guestsâ€™ needs. Thank you again for the feedback and for staying with us. I hope that enjoyed the rest of trip to Anaheim and that you will consider us gain next time youâ€™re in town.  Sincerely, Darrell Buettner General Manager

Summary Heading: Spring break at Disneyland for a family of 6!
Summary: Just completed a 4 nt stay at this brand new hotel.  It's clean, fresh, and well laid out.  Staff is helpful, courteous and friendly. Location is within walking distance to Disneyland.  Price is reasonable.  Paid $251 for Saturday night and $157 for weeknight.  The $251 is a bit high compared to similar amenity properties. There are some things that need attention.  1.  Breakfast:  3 out of 4 mornings the food was gone and there was no sign of replenishment.  This makes a morning with 4 hungry, impatient kids difficult.  2.  The air unit in the room was loud and the air did not evenly flow through the room.  The person sleeping on the sleeper sofa was hot and the person next to the air unit was freezing.  Overall it's a great value and wonderful place, I am sure they will work
Manager Response: Hello RockinMom13,  Thank you for your review of our hotel from your recent stay with us in Anaheim. Iâ€™m glad to hear that you found our staff to be friendly and courteous and that our location was convenient for your trip to Disneyland. We appreciate you bearing with us as we worked through some of the growing pains of our opening to improve things for our guests. We have been increasing our staff in the breakfast room in the morning to ensure that we can accommodate all of our guests and keep the buffet line stocked and replenished throughout service. Weâ€™ll certainly continue to look for areas where we can improve on and provide better service to our guests. Thank you again for the feedback, and please let us know next time youâ€™re headed back to the area. Weâ€™d love to have you stay with us again!!  Sincerely, Darrell Buettner General Manager

Summary: The Springhill Suites Maingate was outstanding. First, it is new and still smells like it. The workout facility is great. The breakfast was also great and clean. Now let's face it, you are looking here because of Disneyland, right? Very close and easy drive in and out of the Parks. Great place to hit the pool or hot tub after a long day on your feet. Staff was also very helpful!
Manager Response: Hello Allan C,  Thank you for taking a moment and sharing your experience with everyone here on TripAdvisor! Iâ€™m happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us and were able to make use of our pool and fitness room to relax and rejuvenate during your trip to Disneyland. Aside from driving in to the park, you can also ride the ART shuttle for a nominal fee daily, or even walk to the park through Downtown Disney (less than 1 mile to the gates)! Thank you again for sharing, we hope to have you back again next time youâ€™re in Anaheim.  Sincerely, Darrell Buettner General Manager

Summary: We were booked into this hotel a few months before our arrival. Turns out there were construction delays, and this brand new hotel would not be ready to open for our dates. The general manager called me personally and booked us into a much more expensive hotel for the same price we expected to pay at the SpringHill Suites. With such excellent customer service, I'm sure this hotel will be a terrific place to stay next time.
Manager Response: Hello iOwahawkeyes,  Thank you for taking time the time to review my hotel. Once again Iâ€™m terribly sorry that we were unable to have you stay with us last month, I appreciate your patience and understanding as we worked through the delays with construction. Iâ€™m happy to say that weâ€™re now officially open as of last weekend and we have a hotel weâ€™re very proud of! I hope that you enjoyed your trip to Anaheim and that youâ€™ll keep us in mind next time youâ€™re in the area!

Summary Heading: Great Place at a great value
Summary: A wonderful experience for the family will start at this hotel. located close to Disneyland and transportation.  Surrounded by a host of great restaurants.  However, the beauty of it all.  The hotel has a wonderful hotel inside so if you can't always go out you can either eat in or bring it back to your spacious room.  There's a pool and basketball courts on the grounds.
Manager Response: Hello Greenjjeanpa,  Thank you for taking the time to review my hotel. I apologize for such a delayed response, but I wasnâ€™t expecting any reviews back in November as we just opened for guests last week. Although I would love to claim credit for your great stay, Iâ€™m afraid you may have posted this review in error to our hotel. I hope you get the chance to see this response so you can repost to the hotel you stayed at last November, it sounds like you really enjoyed your stay with them! Please keep us in mind next time your travels bring you back to Anaheim, weâ€™d love to have you as our guest (although we donâ€™t have basketball courts).
